This purchase includes approximately 10 million domains hosted on Google Domains","author":"Benzinga Newsdesk","created_at":"2023-06-15T20:06:47Z","updated_at":"2023-06-15T20:06:48Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/m-a/23/06/32882894/squarespace-enters-definitive-agreement-to-buy-google-domains-assets-terms-not-disclosed","content":"<p>Squarespace will acquire the assets associated with the Google Domains business, which will be winding down following a transition period. This purchase includes approximately 10 million domains hosted on Google Domains spread across millions of customers.The transaction is expected to close in the&nbsp;third quarter&nbsp;of 2023.While the majority of the benefits of this deal will be realized in 2024 and beyond,&nbsp;Squarespace believes this deal will be meaningfully accretive to its business from both a revenue and free cash flow perspective over time.</p>","symbols":["GOOGL","SQSP"],"source":"benzinga"}]

[{"T":"n","id":32888648,"headline":"Tesla\u0026#39;s Giga Berlin Shifts Gears: Cuts Temp Workers But Keeps Production Goals Intact","summary":" ","author":"Anan Ashraf","created_at":"2023-06-16T08:34:59Z","updated_at":"2023-06-16T08:35:00Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32888648/teslas-giga-berlin-shifts-gears-cuts-temp-workers-but-keeps-production-goals-intact","content":"\u003cp\u003eEV giant\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eTesla Inc\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/TSLA#NASDAQ\"\u003eTSLA\u003c/a\u003e) is reportedly scaling back on hiring temporary workers at its Gigafactory in Brandenburg, Berlin.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat Happened\u003c/strong\u003e: According to the German publication \u003ca href=\"https://www.rbb24.de/studiofrankfurt/wirtschaft/tesla/2023/06/tesla-e-autos-leiharbeit-gruenheide.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003eRBB24\u003c/a\u003e, Tesla will be hiring fewer temporary workers and reducing shifts compared to the initial ramp-up phase. However, the company assured that it remains committed to its production targets. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eTesla stated that while temporary workers will still be required, the company\u0026#8217;s need will be lower than during the initial ramp-up period, as the Gigafactory continues to scale up successfully, as reported by DPA. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIn addition, Tesla will be cutting extra shifts on Saturdays in the second quarter and reducing the regular three shifts at the factory to two and a half, as\u0026nbsp;\u003ca target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.businessinsider.de/wirtschaft/gekuerzte-schichten-weniger-mitarbeiter-krise-bei-tesla-gruenheide/\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003ereported\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;by Business Insider.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhy It Matters:\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;Tesla added\u0026nbsp;\u003ca target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/04/31653403/tesla-looking-at-a-fourth-production-shift-for-giga-berlin-report\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003ea third shift\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;at the Gigafactory in April, with plans to potentially introduce a fourth shift to boost production.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIn March, the company \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/03/31392785/teslas-giga-berlin-reportedly-seeks-to-double-yearly-ev-output-to-1m-cars\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003eapplied to expand production\u003c/a\u003e at the Gigafactory to one million vehicles per year from the current 500,000 per year. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eHowever, Tesla has not yet reached the half-million mark at the plant. Therefore, for the first stage of expansion, the target is to reach 500,000 units per year, equivalent to approximately 10,000 cars per week, according to RBB24.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe Gigafactory achieved a weekly\u0026nbsp;\u003ca target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/03/31503637/teslas-giga-berlin-hits-weekly-production-rate-of-5-000-vehicles-since-delivering-first-vehicles-to\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003eproduction capacity of 5,000 vehicles\u003c/a\u003e, one year after delivering its first vehicles to customers in late March.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eCheck out more of Benzinga's Future Of Mobility coverage by\u0026nbsp;\u003c/em\u003e\u003ca target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/topic/mobility\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003e\u003cem\u003efollowing this link\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eRead More:\u0026nbsp;\u003c/em\u003e\u003ca target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/23/06/32887087/elon-musk-greeted-by-italys-prime-minister-deputy-heads-off-to-france-next-to-meet-macron\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eElon Musk Greeted By Italy\u0026#8217;s Prime Minister, Deputy — Heads Off To France Next To Meet Macron\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["TSLA"],"source":"benzinga"}]

[{"T":"n","id":32889236,"headline":"The Words Apple Never Utters During An Event: MKBHD Breaks It Down","summary":"Tech YouTuber MKBHD reveals the words Apple deliberately avoids using during presentations, including \u0026#34;Artificial Intelligence\u0026#34; and \u0026#34;Virtual Reality,\u0026#34; as part of their control and narrative-shaping strategy.","author":"Ananya Gairola","created_at":"2023-06-16T10:10:32Z","updated_at":"2023-06-16T10:10:32Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/23/06/32889236/the-words-apple-never-utters-during-an-event-mkbhd-breaks-it-down","content":"\u003cp\u003eTech YouTuber \u003cstrong\u003eMarques Brownlee\u003c/strong\u003e AKA \u003cstrong\u003eMKBHD\u003c/strong\u003e, has shed some light on \u003cstrong\u003eApple Inc.'s\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/AAPL#NASDAQ\"\u003eAAPL\u003c/a\u003e) unique approach to presentations, highlighting the words that the tech giant deliberately avoids using — especially when on stage\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/large-cap/23/06/32723259/watchos-10-unveiled-at-wwdc-2023-apple-reinvents-the-smartwatch-experience\"\u003e, like during the WWDC event\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat Happened:\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;In a YouTube video, MKBHD analyzed Apple\u0026#8217;s presentations over the years and discovered a pattern of words that the company consistently avoids or rarely mentions.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIn the video, Brownlee said that \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/large-cap/23/06/32721949/apple-unveils-ios-17-and-ipados-17-at-wwdc-2023-introduces-new-standby-mode-and-more\"\u003eduring Apple\u0026#8217;s latest event\u003c/a\u003e, the Worldwide Developers Conference, which showcased their new Vision Pro headset, the company representatives not once utter the phrase \u0026#8220;virtual reality\u0026#8221; on stage, despite it being a core feature of the product.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSee Also:\u0026nbsp;\u003c/em\u003e\u003ca target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32869484/whats-apples-next-big-iphone-camera-trick-vision-pro-may-offer-a-clue\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eWhat\u0026#8217;s Apple\u0026#8217;s Next Big iPhone Camera Trick? Vision Pro May Offer A Clue\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eHere are some words that, according to Brownlee, Apple deliberately refrains from speaking on a public forum: \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAI or Artificial Intelligence: \u003c/strong\u003eOne notable word absent from Apple\u0026#8217;s presentations is \u0026#8220;Artificial Intelligence\u0026#8221; or \"AI.\" \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/large-cap/23/05/32324579/google-io-2023-highlights-ai-progress-palm-2-challenges-chatgpt-and-introduces-cutting-edge-ai-pow\"\u003eWhile other companies\u003c/a\u003e, like \u003cstrong\u003eAlphabet Inc. \u003c/strong\u003e(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/GOOG#NASDAQ\"\u003eGOOG\u003c/a\u003e) (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/GOOGL#NASDAQ\"\u003eGOOGL\u003c/a\u003e), openly embrace and discuss AI, Apple prefers to use phrases like \u0026#8220;machine learning\u0026#8221; and \u0026#8220;ML\u0026#8221; to describe their technologies.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eVirtual Reality or VR: \u003c/strong\u003eApple\u0026#8217;s strategic avoidance of the term \u0026#8220;virtual reality\u0026#8221; for their Vision Pro headset is part of a greater narrative-shaping effort. Instead of \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32730028/how-does-apples-vision-pro-compare-with-metas-quest-3\"\u003elabeling it as a VR headset\u003c/a\u003e, Apple positions the device as an augmented reality experience. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eBy using terms like \u0026#8220;environments\u0026#8221; and refraining from explicitly mentioning VR, Apple intends to guide consumer perception, said MKBHD. They aim to differentiate the headset and steer the narrative towards AR, aligning with their broader ambitions in the AR space.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eOther Words: \u003c/strong\u003eDuring presentations, Apple is known for not explicitly mentioning certain technical details. Instead, Apple focuses on subjective attributes and introduces branded terms to describe their features. For example, they refer to a \u0026#8220;Taptic Engine\u0026#8221; instead of a large linear vibration motor and use the word \u0026#8220;ceramic shield\u0026#8221; to describe their supplier\u0026#8217;s latest version of glass. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhy It's Important:\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003eAccording to the YouTuber, Apple\u0026#8217;s omission of certain words is rooted in their desire for control and avoidance of comparison. By refraining from associating new products with commonly used terms, the company mitigates the risk of \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/opinion/23/06/32843214/i-made-them-up-googles-ai-tool-admits-to-falsifying-information-apologizes-to-reporter\"\u003enegative sentiments impacting its reputation\u003c/a\u003e.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWatch the complete video here:\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cfigure class=\"wp-block-embed is-type-video is-provider-youtube wp-block-embed-youtube wp-embed-aspect-16-9 wp-has-aspect-ratio\"\u003e\u003cdiv class=\"wp-block-embed__wrapper\"\u003e\n\u003ciframe loading=\"lazy\" title=\"Apple\u0026#039;s Forbidden Words\" width=\"500\" height=\"281\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/kvN5_GXlg2Y?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share\" allowfullscreen\u003e\u003c/iframe\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\u003c/figure\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eCheck out more of Benzinga\u0026#8217;s Consumer Tech coverage by\u0026nbsp;\u003c/em\u003e\u003ca target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/topic/consumer-tech\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003e\u003cem\u003efollowing this link\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eRead Next:\u0026nbsp;\u003c/em\u003e\u003ca target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32840505/apples-flagship-headphones-are-now-99-off-on-amazon-at-450\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eApple\u0026#8217;s Flagship Headphones Are Now $99 Off On Amazon At $450\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["AAPL","GOOG","GOOGL"],"source":"benzinga"}]
[{"T":"n","id":32889236,"headline":"The Words Apple Never Utters During An Event: MKBHD Breaks It Down","summary":"Tech YouTuber MKBHD reveals the words Apple deliberately avoids using during presentations, including \u0026#34;Artificial Intelligence\u0026#34; and \u0026#34;Virtual Reality,\u0026#34; as part of their control and narrative-shaping strategy.","author":"Ananya Gairola","created_at":"2023-06-16T10:10:25Z","updated_at":"2023-06-16T10:10:46Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/23/06/32889236/the-words-apple-never-utters-during-an-event-mkbhd-breaks-it-down","content":"\u003cp\u003eTech YouTuber \u003cstrong\u003eMarques Brownlee\u003c/strong\u003e AKA \u003cstrong\u003eMKBHD\u003c/strong\u003e, has shed some light on \u003cstrong\u003eApple Inc.'s\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/AAPL#NASDAQ\"\u003eAAPL\u003c/a\u003e) unique approach to presentations, highlighting the words that the tech giant deliberately avoids using — especially when on stage\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/large-cap/23/06/32723259/watchos-10-unveiled-at-wwdc-2023-apple-reinvents-the-smartwatch-experience\"\u003e, like during the WWDC event\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat Happened:\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;In a YouTube video, MKBHD analyzed Apple\u0026#8217;s presentations over the years and discovered a pattern of words that the company consistently avoids or rarely mentions.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIn the video, Brownlee said that \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/large-cap/23/06/32721949/apple-unveils-ios-17-and-ipados-17-at-wwdc-2023-introduces-new-standby-mode-and-more\"\u003eduring Apple\u0026#8217;s latest event\u003c/a\u003e, the Worldwide Developers Conference, which showcased their new Vision Pro headset, the company representatives not once utter the phrase \u0026#8220;virtual reality\u0026#8221; on stage, despite it being a core feature of the product.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSee Also:\u0026nbsp;\u003c/em\u003e\u003ca target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32869484/whats-apples-next-big-iphone-camera-trick-vision-pro-may-offer-a-clue\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eWhat\u0026#8217;s Apple\u0026#8217;s Next Big iPhone Camera Trick? Vision Pro May Offer A Clue\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eHere are some words that, according to Brownlee, Apple deliberately refrains from speaking on a public forum: \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAI or Artificial Intelligence: \u003c/strong\u003eOne notable word absent from Apple\u0026#8217;s presentations is \u0026#8220;Artificial Intelligence\u0026#8221; or \"AI.\" \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/large-cap/23/05/32324579/google-io-2023-highlights-ai-progress-palm-2-challenges-chatgpt-and-introduces-cutting-edge-ai-pow\"\u003eWhile other companies\u003c/a\u003e, like \u003cstrong\u003eAlphabet Inc. \u003c/strong\u003e(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/GOOG#NASDAQ\"\u003eGOOG\u003c/a\u003e) (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/GOOGL#NASDAQ\"\u003eGOOGL\u003c/a\u003e), openly embrace and discuss AI, Apple prefers to use phrases like \u0026#8220;machine learning\u0026#8221; and \u0026#8220;ML\u0026#8221; to describe their technologies.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eVirtual Reality or VR: \u003c/strong\u003eApple\u0026#8217;s strategic avoidance of the term \u0026#8220;virtual reality\u0026#8221; for their Vision Pro headset is part of a greater narrative-shaping effort. Instead of \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32730028/how-does-apples-vision-pro-compare-with-metas-quest-3\"\u003elabeling it as a VR headset\u003c/a\u003e, Apple positions the device as an augmented reality experience. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eBy using terms like \u0026#8220;environments\u0026#8221; and refraining from explicitly mentioning VR, Apple intends to guide consumer perception, said MKBHD. They aim to differentiate the headset and steer the narrative towards AR, aligning with their broader ambitions in the AR space.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eOther Words: \u003c/strong\u003eDuring presentations, Apple is known for not explicitly mentioning certain technical details. Instead, Apple focuses on subjective attributes and introduces branded terms to describe their features. For example, they refer to a \u0026#8220;Taptic Engine\u0026#8221; instead of a large linear vibration motor and use the word \u0026#8220;ceramic shield\u0026#8221; to describe their supplier\u0026#8217;s latest version of glass. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhy It's Important:\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003eAccording to the YouTuber, Apple\u0026#8217;s omission of certain words is rooted in their desire for control and avoidance of comparison. [{"T":"n","id":32888989,"headline":"Facebook, Instagram Flooed With Ads For Ozempic-Style Weight-Loss Drugs: NBC News","summary":" ","author":"Benzinga Newsbot","created_at":"2023-06-16T09:44:05Z","updated_at":"2023-06-16T10:13:59Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32888989/facebook-instagram-flooed-with-ads-for-ozempic-style-weight-loss-drugs-nbc-news","content":"\u003cp\u003eOnline pharmacies, medical spas, and diet clinics are capitalizing on the surge of interest in weight-loss drugs Ozempic and Wegovy, running thousands of ads on social media platforms, \u003cem\u003eNBC News\u003c/em\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/internet/ozempic-weight-loss-drug-ads-instagram-wegovy-semaglutide-rcna88602\"\u003ereports\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSurge in Ads\u003c/strong\u003e: More than 4,000 active ad campaigns in the U.S. mentioning semaglutide, the drugs\u0026#8217; active ingredient, were found on Facebook and Instagram alone. This heavy marketing surpasses even that of Viagra, a long-time favorite of online marketers.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eConsumer Reaction\u003c/strong\u003e: While some consumers find the ads amusing, others express anger and frustration, feeling inundated with ads suggesting they could benefit from the drug. The surge in ads comes amidst increased scrutiny of Instagram over its potential contribution to body image issues and eating disorders among young women.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eRegulation and Enforcement\u003c/strong\u003e: \u003cstrong\u003eMeta\u003c/strong\u003e \u003cstrong\u003eInc. \u003c/strong\u003e(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/META#NASDAQ\"\u003eMETA\u003c/a\u003e), the parent company of Facebook and Instagram, has a policy requiring advertisers to get written permission and provide evidence of an appropriate license before they can promote prescription drugs. However, enforcement of this policy has been inconsistent, with ads often being removed only after they have been reported.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eImpact on Drug Supply\u003c/strong\u003e: The sharp rise in demand for semaglutide drugs has led to a shortage, affecting their availability for their other purpose: helping people with diabetes keep blood sugar levels in check. This high demand has also incentivized pharmacies to make or dispense unauthorized copycat versions of the drugs.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cdiv style=\"padding: 20px\"\u003e\n  \u003cdiv style=\"border: 5px solid teal;padding: 20px;text-align: center;border-radius: 10px;font-family: 'Lato', sans-serif\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv style=\"background-color: #f5f5f5;background-position: center;background-size: cover;justify-content: center\"\u003e\n      \u003cimg decoding=\"async\" src=\"https://s3.amazonaws.com/editorial.benzinga.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/24133132/Screenshot-2023-05-25-at-12.30.54-AM.png\" alt=\"Benzinga Newsbot\" style=\"margin-bottom: 20px;width: 100%\"\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003cp style=\"font-family:sans-serif\"\u003e\n      Hi, I am the \u003cspan style=\"font-weight: bold;text-decoration: none;color: teal;font-size: 1rem\"\u003eBenzinga Newsbot!\u003c/span\u003e \n      I generated the above summary based on the source indicated in the article.\n\n      While I do my best to capture the key points of the original article, please be aware that as an AI language model, I may not always accurately represent the nuances and context of the source material. Now, the first leaked renders of the Z Flip 5 are \u003ca href=\"https://www.mysmartprice.com/gear/samsung-galaxy-z-flip-5-official-press-render-design-revealed-specifications-exclusive/\"\u003eout at\u003c/a\u003e MySmartPrice, giving us a glimpse at the large outer display of the flip phone.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSee Also:\u003c/em\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32831353/samsungs-upcoming-flip-phones-outer-display-might-finally-become-more-functional-with-customized-goo\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eSamsung\u0026#8217;s Upcoming Flip Phone\u0026#8217;s Outer Display Might Finally Become More Functional With Customized Google Apps\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe Galaxy Z Flip 5 will launch alongside the \u003cstrong\u003eGalaxy Z Fold 5\u003c/strong\u003e. It is expected to feature a larger 3.4-inch screen on the outside. This actor then tried to sell information about consumers who had been lured in by these false claims.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eProtecting Trust\u003c/strong\u003e: Google emphasizes that customers trust the company to provide authoritative and reliable results, a trust that is undermined by fake reviews. The Federal Trade Commission cited a survey where consumers reported wasting an average of $125 each year due to inaccurate reviews.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eProactive Measures\u003c/strong\u003e: Google uses a combination of people and technology to monitor for fraudulent content on its products 24/7. In 2022, the company protected more than 185,000 businesses from further abuse after detecting suspicious activity and abuse attempts. It also stopped 20 million attempts to create fake Business Profiles.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCollaboration with Regulators\u003c/strong\u003e: Google is sharing its insights with the FTC and other regulators to tackle fake reviews and other deceptive endorsements globally. [{"T":"n","id":32891091,"headline":"Amazon Satellite Launcher\u0026#39;s Chief Throws Bold Proposals To Tackle Space Debris Threat","summary":" ","author":"Anan Ashraf","created_at":"2023-06-16T12:06:33Z","updated_at":"2023-06-16T12:06:33Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/government/23/06/32891091/amazon-satellite-launchers-chief-throws-bold-proposals-to-tackle-space-debris-threat","content":"\u003cp\u003eThe CEO of\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eUnited Launch Alliance\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;(ULA), a competitor to\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eElon Musk\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026#8216;s\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eSpaceX\u003c/strong\u003e, has outlined his ideas for addressing the issue of space debris as private companies strive to commercialize and make space travel more accessible.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat Happened\u003c/strong\u003e: ULA CEO\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eTory Bruno\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;considers orbital debris to be a pressing matter that needs attention today, rather than tomorrow\u0026#8217;s problem.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIn a blog post, Bruno acknowledged that while the space community was aware of the risks associated with irresponsible behavior in orbit, not much has been done about it.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe number of objects in low Earth orbit has more than doubled since 2019, making the situation even more critical, and Bruno emphasized that giving up on space was not an option.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eBruno proposed assigning financial responsibility for major space spills and extending the legal framework governing activities above sea levels to the space domain. End-of-life satellites and expended stages should either be deorbited to a designated storage orbit or completely ejected from Earth\u0026#8217;s orbit.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eHe suggested that the \u003cstrong\u003eFederal Communications Commission\u003c/strong\u003e (FCC) and \u003cstrong\u003eFederal Aviation Administration\u003c/strong\u003e (FAA) establish a net-neutral debris generation standard, where objects left to decay naturally must acquire orbital debris credits, similar to carbon credits. Companies practicing responsible behavior would be rewarded with these credits. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAmazon.com, Inc\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026#8216;s (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/AMZN#NASDAQ\"\u003eAMZN\u003c/a\u003e) first two satellites to space-\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eKuipersat-1\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;and\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eKuipersat-2\u003c/strong\u003e– are now expected to\u0026nbsp;\u003ca target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/22/10/29246370/amazon-satellites-for-future-kuiper-internet-service-get-new-ride\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003ebe launched on the maiden flight of ULA\u0026#8217;s Vulcan\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;Centaur rocket in summer from Florida.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAdditionally, Bruno recommended that second parties be allowed to salvage existing debris for credits, thus incentivizing companies to develop methods for capturing and removing space debris.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eBruno also emphasized the importance of the United States using its soft power to enforce\u0026nbsp;\u003ca target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/22/05/27012152/russian-rocket-body-shatters-into-16-pieces-in-space-adding-to-orbital-debris\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003ecompliance with international players\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;by making space environmental standards a requirement for doing business with the country.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhy It Matters\u003c/strong\u003e: In March, scientists from\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eNASA\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eJet Propulsion Laboratory\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;and the\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eUniversity of Plymouth\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;called for a\u0026nbsp;\u003ca target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/03/31293555/scientists-push-for-treaty-to-safeguard-earths-orbit-from-harm-caused-by-space-industrys-growth\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003elegally-binding treaty to safeguard\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;Earth\u0026#8217;s orbit from the negative impacts of the space industry\u0026#8217;s rapid growth. They warned that failure to achieve global consensus on effective governance could render parts of Earth\u0026#8217;s orbit unusable.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAccording to estimates, there are already over 100 trillion untracked pieces of old satellites orbiting the planet, highlighting the urgency of the situation.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eCheck out more of Benzinga's Future Of Mobility coverage by\u0026nbsp;\u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://www.benzinga.com/topic/mobility\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003e\u003cem\u003efollowing this link\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eRead More:\u003c/em\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32888648/teslas-giga-berlin-shifts-gears-cuts-temp-workers-but-keeps-production-goals-intact\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eTesla's Giga Berlin Shifts Gears: Cuts Temp Workers But Keeps Production Goals Intact\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["AMZN"],"source":"benzinga"}]

Like other Pixel devices, the Pixel Watch is Google's vision of what an ideal \u003cstrong\u003eWear OS\u003c/strong\u003e-powered smartwatch should be like, and it is now available at a big discount of $80 on \u003cstrong\u003eAmazon.com Inc. (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/AMZN#NASDAQ\"\u003eAMZN\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/strong\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat Happened:\u003c/strong\u003e The Google Pixel Watch is now available for $321 on Amazon, after a discount of $79 over its retail price of $399.99. Amazon has discounted both the LTE as well as Wi-Fi variants.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSee Also: \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32852659/dont-miss-this-apple-watch-series-8-deal-with-a-70-discount-on-amazon\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eDon\u0026#8217;t Miss This Apple Watch Series 8 Deal With A $70 Discount On Amazon\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe Pixel Watch LTE variant is available at $321, and the Wi-Fi variant is on sale at $299.99, after a discount of $50. While the Wi-Fi variant was available at this price earlier, the LTE variant is now at its lowest price.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePixel Watch Features:\u003c/strong\u003e The Pixel Watch features a circular 1.6-inch AMOLED display that can get as bright as 1,000 nits. Google has also added \u003cstrong\u003eFitbit\u003c/strong\u003e support, allowing users to track their workouts and other activity in the Fitbit app.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe smartwatch includes a heart rate monitor, a multipurpose electrical sensor, a SpO2 sensor, an accelerometer, a gyroscope, an altimeter, and a compass. Users can unlock more advanced Fitbit features like Daily Readiness Score, sleep tracking analysis, wellness reports, and more with a $9.99 monthly subscription.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eCheck out more of Benzinga\u0026#8217;s Consumer Tech coverage by \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/topic/consumer-tech\"\u003e\u003cem\u003efollowing this link\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eRead Next:\u003c/em\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32889873/you-can-grab-the-motorola-razr-or-oneplus-nord-n30-5g-for-free-with-this-t-mobile-plan\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eYou Can Grab The Motorola Razr+ Or OnePlus Nord N30 5G For Free With This T-Mobile Plan\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["AMZN","GOOGL"],"source":"benzinga"}]

The CMA has concluded that the deal would not hamper competition in the U.K.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eIt found that iRobot\u0026#39;s market position in the supply of robot vacuum cleaners in the U.K. is modest and already faces several significant rivals.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe acquisition would not harm Amazon\u0026#39;s rival \u0026#39;smart home\u0026#39; platforms as robot vacuum cleaners (and the data they gather) are generally not considered an essential input to the emerging \u0026quot;smart home\u0026quot; market in the U.K.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eWhile Amazon could use its position as a major retailer to harm rival robot vacuum cleaner manufacturers, it would have limited benefits, given the size of the U.K. market for robot vacuum cleaners.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePrice Action:\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;IRBT shares traded higher by 18.90% at $50.02 premarket on the last check Friday.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003ePhoto via Wikimedia Commons\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n ","symbols":["AMZN","IRBT"],"source":"benzinga"}]

New Apple Patent Shows Future iPhones Could Be Scratch Resistant","summary":"Apple has won a patent intended to make future iPhones so scratch resistant you would not have to put them in a case.","author":"Rounak Jain","created_at":"2023-06-16T12:47:21Z","updated_at":"2023-06-16T12:47:22Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32891853/clumsy-hands-new-apple-patent-shows-future-iphones-could-be-scratch-resistant","content":"\u003cp\u003eMost of us end up putting our shiny new smartphones in a case the moment they arrive, even as companies make a lot of effort to help their phones stand apart. Now, to let people enjoy their new \u003cstrong\u003eiPhones\u003c/strong\u003e the way they were designed to, \u003cstrong\u003eApple Inc. (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/AAPL#NASDAQ\"\u003eAAPL\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/strong\u003e has won a patent that should make future iPhones scratch resistant.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat Happened:\u003c/strong\u003e Apple has won a patent intended to make future iPhones so scratch resistant you would not have to put them in a case, \u003ca href=\"https://www.patentlyapple.com/2023/06/apple-wins-a-patent-for-an-abrasion-resistant-back-panel-made-of-glass-or-metal-for-possible-future-iphones-ipads-macbooks-1.html\"\u003ereported\u003c/a\u003e Patently Apple.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSee Also: \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32874907/a-declined-autograph-letter-with-steve-jobs-signature-fetches-its-owner-480-000\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eA Declined Autograph Letter With Steve Jobs\u0026#8217; Signature Fetches Its Owner $480,000\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eMost modern smartphones have a chassis made of metal or glass. These materials are prone to issues of their own – while metal chassis is prone to dents, glass back often cracks when users with clumsy hands eventually drop them. Plastic material is prone to both scratches and dents.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThat leaves companies with one option – using a mix that combines the strengths of multiple materials. Apple's solution is a combination of metal and ceramic.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\"The abrasion-resistant members may be formed from metal or ceramic. The substrate comprises a moldable matrix. The abrasion-resistant members are harder than the moldable matrix,\" Apple said in its patent filing.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eTo illustrate how it might look in practice, Apple's patent includes a diagram that shows a series of \"beads\" in a rectangular pattern. These beads are spaced at 10 to 100 microns from each other, but the distance should largely be imperceptible.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWill this be the cure for clumsy hands destroying iPhones? Time will tell, but it looks like Apple certainly is trying to find a fix.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eCheck out more of Benzinga\u0026#8217;s Consumer Tech coverage by \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/topic/consumer-tech\"\u003e\u003cem\u003efollowing this link\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eRead Next: \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32891176/snag-the-google-pixel-watch-at-a-big-discount-of-80\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eSnag The Google Pixel Watch At A Big Discount Of $80\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["AAPL"],"source":"benzinga"}]

The crux of the issue? Accusations of anti-competitive behavior favoring Google-owned YouTube.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAlleged Google\u0026#39;s Unfair Play\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe conflict ignited following a high-profile live stream by Andrew and Tristan Tate, titled \u0026quot;Emergency Meeting,\u0026quot; broadcasted on Rumble. The brothers, recently released on house arrest, drew an impressive audience of 500,000 live viewers. Despite this, a quick Google search for Tate\u0026#39;s streaming event led users to a YouTube video, rather than the original Rumble broadcast.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eGoogle\u0026#39;s apparent preferential treatment of its own video platform, YouTube, has provoked a backlash from Rumble. The streaming platform has openly accused Google of blatant anticompetitive conduct.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eRumble Strikes Back\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;Google\u0026#39;s anticompetitive behavior through its preferential treatment of YouTube is so obvious, the public is noticing,\u0026quot; Rumble declared in a fiery tweet. The platform revealed it had contacted its attorneys and plans to sue Google, ending the tweet with a defiant \u0026quot;see you in court.\u0026quot;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eThe Battle Ahead\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eRumble\u0026#39;s forthcoming legal action against Google marks a significant move in the digital world, potentially setting a precedent for how tech giants manage their own platforms. The case is likely to draw attention from the industry, regulatory bodies, and consumers alike.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eWith mounting scrutiny over Big Tech\u0026#39;s practices, this lawsuit could serve as a litmus test for the industry, potentially leading to more transparency in the digital space.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eThe Power of Public Opinion\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe public\u0026rsquo;s response to this controversy is worth noting. The fact that Rumble\u0026#39;s accusation was easily observed by users indicates the power of public opinion in today\u0026#39;s digital age. Whether this public awareness will translate into legal success for Rumble remains to be seen.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eAs this legal battle unfolds, it serves as a timely reminder of the broader debate on Big Tech\u0026#39;s influence, accountability, and the urgent need for a fair digital playground.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cblockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\"\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eGoogle\u0026#39;s anticompetitive behavior through its preferential treatment of YouTube is so obvious, the public is noticing.\u003cbr /\u003e\r\n\u003cbr /\u003e\r\nAttorneys have been informed and this is why we\u0026rsquo;re suing Google \u0026mdash; see you in court. \u003ca href=\"https://t.co/TYJs8YQOlU\"\u003ehttps://t.co/TYJs8YQOlU\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u0026mdash; Rumble - \u0026nbsp;$RUM (@rumblevideo) \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/rumblevideo/status/1669414601102901259?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\"\u003eJune 15, 2023\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/blockquote\u003e\r\n\u003cscript async src=\"https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"\u003e\u003c/script\u003e","symbols":["GOOG","GOOGL","RUM"],"source":"benzinga"}]

[{"T":"n","id":32888989,"headline":"Facebook, Instagram Flooded With Ads For Ozempic-Style Weight-Loss Drugs: NBC News","summary":" ","author":"Benzinga Newsbot","created_at":"2023-06-16T09:44:05Z","updated_at":"2023-06-16T13:00:09Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32888989/facebook-instagram-flooed-with-ads-for-ozempic-style-weight-loss-drugs-nbc-news","content":"\u003cp\u003eOnline pharmacies, medical spas, and diet clinics are capitalizing on the surge of interest in weight-loss drugs Ozempic and Wegovy, running thousands of ads on social media platforms, \u003cem\u003eNBC News\u003c/em\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/internet/ozempic-weight-loss-drug-ads-instagram-wegovy-semaglutide-rcna88602\"\u003ereports\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSurge in Ads\u003c/strong\u003e: More than 4,000 active ad campaigns in the U.S. mentioning semaglutide, the drugs\u0026#8217; active ingredient, were found on Facebook and Instagram alone. This heavy marketing surpasses even that of Viagra, a long-time favorite of online marketers.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eConsumer Reaction\u003c/strong\u003e: While some consumers find the ads amusing, others express anger and frustration, feeling inundated with ads suggesting they could benefit from the drug. The surge in ads comes amidst increased scrutiny of Instagram over its potential contribution to body image issues and eating disorders among young women.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eRegulation and Enforcement\u003c/strong\u003e: \u003cstrong\u003eMeta\u003c/strong\u003e \u003cstrong\u003eInc. \u003c/strong\u003e(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/META#NASDAQ\"\u003eMETA\u003c/a\u003e), the parent company of Facebook and Instagram, has a policy requiring advertisers to get written permission and provide evidence of an appropriate license before they can promote prescription drugs. However, enforcement of this policy has been inconsistent, with ads often being removed only after they have been reported.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eImpact on Drug Supply\u003c/strong\u003e: The sharp rise in demand for semaglutide drugs has led to a shortage, affecting their availability for their other purpose: helping people with diabetes keep blood sugar levels in check. This high demand has also incentivized pharmacies to make or dispense unauthorized copycat versions of the drugs.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cdiv style=\"padding: 20px\"\u003e\n  \u003cdiv style=\"border: 5px solid teal;padding: 20px;text-align: center;border-radius: 10px;font-family: 'Lato', sans-serif\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv style=\"background-color: #f5f5f5;background-position: center;background-size: cover;justify-content: center\"\u003e\n      \u003cimg decoding=\"async\" src=\"https://s3.amazonaws.com/editorial.benzinga.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/24133132/Screenshot-2023-05-25-at-12.30.54-AM.png\" alt=\"Benzinga Newsbot\" style=\"margin-bottom: 20px;width: 100%\"\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003cp style=\"font-family:sans-serif\"\u003e\n      Hi, I am the \u003cspan style=\"font-weight: bold;text-decoration: none;color: teal;font-size: 1rem\"\u003eBenzinga Newsbot!\u003c/span\u003e \n      I generated the above summary based on the source indicated in the article.\n\n      While I do my best to capture the key points of the original article, please be aware that as an AI language model, I may not always accurately represent the nuances and context of the source material. [{"T":"n","id":32892475,"headline":"Top Wall Street Analyst Sounds Alarm: Major Market Collapse Could Follow AI-Driven Rally, Echoing 2000 And 2008","summary":" In his latest “The Flow Show” report, Bank of America’s chief investment strategist, Michael Hartnett, continues to express pessimistic views on the stock market. ","author":"Piero Cingari","created_at":"2023-06-16T13:14:22Z","updated_at":"2023-06-16T13:16:20Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/analyst-ratings/analyst-color/23/06/32892475/top-wall-street-analyst-sounds-alarm-major-market-collapse-could-follow-big-rally-e","content":" \u003cp\u003eIn his latest \u0026#8220;The Flow Show\u0026#8221; report, Bank of America\u0026#8217;s chief investment strategist, \u003cstrong\u003eMichael Hartnett\u003c/strong\u003e, continues to express pessimistic \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/topic/michael-hartnett\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003eviews on the stock market.\u003c/a\u003e \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eContrary to the prevailing bullish sentiment, Hartnett believes that this is not a new \u0026#8216;shiny bull market\u0026#8217;, and that a big rally might be the precursor to a big collapse akin to a combination of the dot-com bubble in 2000 and the financial crisis in 2008.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eHartnett has been quite pessimistic on the market so far this year, arguing that investors should be cautious in light of persistently strong inflation and the possibility of future interest rate hikes. But the market has proven him wrong so far, with the \u003cstrong\u003eS\u0026amp;P 500 index\u003c/strong\u003e up 15% and the \u003cstrong\u003eNasdaq 100 index\u003c/strong\u003e up 37.6%  this year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eAlso Read: \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32880349/nancy-pelosi-sold-early-but-this-congressman-waited-until-nvidia-hit-1-trillion-market-cap-to-sell\"\u003eNancy Pelosi Sold Early, But This Congressman Waited Until Nvidia Hit $1 Trillion Market Cap To Sell\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\"\u003eAI Led The Rally, But Now The Upside Is Contained\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe analyst attributes the current rally to factors such as the absence of a recession, no credit crunch, and the booming growth of \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/topic/artificial-intelligence\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003eartificial intelligence (AI)\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eHartnett points out that only the ‘Magnificent 7' stocks – \u003cstrong\u003eApple Inc.\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/MSFT#NASDAQ\"\u003eMSFT\u003c/a\u003e), \u003cstrong\u003eAlphabet Inc.\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/GOOG#NASDAQ\"\u003eGOOG\u003c/a\u003e) (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/GOOGL#NASDAQ\"\u003eGOOGL\u003c/a\u003e), \u003cstrong\u003eAmazon Inc.\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/AMZN#NASDAQ\"\u003eAMZN\u003c/a\u003e), \u003cstrong\u003eMeta Platforms Inc.\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/META#NASDAQ\"\u003eMETA\u003c/a\u003e), \u003cstrong\u003eNVIDIA Corp. \u003c/strong\u003e(NASDAQ:\u003ca evaporated.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe expert claimed that AI was an \u0026#8220;unexpected event in the first half of 2023,\u0026#8221; and that the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank (then the internet).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eHartnett cautions that the S\u0026amp;P 500 may only see a limited upside of 100-150 points from its current levels, while the potential Analysts usually derive their information from company conference calls and meetings, financial statements, and conversations with important insiders to reach their decisions.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eSome analysts publish their predictions for metrics such as growth estimates, earnings, and revenue to provide additional guidance with their ratings. Quadruple Witching refers to the simultaneous expiration of stock index futures, stock index options, stock options, and single stock futures on the third Friday of March, June, September, and December. These dates, particularly the last trading hour, often see increased market activity and volatility as traders adjust their expiring positions. Despite the potential turbulence, some investors seize the opportunity to profit from the heightened activity.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eAt present, SPY maintains its support above the critical level of 441.06. [{"T":"n","id":32894175,"headline":"Adobe Proves Its Determination To Lead The New Era Of Generative AI","summary":"Digital media and marketing software titan, Adobe Inc (NASDAQ: ADBE), reported its fiscal second quarter earnings on Tuesday, easily exceeding Wall Street’s expectations, along with giving a mixed guidance for the undergoing quarter.","author":"Upwallstreet","created_at":"2023-06-16T14:44:08Z","updated_at":"2023-06-16T14:44:09Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/23/06/32894175/adobe-proves-its-determination-to-lead-the-new-era-of-generative-ai","content":"\u003cp\u003eDigital media and marketing software titan, Adobe Inc (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/ADBE#NASDAQ\"\u003eADBE\u003c/a\u003e), reported its fiscal second quarter earnings on Tuesday, easily exceeding Wall Street\u0026rsquo;s expectations, along with giving a mixed guidance for the undergoing quarter. Adobe is on the list of companies who are going all in when it comes to AI, but when compared to other tech titans such as Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/MSFT#NASDAQ\"\u003eMSFT\u003c/a\u003e), Adobe even has an advantage\u0026hellip;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFiscal Second Quarter Highlights\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eDuring the quarter that ended on June 2nd, Adobe made\u0026nbsp;$3.91\u0026nbsp;in adjusted earnings per share,\u0026nbsp;topping FactSet\u0026rsquo;s estimates of\u0026nbsp;$3.79\u0026nbsp;a share as they jumped 17% as net income amounted to $1.30 billion and non-GAAP net income came at $1.79 billion. Revenue expanded 10% YoY to\u0026nbsp;$4.77 billion, achieving a Q2\u0026nbsp;record\u0026nbsp;owed to strong demand for its\u0026nbsp;Creative Cloud, Document Cloud and Experience Cloud\u0026nbsp;offerings.\u0026nbsp;Chief Executive Shantanu Narayen\u0026nbsp;stated that\u0026nbsp;groundbreaking innovation,\u0026nbsp;rich data sets, foundation models and ubiquitous product interfaces position\u0026nbsp;the\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp;San Jose, California-based company\u0026nbsp;to\u0026nbsp;lead the new era of generative AI.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003eGuidance\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eFor the undergoing, fiscal third, quarter, Adobe guided for\u0026nbsp;adjusted earnings of $3.98 a share\u0026nbsp;and revenue\u0026nbsp;of $4.85 billion.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003eAI\u0026nbsp;\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eLast\u0026nbsp;week, Adobe\u0026nbsp;introduced Sensei GenAI.\u0026nbsp;This\u0026nbsp;generative AI tool\u0026nbsp;is\u0026nbsp;available\u0026nbsp;to enterprises\u0026nbsp;across Adobe Experience Cloud applications. By\u0026nbsp;launching\u0026nbsp;a generative AI platform for the Creative Cloud,\u0026nbsp;Firefly,\u0026nbsp;Adobe\u0026rsquo;s users are able\u0026nbsp;to create images, videos, and digital models\u0026nbsp;by using\u0026nbsp;text-based prompts\u0026nbsp;which is as simple as this process can get.\u0026nbsp;Although it already dominates the market for digital media editing software,\u0026nbsp;Firefly could represent a massive upgrade.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003eAdobe Vs Microsoft On The AI front\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eBesides both being considered as blue chips in tech, what Adobe and Microsoft have in common is that they both underwent massive cloud transformation and they are both well positioned as the generative AI market continues to grow.\u0026nbsp;Although generative AI efforts aren\u0026#39;t meaningfully boosting\u0026nbsp;their\u0026nbsp;revenues yet,\u0026nbsp;their long-term potential on this front is attracting significant attention.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eBut the key difference between the two is the competition they face. With ChatGPT upgrade for Bing, Microsoft arguably gained less because Bing is still a far cry from leading the search market that is absolutely dominated by Alphabet\u0026#39;s Google, who launched its generative AI response to Microsoft, Bard. When it comes to Azure, Microsoft is facing the same dilemma because Amazon.com Inc (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/AMZN#NASDAQ\"\u003eAMZN\u003c/a\u003e) has a much bigger representative on this front, Amazon Web Services. Amazon also launched its own platform that allows building and scaling generative AI services, Bedrock. Therefore, AI advancements are merely helping Microsoft keep up with Google and Amazon.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;But Adobe doesn\u0026rsquo;t have any worth opponents when it comes to its Creative Cloud and Firefly offerings. When it comes to AI, Adobe is doing an extraordinary job it was already doing with its initial services that are unique to the market. Unlike its rivals, Adobe is using AI to further differentiate itself by using this technology to upgrade its data, scale, talent and portfolio.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eDISCLAIMER: This content is for informational purposes only. It is not intended as investing advice.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n ","symbols":["ADBE","AMZN","MSFT"],"source":"benzinga"}]
[{"T":"n","id":32894175,"headline":"Adobe Proves Its Determination To Lead The New Era Of Generative AI","summary":"Digital media and marketing software titan, Adobe Inc (NASDAQ: ADBE), reported its fiscal second quarter earnings on Tuesday, easily exceeding Wall Street’s expectations, along with giving a mixed guidance for the undergoing quarter.","author":"Upwallstreet","created_at":"2023-06-16T14:44:08Z","updated_at":"2023-06-16T14:51:07Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/23/06/32894175/adobe-proves-its-determination-to-lead-the-new-era-of-generative-ai","content":"\u003cp\u003eDigital media and marketing software titan, Adobe Inc (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/ADBE#NASDAQ\"\u003eADBE\u003c/a\u003e), reported its fiscal second quarter earnings on Tuesday, easily exceeding Wall Street\u0026rsquo;s expectations, along with giving a mixed guidance for the undergoing quarter. Adobe is on the list of companies who are going all in when it comes to AI, but when compared to other tech titans such as Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/MSFT#NASDAQ\"\u003eMSFT\u003c/a\u003e), Adobe even has an advantage\u0026hellip;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFiscal Second Quarter Highlights\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eDuring the quarter that ended on June 2nd, Adobe made\u0026nbsp;$3.91\u0026nbsp;in adjusted earnings per share,\u0026nbsp;topping FactSet\u0026rsquo;s estimates of\u0026nbsp;$3.79\u0026nbsp;a share as they jumped 17% as net income amounted to $1.30 billion and non-GAAP net income came at $1.79 billion. Revenue expanded 10% YoY to\u0026nbsp;$4.77 billion, achieving a Q2\u0026nbsp;record\u0026nbsp;owed to strong demand for its\u0026nbsp;Creative Cloud, Document Cloud and Experience Cloud\u0026nbsp;offerings.\u0026nbsp;Chief Executive Shantanu Narayen\u0026nbsp;stated that\u0026nbsp;groundbreaking innovation,\u0026nbsp;rich data sets, foundation models and ubiquitous product interfaces position\u0026nbsp;the\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp;San Jose, California-based company\u0026nbsp;to\u0026nbsp;lead the new era of generative AI.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003eGuidance\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eFor the undergoing, fiscal third, quarter, Adobe guided for\u0026nbsp;adjusted earnings of $3.98 a share\u0026nbsp;and revenue\u0026nbsp;of $4.85 billion.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003eAI\u0026nbsp;\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eLast\u0026nbsp;week, Adobe\u0026nbsp;introduced Sensei GenAI.\u0026nbsp;This\u0026nbsp;generative AI tool\u0026nbsp;is\u0026nbsp;available\u0026nbsp;to enterprises\u0026nbsp;across Adobe Experience Cloud applications. By\u0026nbsp;launching\u0026nbsp;a generative AI platform for the Creative Cloud,\u0026nbsp;Firefly,\u0026nbsp;Adobe\u0026rsquo;s users are able\u0026nbsp;to create images, videos, and digital models\u0026nbsp;by using\u0026nbsp;text-based prompts\u0026nbsp;which is as simple as this process can get.\u0026nbsp;Although it already dominates the market for digital media editing software,\u0026nbsp;Firefly could represent a massive upgrade.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003eAdobe Vs Microsoft On The AI front\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eBesides both being considered as blue chips in tech, what Adobe and Microsoft have in common is that they both underwent massive cloud transformation and they are both well positioned as the generative AI market continues to grow.\u0026nbsp;Although generative AI efforts aren\u0026#39;t meaningfully boosting\u0026nbsp;their\u0026nbsp;revenues yet,\u0026nbsp;their long-term potential on this front is attracting significant attention.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eBut the key difference between the two is the competition they face. With ChatGPT upgrade for Bing, Microsoft arguably gained less because Bing is still a far cry from leading the search market that is absolutely dominated by Alphabet\u0026#39;s Google, who launched its generative AI response to Microsoft, Bard. When it comes to Azure, Microsoft is facing the same dilemma because Amazon.com Inc (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/AMZN#NASDAQ\"\u003eAMZN\u003c/a\u003e) has a much bigger representative on this front, Amazon Web Services. Amazon also launched its own platform that allows building and scaling generative AI services, Bedrock. Therefore, AI advancements are merely helping Microsoft keep up with Google and Amazon.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;But Adobe doesn\u0026rsquo;t have any worth opponents when it comes to its Creative Cloud and Firefly offerings. When it comes to AI, Adobe is doing an extraordinary job it was already doing with its initial services that are unique to the market. Unlike its rivals, Adobe is using AI to further differentiate itself by using this technology to upgrade its data, scale, talent and portfolio.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eDISCLAIMER: This content is for informational purposes only. [{"T":"n","id":32895135,"headline":"Morgan Stanley Crowns Nvidia As Top AI Stock Pick, Warns Of Potential Market Headwind Amid AI-Driven Rally","summary":" ","author":"AJ Fabino","created_at":"2023-06-16T15:15:52Z","updated_at":"2023-06-16T15:15:53Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/analyst-ratings/analyst-color/23/06/32895135/morgan-stanley-crowns-nvidia-as-top-ai-stock-pick-warns-of-potential-market-headwin","content":"\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMorgan Stanley\u003c/strong\u003e revised its ranking of AI stocks on Friday, telling investors in a note that it is positioning \u003cstrong\u003eNvidia Corporation\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/NVDA#NASDAQ\"\u003eNVDA\u003c/a\u003e) as its new top pick, as the firm sees the Santa Clara, California-based tech giant\u0026#8217;s potential for near-term \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/topic/artificial-intelligence\"\u003egrowth in the AI sector\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAlthough \u003cstrong\u003eAdvanced Micro Devices, Inc\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/AMD#NASDAQ\"\u003eAMD\u003c/a\u003e) was Morgan Stanley's previous top choice, analyst \u003cstrong\u003eJoseph Moore\u003c/strong\u003e maintained a bullish outlook on the company\u0026#8217;s AI opportunity, foreseeing 2024 as the year for AMD\u0026#8217;s significant impact.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eThe AI Analyst: \u003c/strong\u003eMoore upgraded the price targets on the following stocks.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eNvidia Corp\u003c/strong\u003e: From $450 to $500.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAMD\u003c/strong\u003e: From $97 to $138.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMarvell Technology Inc\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/MRVL#NASDAQ\"\u003eMRVL\u003c/a\u003e): From $55 to $68.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eIntel Corporation\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/INTC#NASDAQ\"\u003eINTC\u003c/a\u003e): From $31 to $38.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eMoore's decision to favor Nvidia over AMD is attributed to Nvidia's ability to consistently \"beat and raise\" its earnings per share, making it more attractive for near-term gains.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eNvidia's favorability upgrade is buoyed by the company's AI training demand, which continues to grow, attracting new major customers not previously contemplated.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe Morgan Stanley analyst also highlighted increasing investor interest in other AI plays beyond Nvidia, which, in turn, could potentially cannibalize non-AI legacy compute business within the semiconductor industry.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWith that in mind, Moore mentioned the net impact of AI growth remains unclear across the board, with the exception of one \u0026#8220;2023 leader from the standpoint of numbers going up — Nvidia.\u0026#8221;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe investment bank originally selected AMD as the top pick for 2023 due to expectations of server market share gains driving the group\u0026#8217;s outperformance amidst a challenging macro environment and inventory corrections in the consumer end market.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eMoore noted the rapid shift in spending away from traditional server infrastructure towards AI resulted in AMD\u0026#8217;s potential not yet being fully realized.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe AI spending surge by the largest server market spenders — the cloud providers — poses a serious threat to non-AI hardware this year, Morgan Stanley said, citing the lack of flexibility around fixed capital investment growth, combined with the fast pace at which AI applications have become a basic requirement in many industries.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWith potential macro challenges in mind, Moore still sees a significant upside in the AI-linked revenue for companies within his coverage. In particular, Moore said Nvidia should trade at a premium given the higher probability of upward revisions in the near term.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cem\u003eRead Next: \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/analyst-ratings/analyst-color/23/06/32892475/top-wall-street-analyst-sounds-alarm-major-market-collapse-could-follow-big-rally-e\"\u003eTop Wall Street Analyst Sounds Alarm: Major Market Collapse Could Follow AI-Driven Rally, Echoing 2000 And 2008\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["AMD","INTC","MRVL","NVDA"],"source":"benzinga"}]

$138.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMarvell Technology Inc\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/MRVL#NASDAQ\"\u003eMRVL\u003c/a\u003e): From $55 to $68.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eIntel Corporation\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/INTC#NASDAQ\"\u003eINTC\u003c/a\u003e): From $31 to $38.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eMoore's decision to favor Nvidia over AMD is attributed to Nvidia's ability to consistently \"beat and raise\" its earnings per share, making it more attractive for near-term gains.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eNvidia's favorability upgrade is buoyed by the company's AI training demand, which continues to grow, attracting new major customers not previously contemplated.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe Morgan Stanley analyst also highlighted increasing investor interest in other AI plays beyond Nvidia, which, in turn, could potentially cannibalize non-AI legacy compute business within the semiconductor industry.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWith that in mind, Moore mentioned the net impact of AI growth remains unclear across the board, with the exception of one \u0026#8220;2023 leader from the standpoint of numbers going up — Nvidia.\u0026#8221;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe investment bank originally selected AMD as the top pick for 2023 due to expectations of server market share gains driving the group\u0026#8217;s outperformance amidst a challenging macro environment and inventory corrections in the consumer end market.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eMoore noted the rapid shift in spending away from traditional server infrastructure towards AI resulted in AMD\u0026#8217;s potential not yet being fully realized.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe AI spending surge by the largest server market spenders — the cloud providers — poses a serious threat to non-AI hardware this year, Morgan Stanley said, citing the lack of flexibility around fixed capital investment growth, combined with the fast pace at which AI applications have become a basic requirement in many industries.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWith potential macro challenges in mind, Moore still sees a significant upside in the AI-linked revenue for companies within his coverage. In particular, Moore said Nvidia should trade at a premium given the higher probability of upward revisions in the near term.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cem\u003eRead Next: \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/analyst-ratings/analyst-color/23/06/32892475/top-wall-street-analyst-sounds-alarm-major-market-collapse-could-follow-big-rally-e\"\u003eTop Wall Street Analyst Sounds Alarm: Major Market Collapse Could Follow AI-Driven Rally, Echoing 2000 And 2008\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["AMD","INTC","MRVL","NVDA"],"source":"benzinga"}]
[{"T":"n","id":32896084,"headline":"Meta\u0026#39;s AI Voicebox Aims To Do For Audio What ChatGPT, Dall-E Did For Text, Image Generation","summary":" ","author":"AJ Fabino","created_at":"2023-06-16T15:59:25Z","updated_at":"2023-06-16T15:59:26Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/markets/equities/23/06/32896084/metas-ai-voicebox-aims-to-do-for-audio-what-chatgpt-dall-e-did-for-text-image-generation","content":"\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMeta Platforms Inc\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/META#NASDAQ\"\u003eMETA\u003c/a\u003e) CEO \u003cstrong\u003eMark Zuckerberg\u003c/strong\u003e on Friday introduced Voicebox, a text-to-speech (TTS) \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/topic/artificial-intelligence\"\u003egenerative artificial intelligence speech model\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat Happened:\u003c/strong\u003e Voicebox is an advanced AI model that can produce realistic, contextually accurate speech output from given text and has the potential to complete tasks for which it was not explicitly trained. \u003ca href=\"https://www.yahoo.com/news/metas-voicebox-ai-is-a-dall-e-for-text-to-speech-150021287.html\"\u003eEngadget compared\u003c/a\u003e Voicebox to what OpenAI's ChatGPT did for text output and what Dall-E did for image generation.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eZuckerberg made the announcement via his Meta Channel on Instagram, accompanied by a video showing how Voicebox can convert text into speech in various styles, how it can handle background noise much like an audio eraser and how it can even replace spoken words.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eBuilt on a foundation of \u0026#8220;non-autoregressive flow-matching model trained to infill speech, given audio context and text,\" Engadget noted Voicebox\u0026#8217;s training involved more than 50,000 hours of diverse, unfiltered audio in multiple languages, including English, French, Spanish, German, Polish and Portuguese.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eVoicebox leverages its varied training to deliver conversationally fluid speech in various languages. In tests, speech recognition models trained on synthetic speech generated by Voicebox performed nearly as well as models trained on real speech, the report said, showing a 1% degradation in error rate.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cem\u003eRead also: \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32889872/meta-opens-new-ai-software-for-commercial-use-a-bold-move-set-to-rival-google-and-microsoft\"\u003eMeta Opens New AI Software For Commercial Use, A Bold Move Set to Rival Google and Microsoft\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhy It Matters:\u003c/strong\u003e One of Voicebox\u0026#8217;s defining characteristics is its ability to edit audio clips actively, as it can eliminate noise from speech and replace misspoken words. By identifying a noisy segment in the speech, the user can crop it and instruct the model to regenerate the segment, much like using image-editing software to enhance photos.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eUnlike existing TTS generators, Voicebox doesn\u0026#8217;t require extensive source material to mimic a subject. It\u0026#8217;s the result of Meta\u0026#8217;s zero-shot text-to-speech training method known as Flow Matching.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWhile the potential applications of Voicebox are nearly endless, Meta decided not to release the app or its source code to the public as of now due to potential misuse concerns according to Engadget. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMETA Price Action:\u003c/strong\u003e Shares of Meta are trading 0.92% higher to $284.42 at last check, according to Benzinga Pro.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eRead next: \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/general/entertainment/23/06/32892926/benzingas-stock-whisper-index-5-stocks-investors-are-secretly-monitoring-but-not-talking-ab\"\u003eBenzinga\u0026#8217;s \u0026#8216;Stock Whisper\u0026#8217; Index: 5 Stocks Investors Are Secretly Monitoring But Not Talking About Yet\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003ePhoto via Pixabay. \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["META"],"source":"benzinga"}]

One must act on the contract by this date if one wants to use it.\u003cbr /\u003e\n - \u003cstrong\u003ePremium/Option Price:\u003c/strong\u003e The price of the contract.  \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eFor more information, visit our \u003cem\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://pro.benzinga.com/blog/how-to-understand-option-alerts/\"\u003eGuide to Understanding Options Alerts\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e or read \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/markets/options\"\u003emore news on unusual options activity\u003c/a\u003e.  \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThis article was generated by Benzinga's automated content engine and reviewed by an editor.\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["CCL","EXPE","HD","NKE","RIVN","SBUX","SKX","TSLA","VAC","XPEV"],"source":"benzinga"}]

by his calculations, Amazon added YOY ~$11 billion of GMV in 1Q23 vs. ~$4 billion in 1Q22, ~$13 billion in 4Q22, and ~$43 billion in 2022.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eSo he appears to be on the path to do at least the exact nominal dollar amounts of GMV growth vs. his currently published $35 billion. And the potential for faster GMV growth gets him to revisit the analysis he previously published \u0026ndash; even as he estimates an aggressive growth scenario, early 2024 is likely the year in which Amazon may return to investing more heavily.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe analyst writes that shareholders should be willing to underwrite growth CapEx.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe re-rating reflects continued e-commerce segment operating margin expansion as Amazon grows into its more extensive infrastructure, optionality for faster-than-expected FCF growth vis-\u0026agrave;-vis its advertising segment, the potential for more excellent AWS growth durability as suggested by the ongoing capital intensity in the business, and the rising performance obligations.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePrice Action:\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;AMZN shares traded lower by 0.82% at $126.08 on the last check Friday.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003ePhoto via Wikimedia Commons\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n ","symbols":["AMZN"],"source":"benzinga"}]

He believes a land grab is underway as CSPs turn attention to inference for performance and Total Cost Ownership (TCO) gains.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eHyperscalers continue to drive exponential parameter growth for LLM. Named \u003cstrong\u003eProject Tailwind\u003c/strong\u003e, users in the US can now sign up to gain early access to this \u003cstrong\u003eAI-first notebook\u003c/strong\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat Happened:\u003c/strong\u003e Users in the US can sign up to gain access to Google's AI-first notebook, Project Tailwind, as initially \u003ca href=\"https://9to5google.com/2023/06/16/google-project-tailwind-name/\"\u003espotted\u003c/a\u003e by 9to5Google.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSee Also:\u003c/em\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32872277/wondering-what-is-wrong-with-your-skin-google-lens-can-help-you-find-out-heres-how\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eWondering what is wrong with your skin? Project Tailwind allows users to use AI to synthesize information from multiple sources and deliver an output based on this information.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhy This Could Be Useful:\u003c/strong\u003e From Google's preview and description, Project Tailwind would give everyone access to their own private and personal AI, ensuring their data remains sandboxed within their account.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eFor instance, students could feed their notes, thesis, assignments, and other inputs into Tailwind and get it to generate a summary and conclusion based on this data.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIt could also be a personal tutor, and users could ask it questions based on the inputs provided by them. [{"T":"n","id":32912537,"headline":"Volkswagen\u0026#39;s History Draws Elon Musk\u0026#39;s Amusement, Here\u0026#39;s Why Tesla CEO Laughed","summary":"Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) CEO Elon Musk on Saturday shared a laugh on rival EV maker Volkswagen AG‘s (OTCPK: VWAGY) history.","author":"Anan Ashraf","created_at":"2023-06-19T13:54:10Z","updated_at":"2023-06-19T16:21:34Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32912537/volkswagens-history-draws-elon-musks-amusement-heres-why-tesla-ceo-laughed","content":"\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTesla Inc\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/TSLA#NASDAQ\"\u003eTSLA\u003c/a\u003e) CEO \u003cstrong\u003eElon Musk\u003c/strong\u003e on Saturday shared a laugh on rival EV maker \u003cstrong\u003eVolkswagen AG\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026lsquo;s (OTCPK: VWAGY) history.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat Happened:\u003c/strong\u003e The CEO replied with a laughing emoji to a meme shared by a Twitter user on Volkswagen\u0026rsquo;s awkward history.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cdiv class=\"wp-block-embed__wrapper\"\u003e\r\n\u003cblockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\"\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026#128514;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u0026mdash; Elon Musk (@elonmusk) \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1670179055067451400?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\"\u003eJune 17, 2023\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/blockquote\u003e\r\n\u003cscript async src=\"https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"\u003e\u003c/script\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eVolkswagen was established by Germany\u0026rsquo;s Nazi regime in 1937. The company\u0026rsquo;s history commences with the \u003cstrong\u003eK\u0026auml;fer\u003c/strong\u003e or Beetle, termed by the company itself on its website as a \u0026lsquo;\u003cstrong\u003eNazi prestige project\u003c/strong\u003e.\u0026rsquo;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eHowever, with the outbreak of World War II, mass production at Volkswagen took a back seat, and military vehicles and other armaments were produced using forced labor. Post-war, the British instructed the company to build the Volkswagen Saloon and since then the company has grown to be a major player in the global auto industry.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhy It Matters:\u003c/strong\u003e In the first quarter, Volkswagen, which competes against Musk-led Tesla, \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/earnings/23/05/32206230/volkswagen-reports-strong-q1-results-on-higher-sales-in-europe-and-north-america\"\u003edelivered 2.04 million vehicles globally\u003c/a\u003e, a 7.5% increase year-on-year. Of this, \u003cstrong\u003e6.9 percent,\u003c/strong\u003e or 141,000 were all-electric vehicles.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe company\u0026rsquo;s sales revenue grew by 22 percent to 76 billion euros primarily driven by a recovery in sales volumes in Europe and North America. Sales of passenger cars and light commercial vehicles rose to 4.3 million vehicles in the North American region during the quarter, the company said.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eFor 2023, the company sees vehicle deliveries of 9.5 million.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eCheck out more of Benzinga\u0026rsquo;s Future Of Mobility coverage by\u0026nbsp;\u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://www.benzinga.com/topic/mobility\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\" target=\"_blank\"\u003e\u003cem\u003efollowing this link\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eRead More:\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32908008/tesla-touts-production-of-10-millionth-4680-cell-at-giga-texas\"\u003eTesla Touts Production Of 10 Millionth 4680 Cell At Giga Texas\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003ePhoto: Shutterstock\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n","symbols":["TSLA","VWAGY"],"source":"benzinga"}]
