Significant updates include:\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cul\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eOffering the HPE NonStop Development Environment delivered as an Amazon Machine Image (AMI) and HPE Fraud Risk Management as Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) in AWS Marketplace.\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eMaking support for Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS) Anywhere generally available on HPE GreenLake for Private Cloud Enterprise.\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eExpanding HPE GreenLake for Backup and Recovery to support Amazon Relational Database Services (Amazon RDS) and Amazon EKS Anywhere.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eHPE is broadening its relationship with AWS to deliver a consistent, reliable hybrid cloud experience for customers. These new capabilities build on the full lifecycle of consulting, migration and modernization services for hybrid cloud that HPE delivers today.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eToday, customers want to reduce the complexity of managing their IT estate at the edge, in the public cloud and across hybrid cloud, while controlling costs and ensuring security and compliance. Cloud providers now offer a more seamless cloud experience for customers via a single management control plane and interoperability across platforms and applications, as well as integrated cost management.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;We continue to advance the hybrid cloud market by reducing complexity and simplifying the customer experience. By working with AWS, we can support a customer-centric approach that puts our customers\u0026#39; transformation and business outcomes first,\u0026quot; said Bryan Thompson, vice president of product management, HPE GreenLake cloud services solutions.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eNew services simplify hybrid cloud experience\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eHPE is announcing several new services on HPE GreenLake and AWS Marketplace that provide a consistent, simplified experience for customers to manage data, performance, security and costs. With HPE offerings available via HPE GreenLake and AWS Marketplace, customers have flexibility in how they procure solutions that help advance their edge-to-cloud transformation.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cul\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hpe.com%2Fus%2Fen%2Fhpe-greenlake-private-cloud-enterprise.html\u0026amp;esheet=53422964\u0026amp;newsitemid=20230620908532\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=HPE+GreenLake+for+Private+Cloud+Enterprise\u0026amp;index=2\u0026amp;md5=d78edd2fe2aeab5ada104b74e025864c\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHPE GreenLake for Private Cloud Enterprise\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u0026nbsp;with support for Amazon EKS Anywhere\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;is generally available and offers expanded container deployment options for Kubernetes.\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hpe.com%2Fus%2Fen%2Fhpe-greenlake-backup-recovery.html\u0026amp;esheet=53422964\u0026amp;newsitemid=20230620908532\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=HPE+GreenLake+for+Backup+and+Recovery\u0026amp;index=3\u0026amp;md5=c355c2043ae49e4325d70497bf28e432\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHPE GreenLake for Backup and Recovery\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003enow supports Amazon RDS and Amazon EKS Anywhere, extending the way HPE enables cost-effective, long-term retention and helps customers protect against the business impact of unintended deletion, data loss through an infrastructure outage, or a ransomware attack. HPE GreenLake for Backup and Recovery also supports Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instances and Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volumes.\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHPE NonStop Development Environment\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003eisan integrated development environment for HPE NonStop developers and is designed from the ground up for mission-critical environments that demand continuous business and\u0026nbsp;100%\u0026nbsp;fault tolerance. Delivered as an AMI and available in AWS Marketplace.\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHPE Fraud Risk Management\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003eis a comprehensive fraud management solution that tackles new fraud threats due to 5G technology and Internet of Things (IoT) platforms, as well as many of the most common traditional fraud types relevant for telecommunications service providers. Delivered as a service and available in AWS Marketplace.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThese new services join existing HPE services available on AWS that support edge-to-cloud transformation including cloud application migration, cloud economic analysis, DevOps strategies, networking management and data protection and disaster recovery.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eNews announced onstage during HPE Discover 2023 keynote\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eToday\u0026#39;s expanded relationship with AWS will be announced onstage by HPE CEO Antonio Neri during\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hpe.com%2Fus%2Fen%2Fdiscover.html\u0026amp;esheet=53422964\u0026amp;newsitemid=20230620908532\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=HPE+Discover+2023\u0026amp;index=4\u0026amp;md5=3a80b3e87869ee4bbc37a07d444fe2d6\"\u003eHPE Discover 2023\u003c/a\u003e, the organization\u0026#39;s flagship event, taking place June 20-22 at the Venetian Resort in Las Vegas.\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["AMZN","HPE"],"source":"benzinga"}]

This includes foundation models such as\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://c212.net/c/link/?t=0\u0026amp;l=en\u0026amp;o=3897622-1\u0026amp;h=3401376601\u0026amp;u=https%3A%2F%2Fai.google%2Fdiscover%2Fpalm2%2F\u0026amp;a=PaLM+2\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ePaLM 2\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;and\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://c212.net/c/link/?t=0\u0026amp;l=en\u0026amp;o=3897622-1\u0026amp;h=2973659447\u0026amp;u=https%3A%2F%2Fimagen.research.google%2F\u0026amp;a=Imagen\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eImagen\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;which can be applied to various use cases in the fields of creativity, summarization of knowledge, discoverability, and automation. The models will be integrated into Omnicom\u0026#39;s open operating system, Omni, enabling agency and client teams to accelerate the content development process for marketing campaigns.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eAmong the several foundation models offered within the partnership is Google Cloud\u0026#39;s text-to-image model,\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://c212.net/c/link/?t=0\u0026amp;l=en\u0026amp;o=3897622-1\u0026amp;h=2973659447\u0026amp;u=https%3A%2F%2Fimagen.research.google%2F\u0026amp;a=Imagen\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eImagen\u003c/a\u003e. Launched in May, Imagen allows organizations to generate and customize studio-grade images at scale from input text with low latency and enterprise-grade data governance.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eOnce deployed within Omni, Google Cloud Imagen will enable\u0026nbsp;more than 17,000 trained and certified users to leverage Omni audience intelligence and campaign workflow to create customized images in minutes, define, activate, and measure the impact.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;We\u0026#39;re thrilled to have another first-mover advantage with Google Cloud\u0026#39;s foundation models and to continue strengthening the use of Generative AI within Omnicom,\u0026quot; said\u0026nbsp;Jonathan Nelson, CEO, \u0026nbsp;Omnicom Digital. \u0026quot;By creating Omni as an open operating system, we\u0026#39;re able to quickly integrate these innovative models and mobilize them to thousands of Omnicom employees that use Omni. We\u0026#39;re especially excited to see how Imagen will unlock greater inspiration for our people and elevate the ideas created for clients.\u0026quot;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;At Google Cloud we are committed to bringing the power of our transformational foundation models to people with all levels of technical experience so that everyone has an opportunity to innovate in entirely new ways,\u0026quot; said\u0026nbsp;June Yang, Vice President of Cloud AI and Industry Solutions at Google Cloud. \u0026quot;Our partnership with Omnicom deepens this commitment as it allows marketers to create studio-grade images with mask-free editing for any business need, in a platform where they are already familiar, with only a few typing prompts. We cannot wait to see what they create!\u0026quot;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis partnership is the latest collaboration between Google and Omnicom, who have closely collaborated together for decades. This includes their early collaboration as a alpha partner for\u0026nbsp; clean room integrations with Ads Data Hub.\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["GOOG","GOOGL","OMC"],"source":"benzinga"}]

itemized elaborations have been created using the accompanying table.  \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e•  Regarding \u003cstrong\u003eNVDA\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/NVDA#NASDAQ\"\u003eNVDA\u003c/a\u003e), we observe a \u003cstrong\u003ecall\u003c/strong\u003e option \u003cstrong\u003esweep\u003c/strong\u003e with \u003cstrong\u003ebullish\u003c/strong\u003e sentiment. It expires in 3 day(s) on \u003cstrong\u003eJune 23, 2023\u003c/strong\u003e. Parties traded \u003cstrong\u003e59\u003c/strong\u003e contract(s) at a \u003cstrong\u003e$440.00\u003c/strong\u003e strike. [{"T":"n","id":32932681,"headline":"Discovering The Top Dogs: A Guide To Woofing Up Your Returns With Dogs Of The Dow Investing","summary":"The Dogs of the Dow\n\nWhat is it?\n\n","author":"Dividend Dominator","created_at":"2023-06-20T18:21:55Z","updated_at":"2023-06-20T18:21:55Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/23/06/32932681/discovering-the-top-dogs-a-guide-to-woofing-up-your-returns-with-dogs-of-the-dow-investing","content":"\u003ch3\u003eThe Dogs of the Dow\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003eWhat is it?\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe Dogs of the Dow is an investing strategy that focuses on investing in the top 10 highest dividend-yielding stocks in the Dow Jones 30 index every single year. The Dow Jones Industrial Average Index, also known as The DIJA or just \u0026ldquo;The Dow\u0026rdquo;, is an index of only 30 large companies, weighted by price. The index is the 2nd oldest among US market indices and was created by Mr. Charles Dow, the editor of The Wall Street Journey and co-founder of Dow Jones \u0026amp; Company.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHere are some of the companies included in the Dow Jones.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cul\u003e\r\n\t\u003cli\u003eAmerican Express Co\u0026nbsp;(NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/AXP#NYSE\"\u003eAXP\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\u003cli\u003eApple Inc\u0026nbsp;(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/AAPL#NASDAQ\"\u003eAAPL\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\u003cli\u003eBoeing Co\u0026nbsp;(NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/BA#NYSE\"\u003eBA\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\u003cli\u003eCaterpillar Inc\u0026nbsp;(NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/CAT#NYSE\"\u003eCAT\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\u003cli\u003eMcDonald\u0026rsquo;s,\u0026nbsp;(NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/MCD#NYSE\"\u003eMCD\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\u003cli\u003eJohnson \u0026amp; Johnson (NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/JNJ#NYSE\"\u003eJNJ\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\u003cli\u003eWalt Disney Co.\u0026nbsp;(NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/DIS#NYSE\"\u003eDIS\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eAnd 23 others.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch4\u003eHere\u0026rsquo;s How It Works\u003c/h4\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eCompanies listed on the Dow are determined to be \u0026ldquo;blue-chip stocks\u0026rdquo; meaning they\u0026rsquo;re well-established and financially sound businesses with market caps in the billions. These companies don\u0026rsquo;t alter their dividend policies very often, if at all.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eBecause dividend yield is a function of share price (see the formula below), when a stock\u0026rsquo;s yield is high, it could mean that its share price has fallen but the dividend has remained the same.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F22926592-0427-4363-bba4-c7ae575e1d27_1132x302.png\" rel=\"\" target=\"_blank\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"\" src=\"https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/w_1456,c_limit,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F22926592-0427-4363-bba4-c7ae575e1d27_1132x302.png\" style=\"height:166px; width:624px\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eEssentially the Dogs of the Dow strategy aims to pick stocks with a high yield that are at or near the bottom of their business cycle (or share price), also known as undervalued companies. By consistently cycling through the top 10 stocks by dividend yield every year, the strategy states that the companies near the bottom of the business cycle will see their share price appreciate faster than other companies near the top of their business cycle.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThis strategy works by providing investors with a high dividend yield (bang for your buck) coupled with upside growth potential in the share price. Put those two together and you have a solid wealth-building combination.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F5b5f65ba-e8b6-4b8b-83cb-0fe3e8190bbd_1140x748.png\" rel=\"\" target=\"_blank\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"\" src=\"https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/w_1456,c_limit,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F5b5f65ba-e8b6-4b8b-83cb-0fe3e8190bbd_1140x748.png\" style=\"height:300px; width:457px\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch4\u003eHow To\u0026nbsp;Implement The Strategy\u003c/h4\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eStep 1:\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;At the start of the year, an investor will allocate the capital they have in their portfolio to the top 10 yielding stocks of the Dow. If you have $100,000, then you would allocate $10,000 to each of the 10 stocks.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eIf you want a complete list filtered by dividend yield, click\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.dividend.com/dow-30-dividend-stocks-etfs-and-funds/\"\u003ehere\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eStep 2:\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;At the end of the year, re-evaluate the top 10 yielding stocks in the Dow. You should always re-allocate your funds evenly. For example, if at the end of the year, your portfolio is now worth $110,000 (an increase of 10%) then you would sell off the stocks and reallocate $1,000 to each of the new top 10 stocks.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch4\u003eHere Is The\u0026nbsp;Full List of The Dogs for 2023\u003c/h4\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2Ff5087326-21d4-4154-a052-c5ddcdbf6ccb_1204x950.png\" rel=\"\" target=\"_blank\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"\" src=\"https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/w_1456,c_limit,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2Ff5087326-21d4-4154-a052-c5ddcdbf6ccb_1204x950.png\" style=\"height:492px; width:624px\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch4\u003eHow Did This Strategy Perform In 2022?\u003c/h4\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eAs you can see below, the Dogs of the Dow saw about 50% of the stocks increase in price, with the other 50% decreasing by as much as 46.7% (poor Intel).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eWith that being said, the 2022 Dogs of the Dow\u0026rsquo;s change in price was -1.8% as a whole, but the total return came out to 2.2% (including dividends).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eLet\u0026rsquo;s face it, 2022 was a tough year in the stock market. But the Dogs of the Dow outperformed the S\u0026amp;P 500, which saw a -19.5% change in price in 2022 with a -18.2% total return (including dividends).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2Fa155ab3d-a049-4fb9-95d9-d6871b1bfdaf_1100x408.png\" rel=\"\" target=\"_blank\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"\" src=\"https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/w_1456,c_limit,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2Fa155ab3d-a049-4fb9-95d9-d6871b1bfdaf_1100x408.png\" style=\"height:231px; width:624px\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch4\u003eIf you had invested $10,000 in the Dogs of the Dow from 2008-2018.\u003c/h4\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F14636968-2dda-43d5-93ff-38499a0768a9_1202x1098.png\" rel=\"\" target=\"_blank\"\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"\" src=\"https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/w_1456,c_limit,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F14636968-2dda-43d5-93ff-38499a0768a9_1202x1098.png\" style=\"height:570px; width:624px\" /\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.investopedia.com/terms/d/dogsofthedow.asp\"\u003eSource\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThis is a simple strategy that requires very little maintenance or ongoing research. Just buy at the beginning of the year, hold, collect your dividends and reinvest everything you earn.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe strategy is very much hands-off but requires a bit more tolerance to risk as you are investing in individual companies so high volatility can very much be in effect.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eIf you enjoyed this post, you\u0026#39;re going to love my \u003cstrong\u003eweekly newsletter\u003c/strong\u003e. [{"T":"n","id":32932261,"headline":"What\u0026#39;s Going On With Microsoft Shares","summary":"Microsoft Corp (NASDAQ: MSFT) shares are trading lower by 1.01% to $338.86 Tuesday afternoon. Kennedy Jr.\u003c/strong\u003e, may have taken a surprising turn towards potential corporate partnerships.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat Happened:\u003c/strong\u003e The argument was initially sparked by Rogan\u0026#8217;s invitation to Dr. Hotez to debate with RFK Jr. on the widely-followed podcast. Rogan extended the invitation after Hotez criticized him for providing Kennedy with a platform to disseminate what Hotez described as \u0026#8220;misinformation\u0026#8221; about the COVID-19 vaccine.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eRogan, \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/joerogan/status/1670196590928068609\"\u003ecountering the criticism\u003c/a\u003e, offered to donate $100,000 to a charity of Hotez\u0026#8217;s choice should the scientist agree to participate in the proposed debate — others chimed in with donation offers to make the debate happen, ballooning the total to \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/Jason/status/1670245934259933184\"\u003eat least $260,000\u003c/a\u003e.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cem\u003eRelated: \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/general/biotech/23/06/32907026/joe-rogan-leads-wager-for-debate-between-vaccine-scientist-and-robert-kennedy-jr-elon-musk-and-bi\"\u003eJoe Rogan Leads Wager For Debate Between Vaccine Scientist And Robert Kennedy Jr., Elon Musk And Bill Ackman Chime In\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe offer was met with criticism from various quarters, including Musk, who quickly interjected. The \u003cstrong\u003eTesla Inc\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/TSLA#NASDAQ\"\u003eTSLA\u003c/a\u003e) CEO suggested that Hotez was reluctant to participate in the debate over fears of public scrutiny, tweeting, \u0026#8220;Maybe @PeterHotez just hates charity.\"\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAs the argument continued to escalate, Cuban, a billionaire entrepreneur and owner of the Dallas Mavericks, stepped into the fray. Cuban defended Hotez\u0026#8217;s work and called out both Rogan and Musk for their self-interested motives. According to Cuban, the pair were behaving similarly to the mainstream media (MSM) they often criticize, driven by their interests rather than a commitment to uncovering truth.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eTheir \u0026#8220;platforms have become everything supposedly wrong with MSM. You are driven by self interest. Just like the MSM always has been accused of,\u0026#8221; Cuban tweeted at Rogan in defense of Hotez.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe conversation took a twist when \u003cstrong\u003eDr. Mary Talley Bowden\u003c/strong\u003e, an ear, nose, and throat specialist, \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/MdBreathe/status/1670757048898691074\"\u003equestioned Cuban\u003c/a\u003e about why his company did not carry \u003cstrong\u003eIvermectin\u003c/strong\u003e, a drug that was found to be ineffective, but controversially touted as a treatment for Covid-19. Musk \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1670831341217406977\"\u003eseconded Bowden\u003c/a\u003e, saying, \u0026#8220;good question.\u0026#8221;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eCuban, reflecting his entrepreneurial spirit, then pitched CostPlusDrugs to Musk, suggesting that Musk\u0026#8217;s myriad companies would benefit from CostPlusDrugs\u0026#8217; services, which are aimed at providing safe and affordable medication.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\"You should have your employees use us,\" Cuban \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/mcuban/status/1670887947057627136\"\u003esaid to Musk\u003c/a\u003e. \"It will save them and\u003cbr\u003e@twitter a f\u0026#x2A;\u0026#x2A;\u0026#x2A; ton of money.\"\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eMusk responded positively, saying he would ask Tesla and SpaceX to \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1670940138036420609\"\u003eexplore Cuban\u0026#8217;s proposal\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIn response to Bowden, however, Cuban explained that the pricing for Ivermectin through CostPlusDrugs was higher than other sources, hence its absence from the company\u0026#8217;s offerings.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eRead next: \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32929515/titanic-tourist-sub-missing-the-guinness-record-holding-explorer-onboard-subs-video-game-controller\"\u003eTitanic Tourist Sub Missing: The Guinness Record-Holding Explorer Onboard, Sub\u0026#8217;s Video Game Controller, Link To Blue Origin And More\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003ePhoto: \u003ca href=\"https://www.flickr.com/photos/gageskidmore/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003eGage Skidmore\u003c/a\u003e on flicker\u003c/em\u003e and Shutterstock\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["TSLA"],"source":"benzinga"}]

[{"T":"n","id":32934606,"headline":"Supermicro Offers MicroCloud, A High-Density 3U 8 Node System Utilizing AMD Ryzen Zen 4 7000 Series Processors","summary":"Unique New Multi-Node System Provides Cost Optimized Performance at Scale for eCommerce, Software Development, Cloud Gaming, Content Creation, and Private Server Instances\n\nSAN JOSE, Calif., June 20,","author":"Happy Mohamed","created_at":"2023-06-20T20:11:06Z","updated_at":"2023-06-20T20:11:07Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32934606/supermicro-offers-microcloud-a-high-density-3u-8-node-system-utilizing-amd-ryzen-zen-4-7000-series-p","content":"\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eUnique New Multi-Node System Provides Cost Optimized Performance at Scale for eCommerce, Software Development, Cloud Gaming, Content Creation, and Private Server Instances\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eSAN JOSE, Calif.,\u0026nbsp;June 20, 2023\u0026nbsp;/PRNewswire/ --\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eSupermicro, Inc.\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/SMCI#NASDAQ\"\u003eSMCI\u003c/a\u003e), a Total IT Solution Provider for Cloud, AI/ML, Storage, and 5G/Edge, is introducing a new server that gives IT and data center owners a high performance and scalable solution to meet the needs for E-commerce, cloud gaming, code development, content creation, and virtual private servers. The new systems are designed to use AMD Ryzen\u0026trade; 7000 Series processors optimized for server usage, based on the latest \u0026quot;Zen 4\u0026quot; core architecture, which has a max boost speed of up to 5.7 GHzi, including PCIe 5.0 support, DDR5-5200 MHz, and up to 16 cores (32 threads) per CPU. The new Supermicro MicroCloud is designed to use the latest system technology for a wide range of applications, including web hosting, cloud gaming, and virtual desktop applications.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;We are expanding our application optimized server product lines to include the latest AMD Ryzen 7000 Series processors,\u0026quot; said\u0026nbsp;Michael McNerney, VP of Marketing and Security, Supermicro. \u0026quot;These new servers from Supermicro will give IT administrators a compact and high-performance option in order to offer more services with lower latencies to their internal or external customers. By working closely with AMD to optimize the Ryzen 7000 Series firmware for server usage, we can bring a range of solutions with new technologies with PCIe 5.0, DDR5 memory, and very high clock rates to market faster, which allows organizations to reduce costs and offer advanced solutions to their clients.\u0026quot;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe Supermicro MicroCloud new blade offering, the\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://c212.net/c/link/?t=0\u0026amp;l=en\u0026amp;o=3895732-1\u0026amp;h=1062338693\u0026amp;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.supermicro.com%2Fen%2Fproducts%2Fsystem%2Fmicrocloud%2F3u%2Fas%2520-3015mr-h8tnr\u0026amp;a=AS+-3015MR-H8TNR\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eAS -3015MR-H8TNR\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;server, contains a single optimized AMD Ryzen 7000 Series processor, up to 128GB of DDR5 memory, and a TDP of up to 170W. The Supermicro MicroCloud 3U enclosure contains eight blades, with each blade containing up to two front-accessible NVMe U.2, SAS, or SATA3 drives. The Supermicro MicroCloud shares cooling and redundant power supplies across the eight blades for a more efficient and uninterrupted operation. IT departments can quickly set up dedicated hosting, a multi-instance environment for workloads such as web hosting, cloud gaming, and remote and virtual desktops through easy accessibility of the physical nodes and the rear I/O with a flexible remote management interface, including dedicated IPMI port for the eight nodes.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;AMD works closely with Supermicro to bring innovative products to market that enable customers to reduce costs while increasing performance for a wide range of workloads. The Supermicro MicroCloud offers customers a compact, low latency solution that can meet the demands of many data center operators seeking a successful digital transformation,\u0026quot; said\u0026nbsp;John Morris, Corporate Vice President, Enterprise and HPC Business Group. \u0026quot;The AMD Ryzen 7000 Series processors set a new standard for performance in a compact form factor for cloud and dedicated hosting environments.\u0026quot;\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["AMD","SMCI"],"source":"benzinga"}]
[{"T":"n","id":32935864,"headline":"\u0026#39;Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella And Many Xbox Executives Are Set To Defend Its FTC Case\u0026#39; - The Verge","summary":"https://www.theverge.com/2023/6/20/23767588/microsoft-activision-ftc-case-ceo-satya-nadella-xbox-executives\n\nMicrosoft is sending CEO Satya Nadella, Xbox chief Phil Spencer, and many other Xbox executives to defend","author":"Happy Mohamed","created_at":"2023-06-20T20:42:18Z","updated_at":"2023-06-20T20:42:19Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32935864/microsoft-ceo-satya-nadella-and-many-xbox-executives-are-set-to-defend-its-ftc-case-the-verge","content":"\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2023/6/20/23767588/microsoft-activision-ftc-case-ceo-satya-nadella-xbox-executives\" title=\"https://www.theverge.com/2023/6/20/23767588/microsoft-activision-ftc-case-ceo-satya-nadella-xbox-executives\"\u003ehttps://www.theverge.com/2023/6/20/23767588/microsoft-activision-ftc-case-ceo-satya-nadella-xbox-executives\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eMicrosoft is sending CEO Satya Nadella, Xbox chief Phil Spencer, and many other Xbox executives to defend against its Federal Trade Commission (FTC) case for its proposed Activision Blizzard acquisition.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eBoth Nadella and Activision CEO Bobby Kotick will appear in court this week to defend against a potential preliminary injunction against Microsoft\u0026rsquo;s giant $68.7 billion deal to acquire Activision Blizzard. If the FTC is successful in winning an injunction, then Microsoft has admitted in court filings that the deal could well be over.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe list of Microsoft and Xbox executives also includes Sarah Bond, head of Xbox creator experience, Microsoft CFO Amy Hood, Matt Booty, head of Xbox Game Studios, and Microsoft Gaming CFO Tim Stuart. Lori Wright, who previously\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2021/5/6/22422691/microsoft-xbox-consoles-profit-software-services-revenue-apple-epic-games-trial\"\u003etestified for Microsoft\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;at the\u0026nbsp;\u003cem\u003eEpic Games v. Apple\u0026nbsp;\u003c/em\u003etrial, will also appear. Activision\u0026rsquo;s CFO, Armin Zerza, will also testify.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eSony\u0026rsquo;s PlayStation chief, Jim Ryan, will also testify via video link to discuss market competition. Microsoft was quick to point out that Sony \u0026mdash; a vocal opponent of the merger \u0026mdash; won\u0026rsquo;t appear in person at the courtroom in San Francisco. \u0026ldquo;Unlike Sony, our most senior executives will testify in person to answer any questions about our business strategy. This deal means more choice for gamers, a fact that only becomes clearer the more you look at the case,\u0026rdquo; says David Cuddy, general manager of public affairs at Microsoft, in a statement to\u0026nbsp;\u003cem\u003eThe Verge\u003c/em\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eA lot rests on this hearing for Microsoft after the\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2023/6/12/23758194/ftc-microsoft-activision-blizzard-complaint-block-acquisition-call-of-duty\"\u003eFTC filed to block Microsoft from buying Activision Blizzard last week\u003c/a\u003e. The FTC is seeking an injunction from a US federal district court just weeks before the July 18th deal deadline. If an injunction is granted, then it would block Microsoft from closing its Activision deal until the result of the FTC\u0026rsquo;s original legal challenge that was filed last year. An evidentiary\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.ftc.gov/legal-library/browse/cases-proceedings/2210077-microsoftactivision-blizzard-matter\"\u003ehearing is scheduled\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;for that case on August 2nd, shortly after Microsoft\u0026rsquo;s appeal hearing is scheduled to start in the UK.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eAn injunction could spell the end of this deal for Microsoft, pushing back a potential close date to months down the line, with the Xbox maker forced to renegotiate the terms of the acquisition with Activision or walk away and pay a $3 billion breakup fee. If the FTC\u0026rsquo;s injunction is unsuccessful, then Microsoft is eager to fast-track the FTC case. \u0026ldquo;We welcome the opportunity to present our case in federal court,\u0026rdquo; said Brad Smith, Microsoft vice chair and president, in a statement to\u0026nbsp;\u003cem\u003eThe Verge\u0026nbsp;\u003c/em\u003elast week. \u0026ldquo;We believe accelerating the legal process in the US will ultimately bring more choice and competition to the market.\u0026rdquo;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe FTC case will start with a pre-evidentiary hearing on June 21st, with the full hearing set across five days: June 22nd, 23rd, 27th, 28th, and 29th.\u0026nbsp;\u003cem\u003eThe Verge\u0026nbsp;\u003c/em\u003ewill be following the Microsoft and FTC case closely throughout this week and next, so stay tuned for our coverage.\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["ATVI","MSFT"],"source":"benzinga"}]

[{"T":"n","id":32935115,"headline":"Xbox Stays Clear Of VR: Is the Market Too Small To Gamble On?","summary":"Matt Booty, head of Xbox Game Studios, expressed skepticism about the current viability of the virtual reality (VR) and augmented reality (AR) market.","author":"Franca Quarneti","created_at":"2023-06-20T21:23:01Z","updated_at":"2023-06-20T21:23:02Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/general/gaming/23/06/32935115/xbox-stays-clear-of-vr-is-the-market-too-small-to-gamble-on","content":"\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMatt Booty\u003c/strong\u003e, head of Xbox Game Studios, expressed skepticism about the current viability of the virtual reality (VR) and \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/general/gaming/23/05/32558390/sonys-bold-predictions-ps5-sales-to-outperform-ps4-vr2-exceeds-expectations-aggressive-cloud-gamin\"\u003eaugmented reality (AR) market.\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eWhile many tech companies are eager to establish their own VR headsets, Xbox has shown no interest in venturing into this space.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSee Also:\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32904473/will-you-let-your-10-year-old-play-with-meta-vr-headset-well-mark-zuckerberg-is-allowing-it-now\"\u003eWill You Let Your 10-Year-Old Play With Meta VR Headset? Well, Mark Zuckerberg Is Allowing It Now\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eIn a recent \u003ca href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/business/digital/xbox-game-studios-matt-booty-1235514825/\"\u003einterview\u003c/a\u003e with the Hollywood Reporter, Booty said\u0026nbsp;the lack of a substantial audience is the primary reason behind Xbox\u0026#39;s reluctance to invest in VR technology.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;I think for us, it\u0026rsquo;s just a bit of wait until there\u0026rsquo;s an audience there,\u0026quot; Booty stated. \u0026quot;We\u0026rsquo;re very fortunate that we have got these big IPs that have turned into ongoing franchises with big communities.\u0026quot;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eBooty said that\u003cstrong\u003e \u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMicrosoft Corp \u003c/strong\u003e(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/MSFT#NASDAQ\"\u003eMSFT\u003c/a\u003e), Xbox\u0026#39;s owner, considers games successful only if they attract approximately 10 million players. But he\u0026nbsp;argued that achieving this scale in the VR/AR market is currently unrealistic.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;We have 10 games that have achieved over 10 million players life-to-date, which is a pretty big accomplishment, but that\u0026rsquo;s the kind of scale that we need to see success for the game and it\u0026rsquo;s just, it\u0026rsquo;s not quite there yet with AR, VR.\u0026quot;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eGiven Xbox\u0026#39;s standard for success, it becomes clear that the company is unlikely to venture into the VR market in the near future, despite the popularity of PlayStation\u0026#39;s VR titles, including\u0026nbsp;Horizon: Call of the Mountain\u0026nbsp;and Astro Bot: Rescue Mission,\u0026nbsp;none of them have managed to attract anywhere near 10 million players.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eRecently, \u003cstrong\u003eApple Inc. \u003c/strong\u003e(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/AAPL#NASDAQ\"\u003eAAPL\u003c/a\u003e)\u0026nbsp;unveiled its newest VR/AR headset, the \u003cstrong\u003eApple Vision Pro.\u003c/strong\u003e This device is specifically tailored for gamers and aims to enter the market alongside competing products like \u003cstrong\u003eMeta Platforms, Inc.\u0026#39;\u003c/strong\u003es (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/META#NASDAQ\"\u003eMETA\u003c/a\u003e) Quest headsets,\u003cstrong\u003e Sony Group Corporation\u0026#39;s\u003c/strong\u003e (NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/SONY#NYSE\"\u003eSONY\u003c/a\u003e) PlayStation VR 2, Valve\u0026#39;s Index\u0026nbsp;and various other options.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eRead Next:\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32736149/is-apples-vision-pro-headset-worth-it-top-tech-reviewer-gives-honest-review\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;Is Apple\u0026#39;s Vision Pro Headset Worth It? [{"T":"n","id":32939893,"headline":"Tesla Chargers Required At State-Funded Charging Stations: Texas Mandate","summary":" ","author":"Anan Ashraf","created_at":"2023-06-21T02:57:25Z","updated_at":"2023-06-21T02:57:26Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32939893/tesla-chargers-required-at-state-funded-charging-stations-texas-mandate","content":"\u003cp\u003eThe state of Texas reportedly requires all electric vehicle charging companies to have both\u003cstrong\u003e Tesla Inc\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026#8216;s (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/TSLA#NASDAQ\"\u003eTSLA\u003c/a\u003e) charging standard NACS and rival charging standard CCS to be part of the program to electrify highways using federal dollars. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat Happened:\u003c/strong\u003e Texas, where Tesla headquarters are located, is the first state to mandate its charging standard, reported \u003cstrong\u003eReuters\u003c/strong\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eEarlier in the day, \u003cstrong\u003eRivian Automotive Inc (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/RIVN#NASDAQ\"\u003eRIVN\u003c/a\u003e) said that it \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32923605/tesla-is-driving-rivian-stock-higher-tuesday-whats-going-on\"\u003ewill adopt Tesla\u0026#8217;s North American Charging Standard\u003c/a\u003e across the United States and Canada. Further, South Korean automaker \u003cstrong\u003eHyundai Motor Corp\u003c/strong\u003e said that it would \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32920567/hyundai-mulls-joining-teslas-north-american-charging-standard-alliance-report\"\u003econsider attaining NACS \u003c/a\u003eif it is in the interest of its customers. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe adoption of NACS was kickstarted by \u003cstrong\u003eFord Motor Co\u003c/strong\u003e (NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/F#NYSE\"\u003eF\u003c/a\u003e) when it \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/tech/23/05/32587201/ford-ceo-jim-farley-announces-tesla-supercharger-partnership-with-elon-musk-during-twitter-space\"\u003eannounced a collaboration with Tesla\u003c/a\u003e in late May aimed at increasing customer access to Tesla\u0026#8217;s 12,000 superchargers across U.S. and Canada. General Motors followed up in June and said it too will integrate the charging standard into its EVs starting in  2025. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhy It Matters:\u003c/strong\u003e Several charging equipment makers including \u003cstrong\u003eBlink Charging Co, ChargePoint Holdings Inc\u003c/strong\u003e, \u003cstrong\u003eTritium DCFC Ltd\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003eand \u003cstrong\u003eBTC Power\u003c/strong\u003e have also said that they will add \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32849451/cathie-woods-ark-sees-teslas-collaboration-with-gm-popularize-its-charging-standard\"\u003eNACS connectors\u003c/a\u003e to their network.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32791096/elon-musk-has-last-laugh-on-us-ev-charging-despite-eus-refusal-of-teslas-design\"\u003eAccording to Tesla CEO \u003c/a\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eElon Musk\u003c/strong\u003e, the Tesla design is \u0026#8220;fundamentally better in every way for consumers.\u0026#8221;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eNACS vehicles outnumber CCS two-to-one and Tesla's Supercharging network has 60% more NACS posts than all the CCS-equipped networks combined, Tesla said in a blog in November.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eCheck out more of Benzinga\u0026#8217;s Future Of Mobility coverage by\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/topic/mobility\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003efollowing this link.\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eRead More:\u003c/em\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32919386/hyundai-unveils-85b-investment-plan-to-become-an-ev-powerhouse\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eHyundai Unveils $85B Investment Plan To Become An EV Powerhouse\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["F","RIVN","TSLA"],"source":"benzinga"}]
[{"T":"n","id":32939896,"headline":"Elon Musk Outlines India Investment Plans In Meeting With PM Modi","summary":" ","author":"Benzinga Newsbot","created_at":"2023-06-21T02:57:41Z","updated_at":"2023-06-21T02:57:41Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32939896/elon-musk-outlines-india-investment-plans-in-meeting-with-pm-modi","content":"\u003cp\u003eOn Tuesday, \u003cstrong\u003eElon Musk\u003c/strong\u003e, the CEO of \u003cstrong\u003eTesla Inc\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/TSLA#NASDAQ\"\u003eTSLA\u003c/a\u003e), met with Indian Prime Minister \u003cstrong\u003eNarendra Modi\u003c/strong\u003e during his visit to the U.S.. Musk discussed Tesla\u0026#8217;s investment plans for India, marking a significant step in the electric vehicle (EV) manufacturer\u0026#8217;s entry into the South Asian market.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat Happened:\u003c/strong\u003e Musk and Modi held a meeting in New York, where the Tesla CEO outlined the company\u0026#8217;s investment plans in India, Reuters reports. The meeting comes amidst Tesla\u0026#8217;s ongoing efforts to establish a presence in India, a market with significant growth potential for EVs.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026#8220;I am confident that Tesla will be in India and will do so as soon as humanly possible,\u0026#8221; Musk told media. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026#8220;I would like to thank the prime minister for his support and hopefully we\u0026#8217;ll be able to announce something in the not too distant future,\u0026#8221; he added.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhy It Matters:\u003c/strong\u003e The meeting between Musk and Modi signifies a crucial development in Tesla\u0026#8217;s India strategy. As \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/m-a/23/05/32613349/tesla-revs-up-india-market-entry-elon-musks-next-big-ev-frontier\"\u003eBenzinga reported in May\u003c/a\u003e, Tesla has been revving up its entry into the Indian market, which is seen as the next big frontier for EVs.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eEarlier this month, \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32751946/tesla-sets-up-for-india-entry-plans-for-local-assembly-and-vendor-base-on-the-horizon\"\u003eBenzinga also reported\u003c/a\u003e that Tesla is planning to set up a local assembly unit and vendor base in India. The idea was to provide a free, healthy snack that didn\u0026#8217;t require heavy packaging. An added advantage of bananas is that they don\u0026#8217;t need washing before consumption.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eExpansion of the Banana Stands\u003c/strong\u003e: Amazon opened its first banana stand outside its Seattle headquarters in 2015. Since then, the company has expanded the concept to other locations, including Bellevue, Nashville, and Tokyo. In total, Amazon operates seven banana stands, distributing thousands of bananas each week.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCommunity Impact\u003c/strong\u003e: The banana stands are open to everyone, including non-employees, children, and even dogs. The concept has been well-received, with one patron stating that the free bananas have become their daily breakfast. The idea has even inspired imitators, with business advocates in DC\u0026#8217;s NoMa neighborhood setting up their own banana stand in 2018 to promote the area\u0026#8217;s bid for Amazon\u0026#8217;s second headquarters.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cdiv style=\"padding: 20px\"\u003e\n  \u003cdiv style=\"border: 5px solid teal;text-align: center;border-radius: 10px;font-family: 'Lato', sans-serif\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv style=\"background-color: #f5f5f5;background-position: center;background-size: cover;justify-content: center\"\u003e\n      \u003cimg decoding=\"async\" src=\"https://s3.amazonaws.com/editorial.benzinga.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/24133132/Screenshot-2023-05-25-at-12.30.54-AM.png\" alt=\"Benzinga Newsbot\" style=\"margin-bottom: 20px;width: 100%\"\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003cp style=\"font-family:sans-serif\"\u003e\n      Hi, I am the \u003cspan style=\"font-weight: bold;text-decoration: none;color: teal;font-size: 1rem\"\u003eBenzinga Newsbot!\u003c/span\u003e \n      I generated the above summary based on the source indicated in the article.\n\n      While I do my best to capture the key points of the original article, please be aware that as an AI language model, I may not always accurately represent the nuances and context of the source material. [{"T":"n","id":32941758,"headline":"Tesla Charges Ahead In Europe As May Registrations Surge Over 2000% While Ford Falters","summary":" ","author":"Anan Ashraf","created_at":"2023-06-21T09:32:32Z","updated_at":"2023-06-21T09:32:33Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32941758/tesla-charges-ahead-in-europe-as-may-registrations-surge-over-2000-while-ford-falters","content":"\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTesla Inc\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/TSLA#NASDAQ\"\u003eTSLA\u003c/a\u003e) experienced a remarkable surge in registrations in the\u0026nbsp;\u003ca target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/03/31452119/tesla-sales-outpace-rivals-in-european-market-in-february-are-price-cuts-paying-off\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003eEuropean Union\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;last month, with a staggering 2000% increase compared to May 2022.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat Happened\u003c/strong\u003e: Data from the\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eEuropean Automobile Manufacturers\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026#8216; Association revealed that 21,927 Tesla vehicles were registered in May, a substantial jump from the 957 vehicles registered in the same month last year. The EV giant also saw its market share rise from a mere 0.1% to an impressive 2.3%.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIn contrast, American automaker\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eFord Motor Co\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;(NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/F#NYSE\"\u003eF\u003c/a\u003e) faced a slump in May registrations, witnessing a 4.2% decline. This drop resulted in Ford\u0026#8217;s market share declining from 4.3% to 3.5% compared to the previous year.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe overall car market in the European Union experienced an 18.5% growth, with 938,950 new passenger car registrations. This marks the tenth consecutive month of growth. Gasoline-powered vehicles remained the most popular choice, accounting for 36.5% of new registrations, followed by hybrid electric vehicles with a 25% share. Battery electric vehicles claimed a market share of 13.8% with 129,847 registrations, marking a significant year-over-year increase of 70.9%.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eVolkswagen\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;(OTC:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/VWAGY#OTC\"\u003eVWAGY\u003c/a\u003e) retained its position as the top-selling vehicle brand in the EU, with 243,013 new registrations, representing a 19.5% increase compared to May 2022.\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eStellantis NV\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;(NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/STLA#NYSE\"\u003eSTLA\u003c/a\u003e) closely followed with 170,296 registrations.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhy It Matters\u003c/strong\u003e: The significance of this surge for Tesla lies in its ongoing expansion efforts in Europe. Currently, the company\u0026#8217;s sole European Gigafactory is located in Berlin, Germany. During his recent visit to Europe, Tesla CEO\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eElon Musk\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003ca target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32910907/elon-musk-wraps-up-europe-tour-macron-seeks-collaboration-says-lets-work-together\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003emet with French collaboration and partnerships.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eMoreover, Tesla experienced an astonishing\u0026nbsp;\u003ca target=\"_blank\" increase\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;in new vehicle registrations in the UK last month, further highlighting its growing presence in the European market.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eCheck out more of Benzinga\u0026#8217;s Future Of Mobility coverage by\u0026nbsp;\u003c/em\u003e\u003ca target=\"_blank\" [{"T":"n","id":32942277,"headline":"Apple Bites Into Trademark Battle ... Over The Humble Fruit Itself","summary":" ","author":"Shanthi Rexaline","created_at":"2023-06-21T10:20:58Z","updated_at":"2023-06-21T10:20:58Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/markets/equities/23/06/32942277/apple-bites-into-trademark-battle-over-the-humble-fruit-itself","content":"\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eApple Inc.\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/AAPL#NASDAQ\"\u003eAAPL\u003c/a\u003e) has raised eyebrows by attempting to secure intellectual property rights over depictions of the apple fruit itself. This peculiar move highlights the increasing obsession of\u0026nbsp;\u003ca target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/05/32502498/apples-next-big-surprise-xrproos-trademark-filing-hints-at-exciting-new-innovation\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003ecorporations with intellectual property rights\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;(IPRs) as they strive to gain a competitive edge.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat Happened\u003c/strong\u003e: According to a\u0026nbsp;\u003ca target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wired.co.uk/article/apple-vs-apples-trademark-battle\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003ereport\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;by Wired, the\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eFruit Union Suisse\u003c/strong\u003e, a revered 111-year-old institution in Switzerland, may be forced to relinquish its logo — a red apple adorned with a white cross. Apple\u0026#8217;s intention is not merely to protect its iconic \u0026#8220;bitten apple\u0026#8221; logo, but rather to assert rights over the very depiction of an apple as a fruit.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eJimmy Mariethoz\u003c/strong\u003e, the director of the Fruit Union Suisse, expressed his concerns, stating, \u0026#8220;This is something that is really almost universal\u0026#8230; that should be free for everyone to use.\u0026#8221; The organization firmly believes that the imagery of an apple should be accessible to all, rather than monopolized by a single entity.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSee Also: \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/money/everything-you-need-to-know-about-apple-stock\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003eEverything You Need to Know About Apple Stock\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eBack in 2017, Apple initially applied with the \u003cstrong\u003eSwiss Institute of Intellectual Property\u003c/strong\u003e to secure a trademark for an image of an apple. The submission specifically featured a realistic black-and-white depiction of the Granny Smith variety. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe application covered a wide range of potential uses, encompassing electronic, digital, and audiovisual consumer goods. While the IPR was granted partially, considering that generic images of common goods belong to the public domain, Apple has filed an appeal to expand its claim.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhy It Matters\u003c/strong\u003e: Mariethoz voiced his concerns over the potential consequences, saying, \u0026#8220;We\u0026#8217;re concerned that any visual representation of an apple—whether it\u0026#8217;s audiovisual, linked to new technologies, or media—could be potentially impacted. That would be a very, very significant restriction for us.\u0026#8221;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eHe further said that even simple acts of advertising featuring an apple could now venture into uncertain territory due to this dispute.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eApple\u0026#8217;s ambitious pursuit of intellectual property rights over the depiction of an apple raises questions about the boundaries of ownership and the impact it may have on organizations like the Fruit Union Suisse.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eRead Next: \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32916005/apple-watch-alarm-saves-users-life-detects-life-threatening-blood-clot-during-sleep\"\u003eApple Watch Alarm Saves User\u0026#8217;s Life: Detects Life-Threatening Blood Clot During Sleep\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["AAPL"],"source":"benzinga"}]
[{"T":"n","id":32942479,"headline":"Is Apple Secretly Turning More And More Into An AI Company?","summary":" ","author":"Benzinga Newsbot","created_at":"2023-06-21T10:32:54Z","updated_at":"2023-06-21T10:32:55Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32942479/is-apple-secretly-turning-more-and-more-into-an-ai-company","content":"\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eApple Inc.\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/AAPL#NASDAQ\"\u003eAAPL\u003c/a\u003e) may be doing more in the artificial intelligence (AI) space than its public messaging shows, as seen in some of its latest product upgrade announcements.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe latest manifestation of this transition is an upgrade to its autocorrect feature, announced on Tuesday, which now leverages AI to consider the context of words in a sentence.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat Happened:\u003c/strong\u003e The new autocorrect feature uses sophisticated language models to check words against their context in a sentence, rather than just a dictionary, The Atlantic \u003ca href=\"https://www.theatlantic.com/technology/archive/2023/06/apple-ai-autocorrect-machine-learning-features/674455/?utm_source=flipboard\u0026amp;utm_content=topic%2Ftechnology\"\u003ereports.\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis means it won\u0026#8217;t suggest \u0026#8220;consolation\u0026#8221; when you mean \u0026#8220;consolidation,\u0026#8221; because it\u0026#8217;ll understand that those words aren\u0026#8217;t interchangeable. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eOther AI-powered updates include the Photos app\u0026#8217;s ability to differentiate between your dog and other dogs, and AirPods adjusting to background noise based on your listening over time. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eDespite these AI-driven features, Apple\u0026#8217;s conference unveiling the updates made no mention of AI, instead using more technical language such as machine learning or transformer language model.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhy It Matters:\u003c/strong\u003e Apple\u0026#8217;s incremental approach to AI has been a topic of interest among investors, who are reportedly more intrigued by the company\u0026#8217;s AI-related initiatives than its AR/VR headset. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32712010/apple-investors-less-interested-in-arvr-headset-compared-to-this-says-top-analyst-ahead-of-wwdc-2023\"\u003eInvestors are showing greater interest\u003c/a\u003e in Apple\u0026#8217;s AI-related endeavors, particularly in the development of chatGPT-like services. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe company\u0026#8217;s cautious approach to AI contrasts with the aggressive pursuit of AI by tech giants like Microsoft and Alphabet. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eHowever, despite Apple\u0026#8217;s not-so-proactive approach, it could be the \u0026#8220;one to benefit no matter where the industry goes,\u0026#8221; according to Wedbush analyst Daniel Ives.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eApple\u0026#8217;s AI strategy is expected to be front and center at the WWDC, with the company likely to discuss how it can integrate and ultimately monetize its customer base around future generative AI. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/analyst-ratings/analyst-color/23/05/32647998/apple-at-wwdc-expect-next-big-product-details-especially-when-it-comes-to-ai-analys\"\u003eApple is expected to have its own AI-driven solution\u003c/a\u003e that will be integrated into the Apple ecosystem, enabling customers to further tap into their iOS data, video, music, applications, and Apple devices through next-generation AI capabilities.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cdiv style=\"padding: 20px\"\u003e\n  \u003cdiv style=\"border: 5px solid teal;padding: 20px;text-align: center;border-radius: 10px;font-family: 'Lato', sans-serif\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv style=\"background-color: #f5f5f5;background-position: center;background-size: cover;justify-content: center\"\u003e\n      \u003cimg decoding=\"async\" src=\"https://s3.amazonaws.com/editorial.benzinga.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/24133132/Screenshot-2023-05-25-at-12.30.54-AM.png\" alt=\"Benzinga Newsbot\" style=\"margin-bottom: 20px;width: 100%\"\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003cp style=\"font-family:sans-serif\"\u003e\n      Hi, I am the \u003cspan style=\"font-weight: bold;text-decoration: none;color: teal;font-size: 1rem\"\u003eBenzinga Newsbot!\u003c/span\u003e \n      I wrote the above article, utilizing the sources I hyperlinked above.\n\n       This story was reviewed by Benzinga editors in line with the publication\u0026#8217;s editorial guidelines before being published. \u003c/p\u003e\n \n    \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e","symbols":["AAPL"],"source":"benzinga"}]

A battery of top executives, including Microsoft CEO \u003cstrong\u003eSatya Nadella\u003c/strong\u003e, Xbox chief \u003cstrong\u003ePhil Spencer,\u003c/strong\u003e and Activision Blizzard CEO \u003cstrong\u003eBobby Kotick\u003c/strong\u003e will defend the deal in person.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat Happened:\u003c/strong\u003e Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella, CFO \u003cstrong\u003eAmy Hood\u003c/strong\u003e, Xbox chief Phil Spencer and Activision Blizzard CEO Bobby Kotick, among others, will appear in person in court to defend against the FTC blocking Microsoft's acquisition of \u003cstrong\u003eActivision Blizzard Inc. (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/ATVI#NASDAQ\"\u003eATVI\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/strong\u003e, \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2023/6/20/23767588/microsoft-activision-ftc-case-ceo-satya-nadella-xbox-executives\"\u003ereported\u003c/a\u003e The Verge.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSee Also: \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/general/gaming/23/06/32833324/ftc-sues-to-block-microsofts-acquisition-of-activision-blizzard-microsoft-welcomes-it\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eFTC Sues To Block Microsoft\u0026#8217;s Acquisition Of Activision Blizzard; Microsoft Welcomes It\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAlso appearing to defend the deal will be Xbox Game Studio's head \u003cstrong\u003eMatt Booty\u003c/strong\u003e, Xbox creator experience head \u003cstrong\u003eSarah Bond\u003c/strong\u003e, and Activision's CFO \u003cstrong\u003eArmin Zerza\u003c/strong\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eOn the other hand, \u003cstrong\u003eSony's PlayStation\u003c/strong\u003e chief \u003cstrong\u003eJim Ryan\u003c/strong\u003e will appear virtually.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eOn June 13, the FTC \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/general/gaming/23/06/32833324/ftc-sues-to-block-microsofts-acquisition-of-activision-blizzard-microsoft-welcomes-it\"\u003esued\u003c/a\u003e to block the deal, citing a possible adverse impact on consumer choice and competition.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026#8220;Both a temporary restraining order and a preliminary injunction are necessary because Microsoft and Activision have represented that they may consummate the proposed acquisition at any time,\u0026#8221; the FTC said in its complaint.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhy It Is Important:\u003c/strong\u003e FTC's attempt to block the deal comes at a time when Microsoft has appealed the \u003cstrong\u003eUK Competition and Market Authority's\u003c/strong\u003e decision to block the acquisition. This is despite the deal receiving approvals in significant jurisdictions like the \u003cstrong\u003eEuropean Union\u003c/strong\u003e, \u003cstrong\u003eChina,\u003c/strong\u003e and\u003cstrong\u003e Japan\u003c/strong\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eMicrosoft\u0026#8217;s \u003cstrong\u003e$68.7 billion\u003c/strong\u003e acquisition of Activision Blizzard is also its biggest ever, eclipsing its previous biggest acquisition, which was that of \u003cstrong\u003eLinkedIn\u003c/strong\u003e, for \u003cstrong\u003e$26.2 billion\u003c/strong\u003e. This is also the biggest acquisition in the gaming industry.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eCheck out more of Benzinga's Consumer Tech coverage by\u003c/em\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/topic/consumer-tech\"\u003e\u003cem\u003efollowing this link\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eRead Next:\u003c/em\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32941806/no-whatsapp-is-not-secretly-listening-in-google-clarifies-that-it-was-just-a-bug\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eNo, WhatsApp Is Not Secretly Listening In: Google Clarifies That It Was Just A Bug\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["ATVI","MSFT"],"source":"benzinga"}]

[{"T":"n","id":32943538,"headline":"Can SoftBank Become The Next Hot AI Stock Through A Subsidiary That Nvidia Once Tried To Acquire?","summary":" ","author":"Benzinga Newsbot","created_at":"2023-06-21T11:37:26Z","updated_at":"2023-06-21T11:37:27Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32943538/can-softbank-become-the-next-hot-ai-stock-through-a-subsidiary-that-nvidia-once-tried-to-acquire","content":"\u003cp\u003eAs the artificial intelligence (AI) sector heats up, \u003cstrong\u003eSoftBank Group\u003c/strong\u003e (OTC:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/SFTBY#OTC\"\u003eSFTBY\u003c/a\u003e) is positioning itself to potentially become the next hot AI stock. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe company\u0026#8217;s CEO, \u003cstrong\u003eMasayoshi Son,\u003c/strong\u003e announced on Wednesday that SoftBank is preparing to \u0026#8220;go on the counteroffensive,\u0026#8221; leveraging its subsidiary Arm, a company that Nvidia once attempted to acquire.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat Happened:\u003c/strong\u003e The recent boom in AI technologies has reinvigorated SoftBank\u0026#8217;s leadership. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe company\u0026#8217;s stock has seen a 37% increase since last month when \u003cstrong\u003eNvidia Corporation\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/NVDA#NASDAQ\"\u003eNVDA\u003c/a\u003e), another beneficiary of the AI surge and\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/markets/cryptocurrency/23/05/32624024/nvidia-joins-trillion-dollar-club-ai-surpasses-ukraine-bitcoin-inflation-as-most-searched-\"\u003e now a trillion-dollar-club member\u003c/a\u003e, predicted record profits due to high demand for its advanced chips, \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/is-softbank-an-ai-stock-now-11624392600\"\u003eThe Wall Street Journal\u003c/a\u003e reports. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eSoftBank\u0026#8217;s subsidiary, \u003cstrong\u003ethe U.K. chip designer Arm,\u003c/strong\u003e which was acquired for $32 billion in 2016, is also expected to profit from increased investment in computational power. SoftBank holds a 75% direct stake in Arm, with the remaining shares owned by its Vision Fund.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eDespite a failed acquisition attempt by Nvidia last year, Arm and Nvidia continue to maintain a symbiotic relationship in the chip industry. Nvidia plans to launch its Grace server chips, based on Arm\u0026#8217;s architecture, later this year to compete with Intel and Advanced Micro Devices in the central processors for data centers market.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhy It Matters:\u003c/strong\u003e The rise in Nvidia\u0026#8217;s stock has also boosted other chip stocks, indicating a promising future for Arm\u0026#8217;s upcoming initial public offering. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eJefferies, which recently upgraded SoftBank to buy due to its AI connections, has increased its estimate of Arm\u0026#8217;s valuation from $40 billion to $60 billion. This is significant considering SoftBank\u0026#8217;s market value is around $72 billion. The general tech stock rally should also aid SoftBank\u0026#8217;s Vision Fund, which has been dealing with losses for the past few quarters, as reported by \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32940134/masayoshi-son-says-softbank-shifting-to-offense-mode-to-capitalize-on-ai-revolution-cnbc\"\u003eBenzinga\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eHowever, there are concerns that Son\u0026#8217;s aggressive investment style could lead to significant losses, as it did two years ago when SoftBank invested heavily in startups at high valuations during the pandemic.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eSon earlier said \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32916192/softbank-ceo-masayoshi-son-confesses-to-being-a-daily-user-of-chatgpt\"\u003ehe is a daily user\u003c/a\u003e of AI technologies like ChatGPT.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cdiv style=\"padding: 20px\"\u003e\n  \u003cdiv style=\"border: 5px solid teal;padding: 20px;text-align: center;border-radius: 10px;font-family: 'Lato', sans-serif\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv style=\"background-color: #f5f5f5;background-position: center;background-size: cover;justify-content: center\"\u003e\n      \u003cimg decoding=\"async\" src=\"https://s3.amazonaws.com/editorial.benzinga.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/24133132/Screenshot-2023-05-25-at-12.30.54-AM.png\" alt=\"Benzinga Newsbot\" style=\"margin-bottom: 20px;width: 100%\"\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003cp style=\"font-family:sans-serif\"\u003e\n      Hi, I am the \u003cspan style=\"font-weight: bold;text-decoration: none;color: teal;font-size: 1rem\"\u003eBenzinga Newsbot!\u003c/span\u003e \n      I wrote the above article, utilizing the sources I hyperlinked above.\n\n       This story was reviewed by Benzinga editors in line with the publication\u0026#8217;s editorial guidelines before being published. \u003c/p\u003e\n \n    \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e","symbols":["NVDA","SFTBY"],"source":"benzinga"}]
[{"T":"n","id":32943720,"headline":"What Does That Symbol On Your Car Dashboard Mean? Apple iOS 17 Will Help You Out","summary":" ","author":"Sudhanshu Singh","created_at":"2023-06-21T11:55:30Z","updated_at":"2023-06-21T11:55:31Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32943720/what-does-that-symbol-on-your-car-dashboard-mean-apple-ios-17-will-help-you-out","content":"\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eiOS 17\u003c/strong\u003e has introduced a super helpful new feature called \u0026#8220;Visual Look Up\u0026#8221;, developed by \u003cstrong\u003eApple Inc (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/AAPL#NASDAQ\"\u003eAAPL\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/strong\u003e. This feature analyzes pictures you take and provides more information about the objects within them. The latest \u003cstrong\u003eiOS\u003c/strong\u003e update, \u003cstrong\u003eiOS 17\u003c/strong\u003e, has expanded this feature to recognize common symbols on your car\u0026#8217;s dashboard.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThese symbols cover a wide range, from warning lights to those confusing icons for vents, defrosting, and more. With iOS 17, you can receive valuable information about your car\u0026#8217;s warning lights and other symbols through Visual Look Up.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSee Also:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/em\u003e \u003cem\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32921142/seize-the-best-ever-m1-macbook-air-deal-at-an-unbeatable-price-of-799\"\u003eSeize The Best Ever M1 MacBook Air Deal At An Unbeatable Price Of $799\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eApple\u0026#8217;s\u003c/strong\u003e preview website for iOS 17 highlights some exciting improvements to Visual Look Up this year. For instance, you can find recipes for similar dishes by capturing a photo. Additionally, when you lift a subject from an image, you can access information about it directly from the callout menu. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eFurthermore, iOS 17 enables Visual Look Up to work with videos. You can pause any frame and tap the info icon to look up information about the subject in the frame.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cfigure class=\"wp-block-image size-large\"\u003e\u003cimg decoding=\"async\" loading=\"lazy\" width=\"1024\" height=\"682\" src=\"https://s3.amazonaws.com/editorial.benzinga.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/21051231/iOS-17-1024x682.jpeg\" alt=\"\" class=\"wp-image-55258\" srcset=\"https://s3.amazonaws.com/editorial.benzinga.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/21051231/iOS-17-1024x682.jpeg 1024w,https://s3.amazonaws.com/editorial.benzinga.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/21051231/iOS-17-300x200.jpeg 300w,https://s3.amazonaws.com/editorial.benzinga.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/21051231/iOS-17-768x512.jpeg 768w,https://s3.amazonaws.com/editorial.benzinga.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/21051231/iOS-17-1536x1024.jpeg 1536w,https://s3.amazonaws.com/editorial.benzinga.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/21051231/iOS-17.jpeg 2000w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px\" /\u003e\u003cfigcaption class=\"wp-element-caption\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eImage Credits \u0026#8211; iOSBeta (Reddit)\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/figcaption\u003e\u003c/figure\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eOne noteworthy enhancement Apple has not explicitly mentioned is the expansion of Visual Look Up to recognize car symbols, made possible by iOS 17. Users on Reddit discovered this change earlier this month, and I had the chance to test it today. Its performance impressed me, even identifying multiple symbols and icons within the same picture. So, if your car\u0026#8217;s dashboard lights up like a Christmas tree, Visual Lookup has got you covered.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eOnce Visual Look Up identifies the symbols in your picture, iOS 17 provides quick links to learn more about each symbol using Safari. When viewing photos, the Photos app displays the icon\u0026#8217;s name and briefly describes its meaning.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe auto symbols feature in iOS 17 has a wide range of recognition capabilities, including dashboard warning lights, climate control symbols, headlight options, defrosting symbols, and much more.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHow To Access Visual Look Up:\u003c/strong\u003e Open the Photos app on your iPhone and tap an image. If iOS 17 detects symbols within the picture, you will notice a special icon resembling a steering wheel in the bottom toolbar. Alternatively, you can tap the \u0026#8220;i\u0026#8221; icon if the steering wheel symbol does not appear automatically.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis addition is handy for iOS 17 users, particularly those driving a BMW. iOS 17 is undergoing developer beta testing, and a public beta is set to follow in July. The official release of iOS 17 is scheduled for September when it will be available to everyone.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eCheck out more of Benzinga's Consumer Tech coverage by\u003c/em\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/topic/consumer-tech\"\u003e\u003cem\u003efollowing this link\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eRead Next:\u003c/strong\u003e \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32917787/how-to-silence-whatsapp-calls-from-unknown-numbers\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eHow To Silence WhatsApp Calls From Unknown Numbers\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["AAPL"],"source":"benzinga"}]

[{"T":"n","id":32944880,"headline":"Bill Gates Says AI Will Take Learning For Motivated People To A \u0026#39;Whole New Level\u0026#39;","summary":" ","author":"Benzinga Newsbot","created_at":"2023-06-21T12:35:15Z","updated_at":"2023-06-21T12:35:16Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32944880/bill-gates-says-ai-will-take-learning-for-motivated-people-to-a-whole-new-level","content":"\u003cp\u003eOn Wednesday, \u003cstrong\u003eBill Gates\u003c/strong\u003e, co-founder of \u003cstrong\u003eMicrosoft Corporation\u003c/strong\u003e, expressed optimism about the transformative potential of artificial intelligence (AI) in education during an event in Lagos State, Nigeria.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat Happened:\u003c/strong\u003e Gates hailed the potential of AI to revolutionize education, making learning more accessible and engaging for students and educators alike, \u003ca href=\"https://www.channelstv.com/2023/06/21/its-even-better-bill-gates-hails-education-potential-of-ai/\"\u003eChannels Television reports\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eHe emphasized that AI could simplify complex subjects, assist teachers, and create personalized sets of questions for students. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026#8220;Now, with AI, it's even better,\" Gates said. \"We can help teachers crack the homework automatically. We can create personalized sets of questions for students. But when it comes to that motivation, when kids get discouraged or confused, we'll try and do some of that with the AI,\" he added. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eGates said artificial intelligence has taken the availability of education tools for motivated people to \"a whole new level.\"\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhy It Matters:\u003c/strong\u003e Gates\u0026#8217; comments align with his previous statements on AI\u0026#8217;s potential to transform various sectors. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIn an \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/03/31529366/bill-gatess-open-letter-on-ai-a-tale-of-excitement-and-terror\"\u003eopen letter\u003c/a\u003e published on his personal website, Gates outlined his vision for the future of AI, highlighting its potential to revolutionize education by delivering personalized content to students and identifying their individual motivations for learning. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eHe also \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32768497/bill-gates-thinks-the-next-big-thing-in-ai-will-comes-from-an-unknown-startup\"\u003epredicted\u003c/a\u003e that the next big thing in AI could come from an unknown startup, suggesting that the future leading company in AI will have created a personal digital agent that can perform specific tasks for people.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eHowever, Gates\u0026#8217; optimism about AI\u0026#8217;s potential is not without reservations. He has \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/03/31526018/elon-musk-gives-bill-gates-an-f-in-understanding-of-ai\"\u003eclashed\u003c/a\u003e with other tech leaders like \u003cstrong\u003eElon Musk\u003c/strong\u003e over the understanding and implementation of AI, and he has expressed concerns about the potential risks of AI. Despite these concerns, Gates\u0026#8217; recent comments underscore his belief in the transformative potential of AI, particularly in the field of education.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cdiv style=\"padding: 20px\"\u003e\n  \u003cdiv style=\"border: 5px solid teal;padding: 20px;text-align: center;border-radius: 10px;font-family: 'Lato', sans-serif\"\u003e\n    \u003cdiv style=\"background-color: #f5f5f5;background-position: center;background-size: cover;justify-content: center\"\u003e\n      \u003cimg decoding=\"async\" src=\"https://s3.amazonaws.com/editorial.benzinga.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/24133132/Screenshot-2023-05-25-at-12.30.54-AM.png\" alt=\"Benzinga Newsbot\" style=\"margin-bottom: 20px;width: 100%\"\u003e\n    \u003c/div\u003e\n    \u003cp style=\"font-family:sans-serif\"\u003e\n      Hi, I am the \u003cspan style=\"font-weight: bold;text-decoration: none;color: teal;font-size: 1rem\"\u003eBenzinga Newsbot!\u003c/span\u003e \n      I wrote the above article, utilizing the sources I hyperlinked above.\n\n       This story was reviewed by Benzinga editors in line with the publication\u0026#8217;s editorial guidelines before being published. \u003c/p\u003e\n \n    \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e","symbols":["MSFT"],"source":"benzinga"}]

These people research company financial statements, sit in conference calls and meetings, and speak with relevant insiders to determine what are known as analyst ratings for stocks. Typically, analysts will rate each stock once a quarter. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eSome analysts publish their predictions for metrics such as growth estimates, earnings, and revenue to provide additional guidance with their ratings.
