[{"T":"n","id":32946007,"headline":"PowerSchool Announces Collaboration With Microsoft Azure OpenAI Service To Provide Personalized Learning At Scale In K-12 Education","summary":"Large-scale language models integrated within PowerSchool Performance Matters and PowerSchool LearningNav products will empower educators in delivering transformative personalized learning pathways\n\nPowerSchool","author":"Happy Mohamed","created_at":"2023-06-21T13:07:44Z","updated_at":"2023-06-21T13:07:44Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32946007/powerschool-announces-collaboration-with-microsoft-azure-openai-service-to-provide-personalized-lear","content":"\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eLarge-scale language models integrated within\u0026nbsp;\u003c/em\u003e\u003cem\u003ePowerSchool Performance Matters and PowerSchool LearningNav products will empower educators in delivering transformative personalized learning pathways\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003ePowerSchool Holdings, Inc. (NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/PWSC#NYSE\"\u003ePWSC\u003c/a\u003e), the leading provider of cloud-based software for K-12 education in North America, today announced its integration with\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Fazure.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Fproducts%2Fcognitive-services%2Fopenai-service%2F\u0026amp;esheet=53426684\u0026amp;newsitemid=20230621956382\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=Microsoft+Azure+OpenAI+Service\u0026amp;index=1\u0026amp;md5=01aac8c6f19a2c19a18fe7ddd7fc4441\"\u003eMicrosoft Azure OpenAI Service\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;to use OpenAI\u0026#39;s large language models withinPowerSchool Performance Matters and PowerSchool LearningNav,part ofPowerSchool\u0026#39;s Personalized Learning Cloud.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe implementation of generative AI within these products will dramatically improve educators\u0026#39; ability to deliver personalized learning to students at scale by enabling the application of personalized assessments and learning pathways based on individual student needs and learning goals. K-12 educators will also benefit from access to OpenAI technology within a secure, private platform with the same stringent privacy, ethics, and security standards that govern all PowerSchool products.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;The application of Azure\u0026#39;s OpenAI service within PowerSchool products will usher in a new era of personalized education, dramatically reducing the burden on teachers and providing truly individualized learning and support for every child,\u0026quot; said Hardeep Gulati, PowerSchool CEO. \u0026quot;PowerSchool is uniquely positioned to deploy AI solutions at scale, safely and securely, within our comprehensive K12 education cloud solutions serving school, district, and state education organizations benefiting 50 million students.\u0026quot;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe generative-AI functionality will save educators a significant amount of time by providing them with AI-generated assessment items within the PowerSchool Performance Matters formative assessment solution aligned to a desired learning objective, grade level, subject, and standard, which the teacher can use to deliver more frequent formative assessments at scale. Instead of spending hours creating assessment items, the built-in AI-powered item creation will reduce this effort to minutes. The AI-generated assessment items will be complemented by AI-powered Adaptive Testing in Performance Matters to better understand each student\u0026#39;s competency and personalized instruction needs. The educator can then leverage generative AI within the PowerSchool LearningNav product to create multiple-choice questions within diagnostic tests personalized to each student\u0026#39;s competency level to assist in instruction and measure progress against learning goals.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;Our goal is to bring the transformative potential of AI to education, by powering technology solutions with large-scale AI models that are responsibly deployed through industry-leading partners like PowerSchool,\u0026quot; said Lydia Smyers, Microsoft Vice President of US Education. \u0026quot;We\u0026#39;re looking forward to seeing the impact Microsoft Azure OpenAI Service will bring to the education industry through PowerSchool\u0026#39;s unique implementations and vision for personalized learning.\u0026quot;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eBy integrating GPT into PowerSchool Performance Matters and LearningNav products via Microsoft Azure OpenAI Service, educators can access the benefits of generative AI safely and securely, integrated into the existing education technology tools they use every day. Educators will also benefit from generative AI recommendations with increased accuracy due to PowerSchool\u0026#39;s sophisticated model performance and quality monitoring for factual accuracy of data, validation on reasoning, sensitivity, and content quality metrics. Additionally, PowerSchool continues to invest in feature explain-ability, bias audits, and bias reduction strategies of both algorithmic and data fairness in the machine learning process to inculcate fairness, accountability, and transparency in machine learning while making sure all students benefit from these solutions.\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["MSFT","PWSC"],"source":"benzinga"}]

Kandji\u0026#39;s latest integration with Okta","author":"Happy Mohamed","created_at":"2023-06-21T13:12:32Z","updated_at":"2023-06-21T13:12:32Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32946087/kandji-the-apple-device-management-and-security-platform-brings-okta-device-trust-to-apple-devices-w","content":"\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.globenewswire.com/Tracker?data=JT2qKitLkBXzAzWdo8YxPoB3RnKOC9bQBSZQOFEwz80-hW33-6s7W3tKvK3A3AFsmJl2zfWBDvOQhV24UA2fSw==\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eKandji\u003c/a\u003e, the Apple device management and security platform, today announced a new integration with leading independent Identity partner,\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.globenewswire.com/Tracker?data=SjXi8S0rzWw6NqJ_UTZlbhUbVIkRVc8H9h1VtU52ejIurJYKahmRkB5UNUXJIMzMcqX3wOSb_Z1rbJig9gAESg==\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eOkta, Inc.\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/OKTA#NASDAQ\"\u003eOKTA\u003c/a\u003e). Kandji\u0026#39;s latest integration with Okta Device Trust ensures Apple devices are compliant with access policies before allowing access to Okta-secured SaaS applications, allowing organizations to protect corporate resources.\u003cbr /\u003e\n\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eNow that working from anywhere on any device is the new norm, it is imperative that endpoint devices accessing corporate applications are secure and compliant. Together, Kandji and Okta Device Trust enable organizations to implement a Zero Trust security model by only allowing managed devices access to Okta-integrated applications. Kandji\u0026#39;s integration with Okta Device Trust is built on top of the Okta Identity Engine and adds a layer of security and compliance to establish trust at the device level.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;Hybrid work continues to gain traction, with\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.globenewswire.com/Tracker?data=8s6H_Tv5lU9g6ewwwz4GBQY3OkyZgU-oROfGx8IDt94rbQTYODzLYzRFk3QOY26r4v3uac6aSAbuAMdAGyxq05QEEmtQKTKWinVOtqdRnDtfaQnslgNqdzpkgHEkQcnO5-QEUxK1slpFFZOdJYD6lJeMEZeXCLWnU8q8xAapCQNVhXPPvFZ1V3oJGGbzRUgrgfzeA4AcLG9YpLwWvnvbGeoEjabXItvPfjEMzbZ5n_Q=\" target=\"_blank\"\u003e41%\u0026nbsp;of U.S. workers\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;still embracing this model. As a result, endpoint device management has become increasingly essential for organizations to remain secure and productive,\u0026quot; said Adam Pettit, CEO at Kandji. \u0026quot;Combining Kandji\u0026#39;s comprehensive device management platform and endpoint security solutions with Okta\u0026#39;s industry-leading cloud Identity and access management technology provides organizations with unparalleled security across their Apple fleet.\u0026quot;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eKandji\u0026#39;s integration with Okta provides a complete, end-to-end solution to determine device trust. Once Okta Device Trust is configured, Kandji automatically manages the creation and distribution of all required settings, configuration profiles, and trust certificates. When end users register their devices with Okta via the Okta Verify app, the device will appear as managed in the Okta Universal Directory. The trusted device will now qualify for secure access to applications through Okta.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eTo learn more about Kandji\u0026#39;s integration with Okta Device Trust visit\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.globenewswire.com/Tracker?data=f5yEdzycxaRZz5dH1dueWV9S0LiQaRBdtXBZlpCabkFDnzoXnfkNIUjnoJfTDQ0EiubDKgOrlG4gDxXzeuM4vO7_kWqLrQmfrsLxZz4gyoW4qd02QYizparZ2cJvwDnAUoQZRKsPs6N0ySgd3k7HNBDQAAIIP4c6iqOZ311BjWU0RueKeEo8vNYFtpLo8zyE\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ehttps://support.kandji.io/support/solutions/articles\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHelpful Links\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cul\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eLearn more about Kandji\u0026#39;s\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.kandji.io/apple-device-management/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eDevice Management\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eRead Kandji\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.kandji.io/resources/customer-stories/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eCustomer Stories\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eRead the Kandji\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://blog.kandji.io/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eBlog\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eFollow Kandji on\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/kandjimdm?lang=en\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eTwitter\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eFollow Kandji on\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/kandji/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eLinkedIn\u003c/a\u003e\n\t\u003cul\u003e\n\t\t\u003cli\u003eFollow Kandji on\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/kandjimdm/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eFacebook\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003c/ul\u003e\n\t\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e","symbols":["AAPL","OKTA"],"source":"benzinga"}]

If 335.96 continues to hold, we remain bullish with upside targets of 337.80 and 340.36.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eShould bearish activity prevail today and 335.96 is breached downwards, we expect bearish revisitation of our key level of 333.46.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eNVIDIA Corporation \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eNVIDIA\u0026nbsp;(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/NVDA#NASDAQ\"\u003eNVDA\u003c/a\u003e) continued its remarkable bullish run to reach all-time highs yesterday. It has since pulled back slightly in Wednesday\u0026#39;s premarket session. It currently stands between our channel of 434.01 and 436.56. If it can maintain these levels today, we\u0026#39;re targeting 439.87 on the upside, with potential blue-sky targets of 445 and 450.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eIf tech sees widespread selling today, we\u0026#39;re expecting a clear break of\u0026gt; 432.36 to the downside, with 429.17 as a bearish target.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMeta Platforms Inc \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eMeta\u0026nbsp;(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/META#NASDAQ\"\u003eMETA\u003c/a\u003e) experienced a bullish rally yesterday, pushing the stock to our key upside level of 284.18. We\u0026#39;re monitoring whether this can be established and maintained as a strong support level. If the bulls dominate today, our upside target is 286.94.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eHowever, if 284.18 persists as a strong resistance level, our bearish target is a test of 280.96 as support.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFinal Word:\u003c/strong\u003e The market\u0026#39;s primary focus today will be Jerome Powell\u0026#39;s testimony at the House Financial Services Committee. Powell has predominantly been dovish in his public appearances throughout 2023. If this pattern persists, we might observe buy-side activity across the market today. However, if Powell displays a hawkish stance today, we might witness a substantial downward movement. In this volatile market, it\u0026#39;s crucial to remain alert and prepared for any possible outcomes. [{"T":"n","id":32949033,"headline":"US Tech Stocks Outshine Global Peers Thanks To AI, Fueling US Market Comeback After 2022 Sell-Off","summary":" ","author":"Piero Cingari","created_at":"2023-06-21T14:51:52Z","updated_at":"2023-06-21T14:51:53Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/markets/asia/23/06/32949033/us-tech-stocks-outshine-global-peers-thanks-to-ai-fueling-us-market-comeback-after-2022-sell-off","content":"\u003cp\u003eAs the first half of 2023 drew to an end, the tech-heavy \u003cstrong\u003eNasdaq 100 Index\u003c/strong\u003e, closely tracked by the \u003cstrong\u003eInvesco QQQ Trust\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/QQQ#NASDAQ\"\u003eQQQ\u003c/a\u003e), delivered a spectacular 38.7% rise since the year\u0026#8217;s inception until June 20, \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/money/comparing-stock-indices\"\u003eoutshining all its global competitors\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eNot far behind, the \u003cstrong\u003eNikkei 225 Index\u003c/strong\u003e revealed an impressive performance, up 29.8% in local currency. However, for US-based investors, the 8% devaluation of the Yen against the dollar, slightly tempered this strong return. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAnother noteworthy performance was achieved by the \u003cstrong\u003eS\u0026amp;P 500 Index\u003c/strong\u003e, tracked by the \u003cstrong\u003eSPDR S\u0026amp;P 500 ETF Index\u003c/strong\u003e (NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/SPY#NYSE\"\u003eSPY\u003c/a\u003e), which triumphantly rose by approximately 15%, surpassing its advanced country peers, excluding Japan.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe \u003cstrong\u003eEuropean Euro Stoxx 50\u003c/strong\u003e underperformed the broader US market, gaining 11.9% year to far, as did the \u003cstrong\u003eMSCI All-Country World Ex-US\u003c/strong\u003e, a benchmark for global equities\u0026#8217; performance excluding the U.S., which is up 7.6%. The \u003cstrong\u003eUK FTSE 100\u003c/strong\u003e has experienced a stagnant journey thus far this year. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eYear-to-date Performance of Major Stock Indices:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cfigure class=\"wp-block-image size-large\"\u003e\u003cimg decoding=\"async\" loading=\"lazy\" width=\"1024\" height=\"561\" src=\"https://s3.amazonaws.com/editorial.benzinga.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/21093907/SPX_2023-06-21_15-38-49_b3f93-1024x561.png\" alt=\"\" class=\"wp-image-55498\" srcset=\"https://s3.amazonaws.com/editorial.benzinga.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/21093907/SPX_2023-06-21_15-38-49_b3f93-1024x561.png 1024w,https://s3.amazonaws.com/editorial.benzinga.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/21093907/SPX_2023-06-21_15-38-49_b3f93-300x164.png 300w,https://s3.amazonaws.com/editorial.benzinga.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/21093907/SPX_2023-06-21_15-38-49_b3f93-768x421.png 768w,https://s3.amazonaws.com/editorial.benzinga.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/21093907/SPX_2023-06-21_15-38-49_b3f93-1536x841.png 1536w,https://s3.amazonaws.com/editorial.benzinga.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/21093907/SPX_2023-06-21_15-38-49_b3f93-2048x1122.png 2048w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px\" /\u003e\u003c/figure\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\"\u003eU.S. Stock Market Gets Its Payback for 2022 Events\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eInterestingly, the out-performance of the US stock market in 2023 felt like vengeance for the events of 2022. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eBoth the Nasdaq 100 and the S\u0026amp;P 500 indices had underperformed their counterparts the previous year, suffering a turbulent collapse as the Federal Reserve delivered its fastest rate-hike cycle in its history. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe Nasdaq 100 fell by 33.7%, while the S\u0026amp;P 500 fell by 20%. [{"T":"n","id":32949458,"headline":"California Rep. Mike Garcia Sold Up to $150K Worth of Tesla Stock","summary":" ","author":"Benzinga Insights","created_at":"2023-06-21T15:05:11Z","updated_at":"2023-06-21T15:05:11Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/government/23/06/32949458/california-rep-mike-garcia-sold-up-to-150k-worth-of-tesla-stock","content":"\u003cp\u003eMike Garcia, a Representative from California, reported a sale of Tesla (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/TSLA#NASDAQ\"\u003eTSLA\u003c/a\u003e) stock on June 20, 2023. According to the Periodic Transaction Report the transaction was placed on June 20, 2023.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat Happened:\u003c/strong\u003e A recent report from the House of Representatives Clerk's Office on June 20, 2023 reveals that Garcia made a sale of \u003ca href=\"www.benzinga.com/quote/TSLA\"\u003eTesla\u003c/a\u003e stock valued between $65,002 - $150,000.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eTesla shares are trading down 2.72% at $266.98 at the time of writing.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch3\u003eThe Importance of Congressional Transactions\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eCongressional transactions shouldn't be used primarily to make an investing decision, however, they can be an important factor for an investor to consider.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eA Congressional transaction is when any Representative or Senator either buys or sells an individual stock. Anyone working in Congress must file a Periodic Transaction Report to inform the public of their recent transaction within 30 days of being notified of the transaction and within 45 days of the transaction date.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWhen a Senator or Representative makes a new purchase, that could be an indication that they expect the stock to rise.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eA sale, on the other hand, can be made for a variety of reasons, and may not necessarily mean that the seller thinks the stock will go down.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIn April 2012, Former President Barack Obama signed the STOCK Act into law. The act prohibits members of Congress from using private information given to them by their position for personal gain such as buying or selling a stock. The act also expanded disclosure requirements for members of Congress by requiring them to file a monthly disclosure. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch3\u003eTrade Recap\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eA June filing states that California Representative Mike Garcia sold shares of Tesla. The exact amount of the transaction remained unknown but the filing states a range of $65,002 - $150,000.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eThis article was generated by Benzinga's automated content engine and reviewed by an editor.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["TSLA"],"source":"benzinga"}]

[{"T":"n","id":32950328,"headline":"A Look Into Broadcom\u0026#39;s Debt","summary":" ","author":"Benzinga Insights","created_at":"2023-06-21T15:30:54Z","updated_at":"2023-06-21T15:30:55Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32950328/a-look-into-broadcoms-debt","content":"\u003cp\u003eShares of Broadcom Inc. (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/AVGO#NASDAQ\"\u003eAVGO\u003c/a\u003e) increased by 35.09% in the past three months. Before having a look at the importance of debt, let's look at how much debt Broadcom has. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003eBroadcom Debt\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAccording to the Broadcom's most recent financial statement as reported on June 7, 2023, total debt is at $39.31 billion, with $38.19 billion in long-term debt and $1.12 billion in current debt. Adjusting for $11.55 billion in cash-equivalents, the company has a net debt of $27.76 billion. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eLet's define some of the terms we used in the paragraph above. \u003cstrong\u003eCurrent debt\u003c/strong\u003e is the portion of a company's debt which is due within 1 year, while \u003cstrong\u003elong-term debt\u003c/strong\u003e is the portion due in more than 1 year. \u003cstrong\u003eCash equivalents\u003c/strong\u003e includes cash and any liquid securities with maturity periods of 90 days or less. \u003cstrong\u003eTotal debt\u003c/strong\u003e equals current debt plus long-term debt minus cash equivalents. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eInvestors look at the debt-ratio to understand how much financial leverage a company has. Broadcom has $71.67 billion in total assets, therefore making the debt-ratio 0.55. Generally speaking, a debt-ratio more than 1 means that a large portion of debt is funded by assets. As the debt-ratio increases, so the does the risk of defaulting on loans, if interest rates were to increase. Different industries have different thresholds of tolerance for debt-ratios. For example, a debt ratio of 35% might be higher for one industry, but normal for another.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://www.benzinga.com/files/images/story/2023/1687361451_0.png\" alt=\"debt_fig\" /\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch2\u003eWhy Debt Is Important\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eBesides equity, debt is an important factor in the capital structure of a company, and contributes to its growth. Due to its lower financing cost compared to equity, it becomes an attractive option for executives trying to raise capital.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eInterest-payment obligations can impact the cash-flow of the company. Equity owners can keep excess profit, generated from the debt capital, when companies use the debt capital for its business operations. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eLooking for stocks with low debt-to-equity ratios? Check out Benzinga Pro, a market research platform which provides investors with near-instantaneous access to dozens of stock metrics - including debt-to-equity ratio. \u003ca href=\"https://pro.benzinga.com/\"\u003eClick here to learn more\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eThis article was generated by Benzinga's automated content engine and reviewed by an editor.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["AVGO"],"source":"benzinga"}]
[{"T":"n","id":32950541,"headline":"Accenture To Acquire Anser Advisory To Expand Capital Project Capabilities; No Financial Terms Disclosed","summary":"Accenture will help clients more efficiently deliver large infrastructure projects in North America\n\nAccenture (NYSE:ACN) has entered into an agreement to acquire Anser Advisory, an advisory and management company","author":"Happy Mohamed","created_at":"2023-06-21T15:40:11Z","updated_at":"2023-06-21T15:40:12Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/m-a/23/06/32950541/accenture-to-acquire-anser-advisory-to-expand-capital-project-capabilities-no-financial-terms-disclo","content":"\u003cp\u003eAccenture will help clients more efficiently deliver large infrastructure projects in North America\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eAccenture (NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/ACN#NYSE\"\u003eACN\u003c/a\u003e) has entered into an agreement to acquire\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.anseradvisory.com%2F\u0026amp;esheet=53426348\u0026amp;newsitemid=20230621611845\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=Anser+Advisory\u0026amp;index=1\u0026amp;md5=24c37faaac04cb9d491ccc2b1aaeca21\"\u003eAnser Advisory\u003c/a\u003e, an advisory and management company for infrastructure projects in the United States.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis press release features multimedia. View the full release here:\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20230621611845/en/\"\u003ehttps://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20230621611845/en/\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe acquisition will enhance Accenture\u0026#39;s ability to help companies and state and local public sector organizations complete large, long-term infrastructure projects more predictably and efficiently \u0026ndash; projects that support growth for clients and have a positive impact on communities. The move will expand Accenture\u0026#39;s capital project capabilities, moving the company into an adjacent business with an estimated\u0026nbsp;$88 billion\u0026nbsp;of addressable market in North America1.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eInvestments in ambitious infrastructure and energy transition projects are projected to drive non-residential spending to\u0026nbsp;$1.033 trillion\u0026nbsp;in the United States in 20232. They are driven by government stimuli such as the Inflation Reduction Act, the Infrastructure Investment Jobs Act, and the CHIPS and Science Act, and a trend toward bringing manufacturing back to the US. These programs include building and modernizing electric grids, water projects, freight and passenger rail transportation, airports, electric vehicle charging and alternative fuel infrastructure,\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Fnewsroom.accenture.com%2Fnews%2Frecharge-industries-engages-accenture-to-help-design-and-engineer-one-of-the-worlds-largest-gigafactories-in-australia.htm\u0026amp;esheet=53426348\u0026amp;newsitemid=20230621611845\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=gigafactories\u0026amp;index=2\u0026amp;md5=e613b65f19d0d59ed7c64a8253b785b5\"\u003egigafactories\u003c/a\u003e, semiconductor plants, broadband internet and public buildings.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eAnser Advisory has a proven track record of reducing the risks and impacts of project delays and cost overruns on large-scale critical infrastructure projects. They bring a rare mix of strategy expertise and hands-on know-how from working with owners\u0026#39; engineering, procurement and construction providers on the ground.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eAnser Advisory\u0026#39;s services span advisory, compliance and management services. Owners of capital projects engage Anser Advisory to advise them on how to structure, estimate and plan projects, to monitor the work being done, and to assist them in managing and executing all phases of projects. Increasingly, clients are engaging Anser Advisory to help advance decarbonization and clean energy projects in sectors including energy transmission, distribution and storage, sustainability programs and fleet electrification.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eAaron Saint, North America lead for Accenture\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.accenture.com%2Fus-en%2Fabout%2Findustry-x-index\u0026amp;esheet=53426348\u0026amp;newsitemid=20230621611845\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=Industry+X\u0026amp;index=3\u0026amp;md5=5b39ec2ab8da614f9c1065b9dc651a7c\"\u003eIndustry X\u003c/a\u003e, said: \u0026quot;Accenture and Anser Advisory will support our clients\u0026#39; critical capital projects by combining \u0026lsquo;boots on the ground\u0026#39; know-how, deep industry expertise and leading-edge digital capabilities \u0026ndash; while also opening new adjacent market share opportunities for Accenture. We will reinvent how people do their work, the processes they execute, and the technologies they use to deliver mission critical projects on time and on budget. Given the large-scale investments and projected labor shortages in North America, this is the right time to combine our capabilities and help deliver on our clients\u0026#39; ambitious infrastructure commitments.\u0026quot;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eJimmy Etheredge, CEO of Accenture North America, added: \u0026quot;This acquisition positions Accenture as a key player in the tremendous investment that is taking place to modernize North America\u0026#39;s infrastructure in a sustainable manner. Combining Anser Advisory\u0026#39;s experience with our digital technology expertise is a game-changing transformation for infrastructure projects.\u0026quot;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eBryan Carruthers, CEO of Anser Advisory, said: \u0026quot;Clients engage Anser Advisory as a trusted advisor to minimize risk and maximize outcomes when they invest in critical infrastructure. By joining Accenture, we will be able to provide new value and scale to our clients to support their missions and opportunities for our people to grow their careers at one of the world\u0026#39;s most prestigious companies.\u0026quot;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eFounded in 1996, Anser Advisory is headquartered in Santa Ana, California, and has approximately 1,200 employees across 13 states. Accenture will acquire the Anser Advisory brand with its approximately 920 employees working on private sector and state and local public projects.\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.markonsolutions.com%2F\u0026amp;esheet=53426348\u0026amp;newsitemid=20230621611845\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=Markon+Solutions\u0026amp;index=4\u0026amp;md5=fa62ea94314399df3dd0a706986bf710\"\u003eMarkon Solutions\u003c/a\u003e, a 280-people Anser Advisory subsidiary working with US federal clients, will be retained by Sterling Investment Partners and Markon Solutions management.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eRecent acquisitions Accenture has made to expand its capabilities for asset-intensive industries include\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Fnewsroom.accenture.com%2Fnews%2Faccenture-completes-acquisition-of-eclipse-automation.htm\u0026amp;esheet=53426348\u0026amp;newsitemid=20230621611845\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=Eclipse+Automation\u0026amp;index=5\u0026amp;md5=6a7341bed82739c82501f01c5318f998\"\u003eEclipse Automation\u003c/a\u003e, a provider of customized manufacturing automation and robotics solutions;\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Fnewsroom.accenture.com%2Fnews%2Faccenture-completes-acquisition-of-umlaut.htm\u0026amp;esheet=53426348\u0026amp;newsitemid=20230621611845\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=umlaut\u0026amp;index=6\u0026amp;md5=727292a2b1987253ab7964c0ea882d8c\"\u003eumlaut\u003c/a\u003e, a global engineering services provider; and\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Fnewsroom.accenture.com%2Fnews%2Faccenture-acquires-advoco-scaling-capabilities-for-intelligent-asset-management-solutions.htm\u0026amp;esheet=53426348\u0026amp;newsitemid=20230621611845\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=Advoco%2C\u0026amp;index=7\u0026amp;md5=f48d8d06e093c2940b0a638e3de3de51\"\u003eAdvoco,\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;an asset management services provider.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eCompletion of the acquisition is subject to customary closing conditions, including required antitrust clearances.\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["ACN"],"source":"benzinga"}]

[{"T":"n","id":32950732,"headline":"FedEx And UPS Grapple With An Unfavorable Environment","summary":"On Tuesday, FedEx Corporation (NYSE: FDX) posted its fiscal 2023 fourth-quarter results with shares falling 3.1% in premarket trading on Wednesday, after a revenue miss and weak profit guidance due to a continuously weakening demand and cost inflation pressures. What’s even more concerning is the United Parcel ","author":"Upwallstreet","created_at":"2023-06-21T15:47:56Z","updated_at":"2023-06-21T15:47:56Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/23/06/32950732/fedex-and-ups-grapple-with-an-unfavorable-environment","content":"\u003cp\u003eOn Tuesday, FedEx Corporation (NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/FDX#NYSE\"\u003eFDX\u003c/a\u003e) posted its fiscal 2023 fourth-quarter results with shares falling 3.1% in premarket trading on Wednesday, after a revenue miss and weak profit guidance due to a continuously weakening\u0026nbsp;demand and cost inflation pressures.\u0026nbsp;What\u0026rsquo;s even more concerning is the United Parcel Service Inc (NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/UPS#NYSE\"\u003eUPS\u003c/a\u003e) strike in the air that would be the largest single-employer strike in US history. All in all, it is certainly not the best time to be in the shipping business with even Amazon.com Inc (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/AMZN#NASDAQ\"\u003eAMZN\u003c/a\u003e) dealing with the strike of 84 delivery drivers in California as well as an aftermath of an Amazon driver being shot after delivering a package.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003eFedEx\u0026rsquo;s Fourth Fiscal Quarter Key Figures\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eFor the quarter ended on May 31st, the Memphis-based shipping giant\u0026nbsp;reported\u0026nbsp;revenue\u0026nbsp;dropped from last year\u0026rsquo;s comparable quarter ($24.4 billion) to\u0026nbsp;$21.9 billion.\u0026nbsp;Express segment revenue\u0026nbsp;brought in\u0026nbsp;$10.41\u0026nbsp;billion. While the Ground segment improved due to increased revenue per package and cost-reductions, the Express segment experienced\u0026nbsp;its operating results\u0026nbsp;decline due to lower global volumes\u0026nbsp;that were only\u0026nbsp;partially offset by\u0026nbsp;loweredexpenses and higher U.S. domestic yields.\u0026nbsp;Adjusted operating income amounted to\u0026nbsp;$1.77\u0026nbsp;billion with the strongest\u0026nbsp;operating margin of\u0026nbsp;the fiscal year at\u0026nbsp;8.1%\u0026nbsp;as a result of efficient execution of\u0026nbsp;expense management controls.\u0026nbsp;Net income\u0026nbsp;also dropped from last year\u0026rsquo;s comparable quarter ($1.8 billion) to\u0026nbsp;$1.25 billion\u0026nbsp;and adjusted diluted earnings per share\u0026nbsp;amounted to\u0026nbsp;$4.94.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eAt FedEx Express air and international unit, flight hours\u0026nbsp;slipped\u0026nbsp;12% in the quarter, which\u0026nbsp;exceeded\u0026nbsp;the volume decline.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003eCorporate Staff Changes\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eIn a separate announcement, FedEx announced that\u0026nbsp;CFO Michael Lenz will retire on July 31st. Lenz will be present until the year-end to ensure a smooth transition of his successor who is still unknown.\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003eFlattish Fiscal 2024 Guidance\u0026nbsp;\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eFlat low-single-digit revenue growth\u0026nbsp;is expected in the new fiscal year that kicked off on\u0026nbsp;June 1st,\u0026nbsp;with\u0026nbsp;$1.8 billion in permanent savings out of $4 billion in savings in this fiscal year and the\u0026nbsp;following.\u0026nbsp;Margin improvements at its Express and Ground units\u0026nbsp;are expected, while freight margins\u0026nbsp;are expected to remain under pressure throughout the year and especially during the undergoing quarter.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eFollowing the two-year of skyrocketing demand created by the pandemic, the industry is dealing with a package volume decline and therefore, lowering costs is the logical way to go. As it grapples with this challenging new reality of weakened demand, FedEx is taking this road to improve its profitability.\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003eUS Largest Single-employer Strike Is Looming Over UPS\u0026nbsp;\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eIf UPS does not make an agreement with the Teamsters union,\u0026nbsp;more than 340,000 UPS workers are threatening to strike\u0026nbsp;over pay, hours and working conditions. If it takes place, it would be the largest single-employer strike in US history.\u0026nbsp;As a reminder, the 1997 UPS strike that gathered 185,000 workers resulted in 15 days of standstill operations that slashed deliveries, overwhelmed FedEx and the US Postal Service and caused massive damage to US businesses.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003eThe Worst-case Scenario\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe good side is a short\u0026nbsp;UPS strike would not be as devastating as it was\u0026nbsp;25 years ago as things are quite difference these days. Amazon did not exist back then while FedEx has grown quite bit and retailers such as Walmart (NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/WMT#NYSE\"\u003eWMT\u003c/a\u003e) created\u0026nbsp;shipping alternatives\u0026nbsp;such as the store and curb pickup option. But a longer strike would certainly do more than just slower deliveries such as result in raised prices and empty shelves. Caution is not what the market wanted to hear as it seems it was expecting the glimpse of self-confidence of Amazon, but it could be a smart move for FedEx that is doing what it can to protect margins as pressures are here to stay for a while.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eDISCLAIMER: This content is for informational purposes only. It is not intended as investing advice.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n ","symbols":["AMZN","FDX","UPS","WMT"],"source":"benzinga"}]

to trick consumers into enrolling in automatically renewing Prime subscriptions.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eAmazon also knowingly problematized the revocation process for Prime subscribers who sought to end their membership.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eAmazon leadership slowed or rejected changes that would have made it easier for users to cancel Prime as those changes adversely affected Amazon\u0026rsquo;s bottom line.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe FTC charged that Amazon implemented a cancellation process to deter consumers from successfully unsubscribing from Prime.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eDuring Amazon\u0026rsquo;s online checkout process, the company flashed numerous opportunities to subscribe to Amazon Prime at $14.99/month. In many cases, the option to purchase items on Amazon without subscribing to Prime was more difficult for consumers to locate, the report says.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eIn some cases, the button presented to consumers to complete their transaction did not clearly state that in choosing that option, they also agreed to join Prime for a recurring subscription.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eConsumers who attempted to cancel Prime were faced with multiple steps to accomplish the task of withdrawing.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePrice Action:\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;AMZN shares traded lower by 1.00% at $124.52 on the last check Wednesday.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003ePhoto via Wikimedia Commons\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n ","symbols":["AMZN"],"source":"benzinga"}]

[{"T":"n","id":32952319,"headline":"\u0026#39;Microsoft Is Hiking The Price Of Xbox Series X And Xbox Game Pass\u0026#39; - The Verge","summary":"https://www.theverge.com/2023/6/21/23768400/microsoft-xbox-series-x-xbox-game-pass-price-increase?utm_campaign=theverge\u0026amp;utm_content=chorus\u0026amp;utm_medium=social\u0026amp;utm_source=twitter\n\nMicrosoft is increasing its","author":"Happy Mohamed","created_at":"2023-06-21T17:04:19Z","updated_at":"2023-06-21T17:04:20Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32952319/microsoft-is-hiking-the-price-of-xbox-series-x-and-xbox-game-pass-the-verge","content":"\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2023/6/21/23768400/microsoft-xbox-series-x-xbox-game-pass-price-increase?utm_campaign=theverge\u0026amp;utm_content=chorus\u0026amp;utm_medium=social\u0026amp;utm_source=twitter\" title=\"https://www.theverge.com/2023/6/21/23768400/microsoft-xbox-series-x-xbox-game-pass-price-increase?utm_campaign=theverge\u0026amp;utm_content=chorus\u0026amp;utm_medium=social\u0026amp;utm_source=twitter\"\u003ehttps://www.theverge.com/2023/6/21/23768400/microsoft-xbox-series-x-xbox-game-pass-price-increase?utm_campaign=theverge\u0026amp;utm_content=chorus\u0026amp;utm_medium=social\u0026amp;utm_source=twitter\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eMicrosoft is increasing its Xbox Series X prices in most countries in August apart from the US, Japan, Chile, Brazil, and Colombia. The Xbox maker is also increasing the monthly prices of its Xbox Game Pass and Xbox Game Pass Ultimate subscriptions for the first time next month, which will see the base Game Pass subscription for console move up to $10.99 a month from $9.99.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026ldquo;We\u0026rsquo;ve held on our prices for consoles for many years and have adjusted the prices to reflect the competitive conditions in each market,\u0026rdquo; says Kari Perez, head of communications for Xbox, in a statement to\u0026nbsp;\u003cem\u003eThe Verge\u003c/em\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eXbox Series X console pricing will largely match the\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2022/8/25/23321301/sony-ps5-price-increase-europe-uk-japan-china-australia-mexico-canada\"\u003eprice hike Sony announced for the PS5\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;last year, with the Xbox Series X moving to \u0026pound;479.99 in the UK, \u0026euro;549.99 across most European markets, CAD $649.99 in Canada, and AUD $799.99 in Australia starting August 1st. The Xbox Series S pricing will not be adjusted in any markets, remaining at $249.99.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eWhile Xbox Series X pricing adjustments had been expected after Sony\u0026rsquo;s move last year, Xbox chief\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2022/10/26/23425029/microsoft-xbox-game-pass-profitable-revenues\"\u003ePhil Spencer also hinted in October\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;that pricing for subscriptions wouldn\u0026rsquo;t hold forever.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eXbox Game Pass Ultimate and Game Pass for Console pricing will increase starting July 6th. Xbox Game Pass Ultimate will move from $14.99 per month to $16.99 (\u0026euro;14.99 / \u0026pound;12.99). The base Xbox Game Pass for Console pricing will also move from $9.99 a month up to $10.99 (\u0026euro;10.99 / \u0026pound;8.99). Microsoft is not changing PC Game Pass pricing, though.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eIf you\u0026rsquo;re an existing Game Pass monthly subscriber, then these new recurring prices won\u0026rsquo;t take effect until August 13th, or September 13th in Germany. New Xbox Game Pass members will see the new prices immediately on July 6th. If you\u0026rsquo;re subscribed to Xbox Game Pass through a yearly code, the new pricing won\u0026rsquo;t take effect until you go to renew your subscription.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eMost markets will be affected by the Xbox Game Pass price increases, with the exception of some Game Pass console pricing which will remain the same in Norway, Chile, Denmark, Switzerland, and Saudi Arabia.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eMicrosoft hasn\u0026rsquo;t changed its Xbox Game Pass pricing since launching the subscription in 2017, and the company is keen to stress this isn\u0026rsquo;t related to its proposed acquisition of Activision Blizzard. \u0026ldquo;These Game Pass price adjustments are not related to the Activision Blizzard deal, and are intended to match local market conditions,\u0026rdquo; says Perez.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eMicrosoft\u0026rsquo;s Xbox subscription changes follow a general trend in price hikes over the past couple of years for entertainment subscriptions.\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2022/3/24/22993562/netflix-price-increase-us-plans-2022\"\u003eNetflix raised prices again\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;last year following gradual price hikes in recent years, and Disney Plus and Hulu saw\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2022/8/10/23300460/disney-plus-price-increase-ads-streaming\"\u003esteep price hikes\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;last year, too.\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2022/10/24/23420902/apple-tv-plus-music-price-increase\"\u003eApple Music\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;and\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2021/4/26/22403813/spotify-price-increase-subscriptions-2021\"\u003eSpotify\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;have both increased in price in most markets in recent years.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eNintendo has not yet adjusted its Switch Online subscription service since\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2018/9/13/17857054/nintendo-switch-online-subscription-prices-nes\"\u003elaunching it in 2018\u003c/a\u003e, and Sony only just updated its own\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2022/5/16/23074725/playstation-plus-premium-extra-launch-date-games\"\u003ePlayStation Plus subscriptions\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;last year with new PlayStation Plus Essential, Plus Extra, and Plus Premium subscriptions for PlayStation owners.\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["MSFT"],"source":"benzinga"}]

One must act on the contract by this date if one wants to use it.\u003cbr /\u003e\n - \u003cstrong\u003ePremium/Option Price:\u003c/strong\u003e The price of the contract.  \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eFor more information, visit our \u003cem\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://pro.benzinga.com/blog/how-to-understand-option-alerts/\"\u003eGuide to Understanding Options Alerts\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e or read \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/markets/options\"\u003emore news on unusual options activity\u003c/a\u003e.  \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThis article was generated by Benzinga's automated content engine and reviewed by an editor.\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["AMC","ATVI","DIS","GOOG","GOOGL","META","NFLX","SKLZ","TMUS","WBD"],"source":"benzinga"}]

big picture, not an individual stock.\u0026nbsp;The chart of Tesla stock is being used to illustrate the point.\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\u003cli\u003eTesla\u0026nbsp;is a great company.\u0026nbsp;None of the following is a commentary on Tesla.\u0026nbsp;The purpose here is solely to illustrate the behavior of investors right now.\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eIt is important for prudent investors to understand this behavior.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\u003cli\u003eThe chart shows when the news broke that \u003cstrong\u003eFord Motor Co.\u003c/strong\u003e (NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/F#NYSE\"\u003eF\u003c/a\u003e)\u0026nbsp;was going to use Tesla\u0026rsquo;s charging network.\u0026nbsp;This news was truly a big deal.\u0026nbsp;The subsequent move in Tesla stock is justified.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\u003cli\u003eThe chart shows when the news broke that \u003cstrong\u003eGeneral Motors Co.\u003c/strong\u003e (NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/GM#NYSE\"\u003eGM\u003c/a\u003e) was going to use Tesla\u0026rsquo;s charging network.\u0026nbsp;The news made it inevitable that Tesla would become the charging standard in the\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://zyxemergingfeed.thearorareport.com/tag/u/\" rel=\"tag\" title=\"Click to see other posts for U\"\u003eU\u003c/a\u003e.S.\u0026nbsp;The move up in Tesla stock on the news is justified.\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\u003cli\u003eAfter Ford and General Motors joined Tesla\u0026rsquo;s charging network, it was expected that there would be announcements over the coming days from other automakers about joining Tesla\u0026rsquo;s charging network.\u0026nbsp;This expectation resulted in a further move in Tesla\u0026rsquo;s stock.\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\u003cli\u003eThe chart shows when the news broke that Rivian (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/RIVN#NASDAQ\"\u003eRIVN\u003c/a\u003e) will use Tesla\u0026rsquo;s charging network. Here are the key points:\r\n\t\u003cul\u003e\r\n\t\t\u003cli\u003eOn the Rivian news, Tesla stock added about $40B in market capitalization.\u0026nbsp;(If the calculation is started not when rumors started but when the news broke, the increase in market capitalization is $24B.)\r\n\t\t\u003cul\u003e\r\n\t\t\t\u003cli\u003eIn the after hours, investors excited about Rivian news continued to aggressively buy Tesla stock, adding another $10B in market capitalization for a total\u0026nbsp;add\u0026nbsp;of $50B.\u0026nbsp;(Some bulls will contend that part of the rise was due to India news, but that is nonsense as India news was widely expected and discounted in the stock.)\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\t\t\u003cli\u003eAll in all, investors added $50B to Tesla\u0026rsquo;s market capitalization on the Rivian news.\u0026nbsp;This is on top of $240B in market capitalization investors added on Ford and General Motors news prior to Rivian news.\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\t\t\u003cli\u003eRivian hardly has any vehicles on the road.\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\t\t\u003cli\u003eEven in an optimistic scenario, Rivian will likely\u0026nbsp;add\u0026nbsp;less than $50M\u0026nbsp;to Tesla\u0026rsquo;s profit.\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\t\t\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eThe sum total is that in an optimistic scenario, a profit of less than $50M\u0026nbsp;added $50B in market capitalization.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\t\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\t\t\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\t\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\u003cli\u003ePrudent investors should ask a very simple question, \u0026ldquo;Are investors doing any analysis before risking their money?\u0026rdquo;\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\u003cli\u003eThe foregoing illustrates the current state of exuberance in the stock market.\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSentiment has now turned very positive according to The Arora Report proprietary indicators.\u0026nbsp;These proprietary indicators provide members of The Arora Report with a significant edge in the markets.\u0026nbsp; It is not extremely positive yet.\u0026nbsp; When sentiment turns extremely positive, it is a contrary signal.\u0026nbsp; In plain English, this means a sell signal.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePowell Testimony\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003ePowell will testify in front of Congress today and tomorrow.\u0026nbsp;Will Powell take on the momo crowd in Q\u0026amp;A?\u0026nbsp; The momo crowd and the Fed are at complete odds.\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cul\u003e\r\n\t\u003cli\u003eMost of the momo crowd believes the Fed will cut interest rates three times this year.\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\u003cli\u003eThe Fed says it plans to increase interest rates twice this year.\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe Fed has released prepared remarks from Powell.\u0026nbsp;Here are the key points:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cul\u003e\r\n\t\u003cli\u003eInflation remains over the 2% goal.\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\u003cli\u003eThe economy is facing headwinds from tighter credit.\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\u003cli\u003eReducing inflation is likely to require a period of below trend growth.\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\u003cli\u003eReducing inflation will need softening labor market conditions or higher unemployment.\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eStark Reminder From\u0026nbsp;U.K.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eThe momo crowd is running up the stock market on the belief that the fight against inflation is over.\u0026nbsp; The latest data from the\u0026nbsp;U.K. shows that the momo crowd\u0026#39;s belief is wrong.\u0026nbsp; Future data in the\u0026nbsp;U.S. may turn out similar to the U.K.\u0026nbsp; Inflation in the U.K. is running hotter than expected.\u0026nbsp;Here are the details:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cul\u003e\r\n\t\u003cli\u003eIn the\u0026nbsp;U.K., CPI came at 8.7% year-over-year vs. 8.4% consensus.\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\u003cli\u003eCPI came at 0.7% month-over-month vs. 0.5% consensus.\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\u003cli\u003eCore CPI came at 7.1% year-over-year vs. 6.8% consensus.\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\u003cli\u003eCore CPI came at 0.8% month-over-month vs. 0.6% consensus.\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe data may force Bank of England\u0026rsquo;s hand to raise interest rates again.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eModi Visits\u0026nbsp;U.S.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eIndia\u0026rsquo;s Prime Minister is visiting the\u0026nbsp;U.S.\u0026nbsp;The purpose of the visit is to strengthen ties between the two countries and contain China.\u0026nbsp; Here are the key points:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cul\u003e\r\n\t\u003cli\u003eIndia is ascendant.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\u003cli\u003eIndia is already a world leader in providing information technology services.\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\u003cli\u003eNow, manufacturing is years.\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMomo Crowd And Smart Money In Stocks\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe momo crowd is buying stocks in the early trade.\u0026nbsp;Smart money is inactive in the early trade.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eGold\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe Inc.\u003c/strong\u003e (NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/BLK#NYSE\"\u003eBLK\u003c/a\u003e)\u0026nbsp;filing for a bitcoin ETF.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMarkets\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eOur very, very short-term early stock market indicator is indeterminable at this time and will depend on how Powell answers the questions.\u0026nbsp;This indicator, with a great track record, is popular among long term investors to stay in tune with the market and among short term traders to independently undertake quick trades.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eProtection Band And What To Do Now\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eIt is important for investors to look ahead and not in the rearview mirror.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eConsider continuing to hold good, very long term, existing positions. Based on individual risk preference, consider holding 21% - 39% in cash or Treasury bills or allocated to short-term tactical trades; and short to medium-term hedges of 3% - 6%, and short term hedges of 5% - 8%. This is a good way to protect yourself and participate in the upside at the same time.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eYou can determine your protection bands by adding cash to hedges.\u0026nbsp;The high band of the protection is appropriate for those who are older or conservative. The low band of the protection is appropriate for those who are younger or aggressive.\u0026nbsp; If you do not hedge, the total cash level should be more than stated above but significantly less than cash plus hedges.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eIt is worth reminding that you cannot take advantage of new upcoming opportunities if you are not holding enough cash.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003eWhen adjusting hedge levels, consider adjusting partial stop quantities for stock positions (non ETF); consider using wider stops on remaining quantities and also allowing more room for high beta stocks.\u0026nbsp;High beta stocks are the ones that move more than the market.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTraditional 60/40 Portfolio\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eProbability based risk reward adjusted for inflation does not favor long duration strategic bond allocation at this time.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThose who want to stick to traditional 60% allocation to stocks and 40% to bonds may consider focusing on only high quality bonds and bonds of five year duration or less.\u0026nbsp; Those willing to bring sophistication to their investing may consider using bond ETFs as tactical positions and not strategic positions at this time.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n ","symbols":["BLK","F","GM","RIVN","TSLA"],"source":"benzinga"}]

buy Tesla stock, adding another $10B in market capitalization for a total\u0026nbsp;add\u0026nbsp;of $50B.\u0026nbsp;(Some bulls will contend that part of the rise was due to India news, but that is news.\u0026nbsp;This is on top of $240B in market capitalization investors added on Ford and General Motors news prior to Rivian news.\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\t\u003cli\u003eRivian hardly has any vehicles on the road.\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\t\u003cli\u003eEven in an optimistic scenario, Rivian will likely\u0026nbsp;add\u0026nbsp;less than $50M\u0026nbsp;to Tesla\u0026rsquo;s profit.\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\t\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eThe sum total is that in an optimistic scenario, a profit of less than $50M\u0026nbsp;added $50B in market capitalization.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\t\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cul\u003e\r\n\t\u003cli\u003ePrudent investors should ask a very simple members of The Arora Report with a significant edge in the markets.\u0026nbsp; It is not extremely positive yet.\u0026nbsp; When sentiment turns extremely positive, it is a contrary signal.\u0026nbsp; In plain English, this means a sell signal.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePowell important for investors to look ahead and not in the rearview mirror.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eConsider continuing to hold good, very long term, existing positions. Based on individual risk preference, consider holding 21% - 39% in cash or Treasury bills or allocated to short-term tactical trades; and short to medium-term hedges of 3% - 6%, and short term hedges of 5% - 8%. This is a good way to protect yourself and participate in the upside at the same time.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eYou can determine your protection bands by adding cash to hedges.\u0026nbsp;The high band of the protection is appropriate for those who are older or conservative. The low band of the protection is appropriate for those who are younger or aggressive.\u0026nbsp; If you do not hedge, the total cash level should be more than stated above but significantly less than cash plus hedges.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eIt is worth reminding that you cannot take advantage of new upcoming opportunities if you are not holding enough cash.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003eWhen adjusting hedge levels, consider adjusting partial stop quantities for stock positions (non ETF); consider using wider stops on remaining quantities and also allowing more room for high beta stocks.\u0026nbsp;High beta stocks are the ones that move more than the market.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTraditional 60/40 Portfolio\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eProbability based risk reward adjusted for inflation does not favor long duration strategic bond allocation at this time.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThose who want to stick to traditional 60% allocation to stocks and 40% to bonds may consider focusing on only high quality bonds and bonds of five year duration or less.\u0026nbsp; Those willing to bring sophistication to their investing may consider using bond ETFs as tactical positions and not strategic positions at this time.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n ","symbols":["BLK","BTCUSD","F","GM","RIVN","TSLA"],"source":"benzinga"}]

[{"T":"n","id":32954019,"headline":"Executive Left Six-Figure Role To Pursue Happiness, Ended Up A Billionaire","summary":" ","author":"AJ Fabino","created_at":"2023-06-21T18:30:01Z","updated_at":"2023-06-21T18:30:02Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/general/entertainment/23/06/32954019/executive-left-six-figure-role-to-pursue-happiness-ended-up-a-billionaire","content":"\u003cp\u003eBenzinga has covered the age-old question of \u0026#8220;Can money buy happiness?\u0026#8221; extensively, through multiple written pieces and research, \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32782801/unraveling-the-money-happiness-myth-insights-from-yales-science-of-well-being-course\"\u003ehere\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/general/entertainment/23/06/32749675/are-you-a-karate-kid-or-a-gossip-girl-heres-how-much-money-you-need-to-be-happy\"\u003ehere\u003c/a\u003e, and \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32835261/can-money-buy-happiness-heres-what-shark-tank-star-matt-higgins-says\"\u003ehere\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eSo far, our research says yes, though there is a plateau in terms of happiness associated with earnings, and the situation isn't one-size-fits-all. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eEric Yuan\u003c/strong\u003e — the mind behind \u003cstrong\u003eZoom Video Communications Inc\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/ZM#NASDAQ\"\u003eZM\u003c/a\u003e) — tells a story about how happiness trumped earnings, and in the end, success still followed.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eBefore he reached billionaire status with the success of Zoom, Yuan was an immigrant from China striving to make his dreams come true in Silicon Valley.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eYuan\u0026#8217;s fascination with Silicon Valley was spurred when he heard a speech delivered by \u003cstrong\u003eMicrosoft Corp.\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/MSFT#NASDAQ\"\u003eMSFT\u003c/a\u003e) founder \u003cstrong\u003eBill Gates\u003c/strong\u003e, in which he detailed the promise of the future internet.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eDespite facing several setbacks and eight visa rejections, Yuan never lost sight of his dream to set foot in Silicon Valley. On his ninth attempt, at 27 years old, he obtained a U.S. visa and made his way to the U.S. in 1997, \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/08/21/zoom-founder-left-job-because-he-wasnt-happy-became-billionaire.html?utm_content=makeit\u0026amp;utm_medium=Social\u0026amp;utm_source=Facebook\u0026amp;fbclid=IwAR18yXpbx20wm0CMFQ2BmPIwAhhHnjw9MVO9SLEA4BfburoFW2PwWmCYPsU\"\u003eaccording to\u003c/a\u003e an article by CNBC.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eYuan spoke no English but had a talent for writing computer code.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eCoding landed him a position at WebEx, a video conferencing software company that was acquired by \u003cstrong\u003eCisco Systems Inc\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/CSCO#NASDAQ\"\u003eCSCO\u003c/a\u003e) for $3.2 billion, with Yuan earning a \u0026#8220;very high six-figure\u0026#8221; salary as the tech giant\u0026#8217;s vice president of engineering.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eHe found himself unhappy.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eYuan felt the product he helped build at WebEx wasn\u0026#8217;t advancing quickly enough. The system, in his view, became burdensome for customers, leading him to believe that there was a need for more accessible and efficient mobile video conferencing software.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThough to build his product, he had to abandon his high-paying job at Cisco and venture into the uncertainty of building a startup.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cem\u003eRead Also: \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32932387/warren-buffetts-son-cashed-out-90k-in-berkshire-stock-to-buy-time-its-worth-300m-now-but-heres-why-h\"\u003eWarren Buffett\u0026#8217;s Son Cashed Out $90K In Berkshire Stock To \u0026#8216;Buy Time\u0026#8217; — It\u0026#8217;s Worth $300M Now, But Here\u0026#8217;s Why He Doesn\u0026#8217;t Regret It\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWhile risky to some, Yuan attributed leaving Cisco to pursue his own happiness. \"The purpose of life is to pursue happiness, and I was not happy. Then what's the risk?\"\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eHis pursuit led him to establish Zoom in 2011.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eDespite the crowded video conferencing market dominated by major players, he managed to secure funding from angel investors, including fellow former Cisco executive \u003cstrong\u003eDan Scheinman\u003c/strong\u003e, who backed Yuan\u0026#8217;s vision with a $250,000 investment.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe company launched its first product in 2013, which quickly gained traction with more than 3,500 businesses using Zoom within five months of its launch. By 2015, the number of companies using Zoom ballooned to around 65,000.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eZoom\u0026#8217;s rise to success wasn\u0026#8217;t without hurdles, either. It experienced steep backlash just two months after its IPO in April 2019 due to security vulnerabilities in its software.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eHurdles aside, Yuan\u0026#8217;s remaining 7.7% stake in Zoom is worth more than $1.54 billion, a pretty big leap from his six-figure salary at Cisco.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWhile his journey from an unhappy executive to a successful entrepreneur made him a billionaire — and he is happy.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cem\u003eRead Next: \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/general/education/22/03/26242201/if-you-invested-1-000-in-zoom-video-stock-at-its-pandemic-low-heres-how-much-youd-have-now\"\u003eIf You Invested $1,000 In Zoom Video Stock At Its Pandemic Low, Here\u0026#8217;s How Much You\u0026#8217;d Have Now\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eThis article is part of the \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/topic/benzinga-inspire\"\u003eBenzinga Inspire\u003c/a\u003e series. \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003ePhotos: Courtesy Zoom\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["CSCO","MSFT","ZM"],"source":"benzinga"}]

background:transparent; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eits quantum supercomputer\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;using the topological qubits the company\u0026rsquo;s researchers have worked on for a few years.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe company believes that it will take fewer than ten years to build a\u0026nbsp;\u003ca class=\"editor-rtfLink\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32941321/cisco-launches-power-efficient-networking-chips-takes-on-broadcom-and-marvell-in-ai-arena\" style=\"color:#4a6ee0; background:transparent; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ecites\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;Krysta Svore, Microsoft\u0026rsquo;s VP.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eMicrosoft is introducing new measurements as the industry looks to move beyond the current era of noisy intermediate-scale quantum (NISQ) computing.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\u003cem\u003eAlso Read:\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/em\u003e\u003ca class=\"editor-rtfLink\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/04/31863344/microsoft-wants-to-run-chatgpt-on-its-own-chips-to-drive-performance-cost-efficiency-testing-since-2\" style=\"color:#4a6ee0; background:transparent; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt\" target=\"_blank\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eMicrosoft Wants To Run ChatGPT On Its Own Chips To Drive Performance, Cost Efficiency - Testing Since 2019\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eIn 2022, Microsoft announced a breakthrough when its team first highlighted its ability to create Majorana-based qubits. Majorana qubits are relatively stable (especially compared to traditional techniques), but they are also challenging to develop. Microsoft made an early bet on this technology.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe company claims to be at the foundational implementation level. To reach the next step or the resilient level, it will take a quantum computer to perform those one million reliable quantum operations per second and a failure rate of one per trillion operations, Svore said.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe next step now is to build hardware-protected qubits. These qubits will be small (less than 10 microns on a side) and fast enough to perform one qubit operation in less than a microsecond.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eAfter that, the team plans to entangle these qubits and operate them through braiding. From there, Microsoft proposes to build a smaller multi-qubit system and demonstrate a complete quantum system.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eMicrosoft also announced Azure Quantum Elements, its platform for accelerating scientific discovery by combining high-performance computing, AI, and quantum, and Copilot for Azure Quantum. This specially trained AI model can help scientists (and students) generate quantum-related calculations and simulations.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe stock is up over 39% YTD thanks to its\u0026nbsp;\u003ca class=\"editor-rtfLink\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/05/32192992/microsofts-premium-chatgpt-service-set-to-supercharge-azure-growth-analyst-predicts-even-wider-lead\" style=\"color:#4a6ee0; background:transparent; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt\" target=\"_blank\"\u003esuccess with ChatGPT\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePrice Action:\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;MSFT shares traded lower by 1.00% at $334.63 on the last check Wednesday.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n ","symbols":["MSFT"],"source":"benzinga"}]

Featuring visionOS\u0026trade;, the world\u0026#39;s first spatial operating system, Vision Pro lets users interact with digital content in their physical space using the most natural and intuitive inputs possible \u0026mdash; their eyes, hands, and voice. Starting today, Apple\u0026#39;s global community of developers will be able to create an entirely new class of spatial computing apps that take full advantage of the infinite canvas in Vision Pro and seamlessly blend digital content with the physical world to enable extraordinary new experiences. With the visionOS SDK, developers can utilize the powerful and unique capabilities of Vision Pro and visionOS to design brand-new app experiences across a variety of categories including productivity, design, gaming, and more.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eNext month, Apple will open developer labs in Cupertino, London, Munich, Shanghai, Singapore, and Tokyo to provide developers with hands-on experience to test their apps on Apple Vision Pro hardware and get support from Apple engineers. Development teams will also be able to apply for developer kits to help them quickly build, iterate, and test right on Apple Vision Pro.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;Apple Vision Pro redefines what\u0026#39;s possible on a computing platform. Developers can get started building visionOS apps using the powerful frameworks they already know, and take their development even further with new innovative tools and technologies like Reality Composer Pro, to design all-new experiences for their users,\u0026quot; said Susan Prescott, Apple\u0026#39;s vice president of Worldwide Developer Relations. \u0026quot;By taking advantage of the space around the user, spatial computing unlocks new opportunities for our developers, and enables them to imagine new ways to help their users connect, be productive, and enjoy new types of entertainment. We can\u0026#39;t wait to see what our developer community dreams up.\u0026quot;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eDevelopers can build new experiences that take advantage of the groundbreaking features of Apple Vision Pro by using the same foundational frameworks they already know from other Apple platforms, including powerful technologies like Xcode\u0026reg;, SwiftUI\u0026reg;, RealityKit\u0026reg;, ARKit\u0026reg;, and TestFlight\u0026reg;. These tools enable developers to create new types of apps that span a spectrum of immersion, including windows, which have depth and can showcase 3D content; volumes, which create experiences that are viewable from any angle; and spaces, which can fully immerse a user in an environment with unbounded 3D content. To help developers optimize 3D content for their visionOS apps and games, an all-new tool available with Xcode called Reality Composer Pro\u0026trade; lets them preview and prepare 3D models, animations, images, and sounds, so they look amazing on Vision Pro. Developers can also interact with their apps in the new visionOS simulator to explore and test various room layouts and lighting conditions. And every developer framework comes with built-in support for Apple\u0026#39;s innovative accessibility features to ensure spatial computing and visionOS apps are accessible to everyone.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eStarting next month, developers who have been building 3D apps and games with Unity\u0026#39;s robust authoring tools can port their Unity apps to Apple Vision Pro and take full advantage of its powerful capabilities.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eDevelopers who have previewed the visionOS SDK and APIs are excited for the potential of the platform and how it will enable them to create all-new app experiences for their users:\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;With Apple Vision Pro,\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eComplete HeartX\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003ewill help prepare medical students for clinical practice by using hyper-realistic 3D models and animations that help them understand and visualize medical issues, such as ventricular fibrillation, and how to apply their knowledge with patients,\u0026quot; said Jan Herzhoff, Elsevier Health\u0026#39;s president. \u0026quot;Learning through Complete HeartX on Apple Vision Pro will transform medical education and prepare future health professionals for practice.\u0026quot;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;The\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003edjay\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;app on Apple Vision Pro puts a fully featured DJ system right at a user\u0026#39;s fingertips. With a reimagined spatial interface, anyone can mix their favorite music and apply real-time effects using just their eyes and hands,\u0026quot; said Karim Morsy, Algoriddim\u0026#39;s CEO. \u0026quot;Whether for a beginner or a seasoned professional, djay on Vision Pro transforms the user\u0026#39;s surroundings with stunning environments that automatically react to their mix, enabling them to experience and interact with music in ways never before possible.\u0026quot;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;\u003cstrong\u003eJigSpace\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003eand Apple Vision Pro empower people and businesses to easily communicate their ideas or products in all-new ways,\u0026quot; said Zac Duff, JigSpace\u0026#39;s cofounder and CEO. \u0026quot;It uses the high-resolution CAD files companies already have, so their marketing, sales, product, or support teams can securely collaborate with colleagues or customers from anywhere in the world and get people to that \u0026lsquo;Aha!\u0026#39; moment in a fraction of the time it usually takes. This level of fast, effective communication simply wasn\u0026#39;t possible before.\u0026quot;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;Manufacturers can use AR solutions from\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003ePTC\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;to collaborate on critical business problems by bringing interactive 3D content into the real world \u0026mdash; from a single product, to an entire production line,\u0026quot; said Stephen Prideaux-Ghee, PTC\u0026#39;s chief technology officer of AR/VR. \u0026quot;With Apple Vision Pro, stakeholders across departments and in different locations can review content simultaneously to make design and operation decisions. This capability will unlock a level of collaboration previously not possible.\u0026quot;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe visionOS SDK, updated Xcode, Simulator, and Reality Composer Pro are available for Apple Developer Program members at\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink\u0026amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Fdeveloper.apple.com%2F\u0026amp;esheet=53428045\u0026amp;newsitemid=20230621680058\u0026amp;lan=en-US\u0026amp;anchor=developer.apple.com\u0026amp;index=2\u0026amp;md5=8a370a300a040042504851c777534e5b\"\u003edeveloper.apple.com\u003c/a\u003e. Registered Apple developers have access to a variety of resources to help them design, develop, and test apps for Apple Vision Pro, including extensive technical documentation, new design kits, and updated human interface guidelines for visionOS.\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["AAPL"],"source":"benzinga"}]
