[{"T":"n","id":32956062,"headline":"Rivian Brings Tesla Another Step Closer To Changing The Charging Standard","summary":"On Tuesday, Amazon.com Inc (NASDAQ: AMZN)-backed EV maker Rivian Automotive Inc (NASDAQ: RIVN) revealed it is following the footsteps of legendary automakers Ford Motor (NYSE: F) and Gen","author":"Upwallstreet","created_at":"2023-06-21T20:15:02Z","updated_at":"2023-06-21T20:15:03Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/23/06/32956062/rivian-brings-tesla-another-step-closer-to-changing-the-charging-standard","content":"\u003cp\u003eOn Tuesday, Amazon.com Inc (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/AMZN#NASDAQ\"\u003eAMZN\u003c/a\u003e)-backed EV maker Rivian Automotive Inc (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/RIVN#NASDAQ\"\u003eRIVN\u003c/a\u003e) revealed it is following the footsteps of legendary automakers Ford Motor (NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/F#NYSE\"\u003eF\u003c/a\u003e) and General Motors (NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/GM#NYSE\"\u003eGM\u003c/a\u003e) in adopting the charging standard of the EV king, Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/TSLA#NASDAQ\"\u003eTSLA\u003c/a\u003e). As Rivian adds momentum to Tesla\u0026rsquo;s quest to change the industry standard, its drivers will get to benefit from the biggest charging network in the U.S. as well as from what drivers evaluated as\u0026nbsp;the most efficient chargers. Rivian\u0026rsquo;s shares rose 5.5% upon the news.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003eRivian Gets Access To Tesla Superchargers\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eFrom next spring, Rivian drivers will gain access to 12,000 Tesla Superchargers in the United States and Canada, with the help of a special adapter. According to the US Department of Energy, Tesla\u0026rsquo;s supercharging infrastructure makes about 60% of the fast-charging network in the U.S. so Rivian drivers are in for a great treat. Moreover, as of 2025, Rivian will be adding Tesla standardized charging port on its EVs.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003eRivian Will Continue Building Its Charging Network\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe maker of the\u0026nbsp;R1T electric pickup truck and the electric R1S SUV, will continue expanding its own fast-charging network, but it will adopt Tesla-standardized plugs which means Rivian\u0026rsquo;s in for a significant revenue source from Tesla owners.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003eFinally Good News For Rivian\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eLike any startup, Rivian has been having a hard time getting its business on track. It has recently been revisiting the exclusivity agreement with its largest shareholder, Amazon, as its production capabilities outpaced Amazon\u0026rsquo;s demand for new electric vans. Amazon is commited to 10,000 EV delivery vans per year, while Rivian insists that 10,000 units only meet the agred-upon annual minimum. Considering that the production line is all set up and running, Rivian needs Amazon to release it from the exclusivity agreement that was made in 2019 so it can sell its vans to others. Although it sells far less EVs compared to Tesla, Ford and GM, Rivian is one of the major players on the EV field. During the first quarter, it sold almost\u0026nbsp;8,000 EVs\u0026nbsp;while according to Cox Automotive, Ford\u0026rsquo;s sold almost 11,000 EVs and GM slightly exceeded 20,000 vehicles. This figure alone puts Rivian ahead of luxury brands such as BMW. Tesla remains king in EV sales with 161,000 sold EVs in the U.S. but unlike Rivian, it does not have an electric SUV and pickup truck with the Cybertruck only expected to reach the road by the end of the year.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003eA Series Of Wins For Tesla\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eAlso on Tuesday, Reuters reported that CEO of Hyundai Motor Company (OTC:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/HYMTF#OTC\"\u003eHYMTF\u003c/a\u003e), Jaehoon Chang, stated that the South Korean automaker is considering shifting to Tesla\u0026rsquo;s charging standard. Chang stated that the company is evaluating what is best for its customers but one clear issue is that Tesla\u0026rsquo;s current network of superchargers don\u0026rsquo;t allow the faster charging that Hyundai\u0026rsquo;s EVs can gain with other chargers so Tesla would need to be willing to make some adjustments for Hyundai to make this step. Since Ford jumped on Tesla\u0026rsquo;s charging wagon in late May, Tesla\u0026rsquo;s shares went up 40%.\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp;Moreover, these series of deals are helping Tesla benefit from\u0026nbsp;$7.5 billion in funding that the Biden administration provided to speed up the development of EV chargers in the U.S. For Tesla to qualify, it needed to open its charging network and it rebranded its charging technology as the North American Charging Standard. With this series\u0026nbsp;of agreements, Tesla seems to be quite close to changing the industry charging standard.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eDISCLAIMER: This content is for informational purposes only. It is not intended as investing advice.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n ","symbols":["AMZN","F","GM","HYMTF","RIVN","TSLA"],"source":"benzinga"}]

[{"T":"n","id":32968394,"headline":"A Look Into Apple\u0026#39;s Debt","summary":" ","author":"Benzinga Insights","created_at":"2023-06-22T14:45:22Z","updated_at":"2023-06-22T14:45:23Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32968394/a-look-into-apples-debt","content":"\u003cp\u003eShares of Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/AAPL#NASDAQ\"\u003eAAPL\u003c/a\u003e) moved higher by 17.86% in the past three months. Before having a look at the importance of debt, let's look at how much debt Apple has. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003eApple Debt\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAccording to the Apple's most recent balance sheet as reported on May 5, 2023, total debt is at $109.61 billion, with $97.04 billion in long-term debt and $12.57 billion in current debt. Adjusting for $24.69 billion in cash-equivalents, the company has a net debt of $84.93 billion. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eLet's define some of the terms we used in the paragraph above. \u003cstrong\u003eCurrent debt\u003c/strong\u003e is the portion of a company's debt which is due within 1 year, while \u003cstrong\u003elong-term debt\u003c/strong\u003e is the portion due in more than 1 year. \u003cstrong\u003eCash equivalents\u003c/strong\u003e includes cash and any liquid securities with maturity periods of 90 days or less. \u003cstrong\u003eTotal debt\u003c/strong\u003e equals current debt plus long-term debt minus cash equivalents. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eShareholders look at the debt-ratio to understand how much financial leverage a company has. Apple has $332.16 billion in total assets, therefore making the debt-ratio 0.33. As a rule of thumb, a debt-ratio more than 1 indicates that a considerable portion of debt is funded by assets. A higher debt-ratio can also imply that the company might be putting itself at risk for default, if interest rates were to increase. However, debt-ratios vary widely across different industries. A debt ratio of 35% might be higher for one industry, but average for another.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://www.benzinga.com/files/images/story/2023/1687445119_0.png\" alt=\"debt_fig\" /\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch2\u003eWhy Shareholders Look At Debt?\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eDebt is an important factor in the capital structure of a company, and can help it attain growth. Debt usually has a relatively lower financing cost than equity, which makes it an attractive option for executives.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eHowever, interest-payment obligations can have an adverse impact on the cash-flow of the company. Having financial leverage also allows companies to use additional capital for business operations, allowing equity owners to retain excess profit, generated by the debt capital.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eLooking for stocks with low debt-to-equity ratios? Check out Benzinga Pro, a market research platform which provides investors with near-instantaneous access to dozens of stock metrics - including debt-to-equity ratio. \u003ca href=\"https://pro.benzinga.com/\"\u003eClick here to learn more\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eThis article was generated by Benzinga's automated content engine and reviewed by an editor.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["AAPL"],"source":"benzinga"}]

[{"T":"n","id":32969046,"headline":"Toyota Turns To AI In An Effort To Catch Up In The EV Race","summary":"Undoubtedly, AI is the hottest topic of 2023 as there’s barely an industry not exploring the possibilities brought on by machine learning technologies.","author":"Upwallstreet","created_at":"2023-06-22T15:03:49Z","updated_at":"2023-06-22T15:03:49Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/23/06/32969046/toyota-turns-to-ai-in-an-effort-to-catch-up-in-the-ev-race","content":"\u003cp\u003eUndoubtedly, AI is the hottest topic of 2023 as there\u0026rsquo;s barely an industry not exploring the possibilities brought on by machine learning technologies. The automotive industry is no exception and Toyota Motor (NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/TM#NYSE\"\u003eTM\u003c/a\u003e) announced this week it will be using generative AI to develop its electric vehicles more quickly and efficiently.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003eToyota Will Combine Its Traditional Engineering With The Generative AI-based Car Design\u0026nbsp;\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eToyota Research Institute (TRI)\u0026nbsp;has developed a new algorithm that can help\u0026nbsp;speed up the\u0026nbsp;design process of new vehicles.\u0026nbsp;This technology will allow\u0026nbsp;engineers and designers to upload sketches\u0026nbsp;and through\u0026nbsp;text-based prompts, they will be able to\u0026nbsp;ask the system to optimize them\u0026nbsp;while respecting\u0026nbsp;engineering constraints.\u0026nbsp;This is an important milestone considering that generative AI has merely been used as an inspiration design-wise as the engineering and safety requirements that go into the actual design are far too complex to comprehend, as\u0026nbsp;Avinash Balachandran,TRI\u0026rsquo;s Human Interactive Driving division\u0026nbsp;director\u0026nbsp;explained. Moreover, this technique will specially be useful for the aerodynamic part of the design is essential for the vehicle\u0026rsquo;s energy efficiency. In simple words, TRI will be\u0026nbsp;using AI to\u0026nbsp;cut down the iterations needed to reconcile design and engineering considerations, helping Toyota make EVs faster with an increased efficiency.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003eLet\u0026rsquo;s Not Forget That AI Is At The Center Of Tesla\u0026rsquo;s Self-driving Software Technology\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eAlthough it seems like big news, AI is already a big part of Tesla\u0026rsquo;s EVs. The world seems to have forgotten that last September, Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/TSLA#NASDAQ\"\u003eTSLA\u003c/a\u003e) unveiled all kinds of developments on this front during its AI day, but more focus has been placed on Musk being among those who called for pause on this development, although he simply emphasized the need to minimize the probability of negative outcomes while fully acknowledging the positive potential of AI. Musk\u0026rsquo;s primary concern is the need to regulate the governance of AI, while Tesla, an EV company that is more about EV software than hardware, continues\u0026nbsp;rulling\u0026nbsp;on the EV front. According to Bloomberg, the EV king, Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/TSLA#NASDAQ\"\u003eTSLA\u003c/a\u003e) is projected to remain the top seller of EVs in the US through at least 2026 thanks to its discounting strategy. Besides the price war that helped Tesla renew demand for its vehicles, it seems the EV king has already won the charging war with Ford Motor (NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/F#NYSE\"\u003eF\u003c/a\u003e), General Motors (NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/GM#NYSE\"\u003eGM\u003c/a\u003e) and Rivian Automotive Inc (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/RIVN#NASDAQ\"\u003eRIVN\u003c/a\u003e) agreeing to adopt its charging technology. On Tuesday, Reuters reported that the state of Texas announced\u0026nbsp;that all new EV chargers built using federal funding will have to include Tesla\u0026rsquo;s charging port, named the North American Charging Standard (NACS).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003eCould AI Be The Key To The EV Jump?\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eOne thing is certain, the AI drum keeps on beating as only a\u0026nbsp;little less than a month ago, even Bayerische Motoren Werke Aktiengesellschaft (OTC:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/BMWYY#OTC\"\u003eBMWYY\u003c/a\u003e) admitted it is experimenting with the idea to use generative AI to design parts of its vehicles, such as wheels. Toyota certainly needs a helping hand to catch up an EV race it wants to win, and AI is a very powerful card to have in one\u0026rsquo;s deck. AI-assisted aerodynamic design is only one tool in the suite of new technologies that Toyota has equipped itself with, along with perhaps the most crucial, next-generation EV battery.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eDISCLAIMER: This content is for informational purposes only. It is not intended as investing advice.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n ","symbols":["BMWYY","F","GM","RIVN","TM","TSLA"],"source":"benzinga"}]

This surge is attributed to the success of OpenAI\u0026#8217;s \u003cstrong\u003eChatGPT\u003c/strong\u003e. Roles such as data scientist, software engineer, machine learning engineer, and data engineer were among the most sought after.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eImpact on the Tech Job Market\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis increase comes amidst a challenging time for the broader tech job market, with mass layoffs at companies like \u003cstrong\u003eMeta Platforms Inc. \u003c/strong\u003e(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/META#NASDAQ\"\u003eMETA\u003c/a\u003e) and Amazon.com Inc. Despite the overall tech jobs in the U.S. being down by 43.6% from June last year, the number of available AI jobs is not keeping pace with the interest from job seekers.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eIncreased Interest in Generative AI Jobs\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIndeed\u0026#8217;s data indicated that searches for generative AI jobs soared to 147 per million total jobs searched in May, up from virtually zero a year earlier. [{"T":"n","id":32970259,"headline":"Apple\u0026#39;s Vision Pro SDK Is Already Here For Developers: Gizmodo","summary":" ","author":"Benzinga Newsbot","created_at":"2023-06-22T15:49:41Z","updated_at":"2023-06-22T15:49:41Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32970259/apples-vision-pro-sdk-is-already-here-for-developers-gizmodo","content":"\u003cp\u003eApple is preparing for the launch of its Vision Pro headset in 2024 by releasing the software development kit (SDK) for the device and encouraging third-party developers to create apps for it, \u003ca href=\"https://gizmodo.com/apple-vision-pro-visionos-dev-access-open-1850564864\"\u003eGizmodo\u003c/a\u003e reports.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eOpening the Gates for Developers\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eOn Wednesday, \u003cstrong\u003eApple Inc.\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/AAPL#NASDAQ\"\u003eAAPL\u003c/a\u003e) announced that developers can now start creating their own \u0026#8220;spatial experiences,\u0026#8221; essentially virtual and augmented reality software, for the upcoming Vision Pro headset. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe company will be opening development labs in several countries, including the U.S., U.K., Germany, China, Taiwan, and Japan, for developers to test their apps on the Vision Pro hardware.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCreating Apps for Vision Pro\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eApple\u0026#8217;s VP of developer relations, Susan Prescott, assured that creating apps for the Vision Pro would be similar to coding on the company\u0026#8217;s other platforms, with foundational frameworks like Xcode, SwiftUI, ARKit, and TestFlight. The SDK and updated developer software are already available for those with an Apple Developer Program membership.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eExpectations for Vision Pro\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWhile Apple has showcased how the Vision Pro can be used with existing apps like FaceTime and Safari, the company is hoping that external developers will leverage the visionOS AR infrastructure to create innovative applications that push the hardware\u0026#8217;s capabilities. These people research company financial statements, sit in conference calls and meetings, and speak with relevant insiders to determine what are known as analyst ratings for stocks. Typically, analysts will rate each stock once a quarter. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eSome analysts will also offer forecasts for metrics like growth estimates, earnings, and revenue to provide further guidance on stocks. Investors who use analyst ratings should note that this specialized advice comes from humans and may be subject to error.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThis article was generated by Benzinga's automated content engine and reviewed by an editor.\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["AVGO"],"source":"benzinga"}]
[{"T":"n","id":32970648,"headline":"How To Earn $500 A Month From Intel Stock","summary":" ","author":"AJ Fabino","created_at":"2023-06-22T16:06:29Z","updated_at":"2023-06-22T16:06:30Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/news/large-cap/23/06/32970648/how-to-earn-500-a-month-from-intel-stock","content":"\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eIntel Corporation\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/INTC#NASDAQ\"\u003eINTC\u003c/a\u003e) on Wednesday announced that its manufacturing business will operate as a separate unit, causing shares to \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32952724/whats-going-on-with-intel-intc-shares\"\u003eslip into Thursday's session\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat Happened:\u003c/strong\u003e The Santa Clara, California-based tech giant is aiming to offer its manufacturing services to other companies, including competitors. Intel did not give clear guidelines on its scaling plan, or new external customers for the business.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIntel CFO \u003cstrong\u003eDavid Zinsner\u003c/strong\u003e says the company will adopt a customer-supplier relationship model with the manufacturing business. The company expects to become the second-largest foundry in 2024, generating more than $20 billion in manufacturing revenue.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eSummit Insights Group analyst \u003cstrong\u003eKinngai Chan\u003c/strong\u003e told Reuters that Intel\u0026#8217;s forecast lags behind \u003cstrong\u003eTaiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co\u0026#8217;s\u003c/strong\u003e (NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/TSM#NYSE\"\u003eTSM\u003c/a\u003e) expected sales of close to $85 billion in 2024.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026#8220;The presentation essentially tells investors that its current manufacturing is sub-scale and could remain sub-scale for a while,\u0026#8221; Chan said.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cem\u003eRead Also: \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32964479/micron-braces-for-semiconductor-assembly-and-test-facility-in-india-to-invest-up-to-825m\"\u003eMicron Braces For Semiconductor Assembly And Test Facility In India; To Invest Up To $825M\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eHowever, despite concerns, income-oriented investors may find Intel appealing due to its dividend yield of 1.53%.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eFor an investor looking to earn $500 per month from Intel dividends, we'll start with the $500 target, which translates to $6,000 per year ($500 x 12 months).\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eGiven Intel\u0026#8217;s 1.53% dividend yield, we divide the yearly target by the yield: $6,000 / 0.0153 = $392,156.86.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSo, an investor would need to own approximately 12,004 shares of Intel to generate a monthly dividend income of $500.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFor a more conservative goal of $100 per month ($1,200 annually), the calculation would be: $1,200 / 0.0153 = $78,431.37, or 2,399 shares to generate a monthly dividend income of $100.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eNote that dividend yield can change on a rolling basis, as the dividend payment and the stock price both fluctuate over time.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe dividend yield is calculated by dividing the annual dividend payment by the current stock price. As the stock price changes, the dividend yield will also change.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eFor example, if a stock pays an annual dividend of $2 and its price is $50, its dividend yield would be 4%. If the stock price increases to $60, the dividend yield would decrease to 3.33% ($2/$60).\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eConversely, if the stock price decreases to $40, the dividend yield would increase to 5% ($2/$40).\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eFurther, the dividend payment itself can also change over time, which can also impact the dividend yield. If a company increases its dividend payment, the dividend yield will increase even if the stock price remains the same. Similarly, if a company decreases its dividend payment, the dividend yield will decrease.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cem\u003eRead Next: \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/large-cap/23/06/32953828/how-to-earn-500-a-month-from-fedex-stock\"\u003eHow To Earn $500 A Month From FedEx Stock\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["INTC","TSM"],"source":"benzinga"}]

not in the rearview mirror.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eConsider continuing to hold good, very long term, existing positions. Based on individual risk preference, consider holding 21% - 39% in cash or Treasury bills or allocated to short-term tactical trades; and short to medium-term hedges of 3% - 6%, and short term hedges of 5% - 8%. This is a good way to protect yourself and participate in the upside at the same time.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eYou can determine your protection bands by adding cash to hedges.\u0026nbsp; The high band of the protection is appropriate for those who are older or conservative. The low band of the protection is appropriate for those who are younger or aggressive.\u0026nbsp; If you do not hedge, the total cash level should be more than stated above but significantly less than cash plus hedges.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eIt is worth reminding that you cannot take advantage of new upcoming opportunities if you are not holding enough cash.\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003eWhen adjusting hedge levels, consider adjusting partial stop quantities for stock positions (non ETF); consider using wider stops on remaining quantities and also allowing more room for high beta stocks.\u0026nbsp; High beta stocks are the ones that move more than the market.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTraditional 60/40 Portfolio\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eProbability based risk reward adjusted for inflation does not favor long duration strategic bond allocation at this time.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThose who want to stick to traditional 60% allocation to stocks and 40% to bonds may consider focusing on only high quality bonds and bonds of five year duration or less.\u0026nbsp; Those willing to bring sophistication to their investing may consider using bond ETFs as tactical positions and not strategic positions at this time.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eThe Arora Report is known for its accurate calls.\u0026nbsp; The Arora Report correctly called the 2008 financial crash, the start of a mega bull market in 2009, the COVID crash, the post-COVID bull market, and the 2022 bear market.\u0026nbsp; Please click here to sign up for a free forever \u003ca href=\"https://thearorareport.com/generate-wealth-newsletter\"\u003eGenerate Wealth Newsletter\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n ","symbols":["AMD","BLK","F","GM","NVDA","QQQ","RIVN","SMH","SPY","TSLA","WT"],"source":"benzinga"}]

Power\u0026#39;s","author":"Benzinga Newsdesk","created_at":"2023-06-22T16:19:37Z","updated_at":"2023-06-22T16:19:37Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32970935/tesla-rivian-lucid-and-polestar-fill-bottom-spots-in-initial-quality-study","content":"\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://insideevs.com/news/673294/tesla-rivian-polestar-lucid-score-low-initial-quality-study/\"\u003ehttps://insideevs.com/news/673294/tesla-rivian-polestar-lucid-score-low-initial-quality-study/\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eAll the major EV-only manufacturers that have a presence in the United States have ranked very poorly in J.D. Power's Initial Quality Study 2023, which analyzes what problems arise in the early ownership period of a new vehicle. The results of this year's study are based on responses from 93,380 purchasers and lessees of new 2023 model-year vehicles who were surveyed early in their ownership.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://insideevs.com/tesla/\"\u003eTesla\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\"https://insideevs.com/rivian/\"\u003eRivian\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\"https://insideevs.com/lucid/\"\u003eLucid\u003c/a\u003e, and \u003ca href=\"https://insideevs.com/polestar/\"\u003ePolestar\u003c/a\u003e have ranked at the bottom spots of the chart, with the worst score going to Lucid Motors, which got a result of 340 problems per 100 vehicles (PP100).\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eThe whole EV manufacturer picture is as follows:\u003c/p\u003e\u003cul\u003e\u003cli\u003eTesla Motors: 257 PP100\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eRivian Motors: 282 PP100\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003ePolestar: 313 PP100\u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eLucid Motors: 340 PP100\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\u003cp\u003eTesla saw an increase of 31 PP100 year over year, while Polestar improved 15 PP100. At the same time, Rivian and Lucid Motors were both included in this year's study for the first time. However, J.D. Power notes that all four carmakers are not officially ranked amongst other brands in the study as they do not meet ranking criteria.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eThe data analytics company says that, unlike other car manufacturers, Tesla, Rivian, Polestar, and Lucid do not grant it permission to survey its owners in states where authorization is required. As a result, a score was calculated based on a sample of surveys from owners in other states where authorization is not required.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eCompared to the top three brands ranked in this year's Initial Quality Study, the four EV makers are lagging quite a lot: \u003ca href=\"https://insideevs.com/dodge/\"\u003eDodge\u003c/a\u003e is on the first spot, with 140 PP100, followed by \u003ca href=\"https://insideevs.com/ram/\"\u003eRam\u003c/a\u003e with 141 PP100 and, rather surprisingly, \u003ca href=\"https://insideevs.com/alfa-romeo/tonale/\"\u003eAlfa Romeo\u003c/a\u003e with 143 PP100.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eJ.D. Power notes that all new vehicles are becoming more problematic, with 12 problems per 100 vehicles more this year than in 2022 and 30 more PP100 compared to 2021. Among the issues mentioned by owners and lessees have to do with simple things like poor-sounding horns, cup holders that don't serve their purpose, and the use of much more technology in general.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eDoor handles are also increasingly problematic as manufacturers are trying to redesign them and make them stand-out features. The survey says that owners are having issues with high-tech approaches to this basic function and that seven out of the 10 most problematic models in this area are battery electric vehicles (BEVs), without going into detail.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e\u003cp\u003e\"The automotive industry is facing a wide range of quality problems, a phenomenon not seen in the 37-year history of the IQS,\" said Frank Hanley, senior director of auto benchmarking at J.D. Power. \"The industry is at a major crossroad and the path each manufacturer chooses is paramount for its future. From persistent problems carrying over from years past to an increase in new types of problems, today's new vehicles are more complex—offering new and exciting technology—but not always satisfying owners.\"\u003c/p\u003e\u003c/blockquote\u003e\u003cp\u003eThe US Initial Quality Study, now in its 37th year, is based on a 223-question survey organized into nine vehicle categories: infotainment, features, controls and displays, exterior, driving assistance, interior, powertrain, seats, driving experience, and climate.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eAs always, we'd like to know what you think about this, so head over to the comments section below to give us your thoughts.\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["LCID","PSNY","RIVN","TSLA"],"source":"benzinga"}]

[{"T":"n","id":32971151,"headline":"Price Over Earnings Overview: Apple","summary":" ","author":"Benzinga Insights","created_at":"2023-06-22T16:31:07Z","updated_at":"2023-06-22T16:31:08Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32971151/price-over-earnings-overview-apple","content":"\u003cp\u003eIn the current session, the stock is trading at $185.78, after a \u003cstrong\u003e0.99%\u003c/strong\u003e increase. Over the past month, \u003cstrong\u003eApple Inc. (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/AAPL#NASDAQ\"\u003eAAPL\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/strong\u003e stock increased by \u003cstrong\u003e7.39%\u003c/strong\u003e, and in the past year, by \u003cstrong\u003e31.15%\u003c/strong\u003e. With performance like this, long-term shareholders are optimistic but others are more likely to look into the price-to-earnings ratio to see if the stock might be overvalued.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://www.benzinga.com/files/images/story/2023/1687451463_0.png\" alt=\"Past Year Chart\" /\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch3\u003eEvaluating Apple P/E in Comparison to Its Peers\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe P/E ratio measures the current share price to the company's EPS. It is used by long-term investors to analyze the company's current performance against it's past earnings, historical data and aggregate market data for the industry or the indices, such as S\u0026amp;P 500. A higher P/E indicates that investors expect the company to perform better in the future, and the stock is probably overvalued, but not necessarily. It also could indicate that investors are willing to pay a higher share price currently, because they expect the company to perform better in the upcoming quarters. This leads investors to also remain optimistic about rising dividends in the future. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eCompared to the aggregate P/E ratio of the \u003cstrong\u003e75.12\u003c/strong\u003e in the Technology Hardware, Storage \u0026amp; Peripherals industry, Apple Inc. has a lower P/E ratio of \u003cstrong\u003e31.36\u003c/strong\u003e. Shareholders might be inclined to think that  the stock might perform worse than it's industry peers. It's also possible that the stock is undervalued. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://www.benzinga.com/files/images/story/2023/1687451464_1.png\" alt=\"Guage\" /\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIn conclusion, the price-to-earnings ratio is a useful metric for analyzing a company's market performance, but it has its limitations. While a lower P/E can indicate that a company is undervalued, it can also suggest that shareholders do not expect future growth. Additionally, the P/E ratio should not be used in isolation, as other factors such as industry trends and business cycles can also impact a company's stock price. Therefore, investors should use the P/E ratio in conjunction with other financial metrics and qualitative analysis to make informed investment decisions. \u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["AAPL"],"source":"benzinga"}]

not in the rearview mirror.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eConsider continuing to hold good, very long term, existing positions. Based on individual risk preference, consider holding 21% - 39% in cash or Treasury bills or allocated to short-term tactical trades; and short to medium-term hedges of 3% - 6%, and short term hedges of 5% - 8%. This is a good way to protect yourself and participate in the upside at the same time.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eYou can determine your protection bands by adding cash to hedges.\u0026nbsp; The high band of the protection is appropriate for those who are older or conservative. The low band of the protection is appropriate for those who are younger or aggressive.\u0026nbsp; If you do not hedge, the total cash level should be more than stated above but significantly less than cash plus hedges.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eIt is worth reminding that you cannot take advantage of new upcoming opportunities if you are not holding enough cash.\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003eWhen adjusting hedge levels, consider adjusting partial stop quantities for stock positions (non ETF); consider using wider stops on remaining quantities and also allowing more room for high beta stocks.\u0026nbsp; High beta stocks are the ones that move more than the market.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTraditional 60/40 Portfolio\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eProbability based risk reward adjusted for inflation does not favor long duration strategic bond allocation at this time.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThose who want to stick to traditional 60% allocation to stocks and 40% to bonds may consider focusing on only high quality bonds and bonds of five year duration or less.\u0026nbsp; Those willing to bring sophistication to their investing may consider using bond ETFs as tactical positions and not strategic positions at this time.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eThe Arora Report is known for its accurate calls.\u0026nbsp; The Arora Report correctly called the 2008 financial crash, the start of a mega bull market in 2009, the COVID crash, the post-COVID bull market, and the 2022 bear market.\u0026nbsp; Please click here to sign up for a free forever \u003ca href=\"https://thearorareport.com/generate-wealth-newsletter\"\u003eGenerate Wealth Newsletter\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n  ","symbols":["AMD","BLK","BTCUSD","F","GM","NVDA","QQQ","RIVN","SMH","SPY","TSLA","WT"],"source":"benzinga"}]

The stock\u0026nbsp;now makes up a large portion of the \u003cstrong\u003eBerkshire Hathaway Inc\u003c/strong\u003e (NYSE: \u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/brk-a#NYSE\"\u003eBRK-A\u003c/a\u003e)(NYSE: \u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/brk-b#NYSE\"\u003eBRK-B\u003c/a\u003e) portfolio.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHere\u0026rsquo;s a look at how shares of the technology giant have performed since the \u0026quot;Oracle of Omaha\u0026rsquo;s\u0026quot; purchase was disclosed.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat Happened: \u003c/strong\u003eLegendary investor \u003cstrong\u003eWarren Buffett\u003c/strong\u003e unveiled a 9.8 million purchase of Apple shares on\u003cstrong\u003e May 16, 2016\u003c/strong\u003e. The shares were purchased by Berkshire Hathaway, the \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/16/05/7985349/berkshire-hathaway-just-reported-9-8-million-share-stake-in-apple\"\u003econglomerate led by Buffett.\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe Apple shares were bought at an average price of $27.25 at the time, or around $6.81 adjusted for a 2020 stock split. The initial stake purchased by Buffett was around $1.1 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eBuffett \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/general/biotech/21/02/19694882/warren-buffetts-berkshire-cuts-apple-stake-and-buys-these-drugmaker-telecom-stocks-instead\"\u003etrimmed part of the Apple stock position\u003c/a\u003e in 2021, taking some gains from the investment in the technology giant.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSince that time, Buffett has added to the Apple position making it one of the biggest pieces in the Berkshire\u0026nbsp;Hathaway portfolio and making the company one of the biggest owners of Apple shares.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eIn the \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/trading-ideas/long-ideas/23/02/30916971/warren-buffetts-berkshire-hathaway-bites-more-into-apple-stock-in-q4-makes-massive-stake\"\u003efourth quarter of 2022\u003c/a\u003e, Berkshire Hathaway added to its Apple stake, buying over 333,000 shares.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eIn the first quarter of 2023, Berkshire Hathaway\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/markets/equities/23/05/32409090/warren-buffett-trims-activision-blizzard-adds-capital-one-in-q1-what-investors-need-to-know\"\u003eincreased its holdings\u003c/a\u003e of Apple, adding an additional 20,424,207 shares.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eAt the end of the first quarter, Berkshire Hathaway owned 915,560,382 Apple shares. This makes the investment worth around 46% of the company\u0026#39;s investment portfolio, worth around $170 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eRelated Link: \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32698111/nvidia-recently-hit-a-1-trillion-market-cap-which-stock-is-next-to-join-club-heres-what-benzinga-use\"\u003eNvidia Recently Hit A $1 Trillion Market Cap, Which Stock Is Next To Join Club?\u0026nbsp;\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eInvesting $1,000 With Buffett: \u003c/strong\u003eAn investor who chose on May 16, 2016, the Berkshire Hathaway filing date, to buy a stake in Apple has done quite well.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eShares of Apple traded between $22.91 and $23.85 on May 16, 2016. An investment of $1,000 at the day\u0026rsquo;s high could have bought 10.48 shares of Apple.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eA four-for-one stock split by Apple in August 2020 would have taken 10.48 shares of Apple to 41.92 shares.\u003cstrong\u003e Those 41.92 shares of Apple would be valued at $7,811.79 at the time of writing, based on a share price of $186.35 for AAPL.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThis represents a hypothetical return of 681.2% over the last seven years, one that has outperformed the overall stock market.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eThe SPDR S\u0026amp;P 500 ETF Trust, which tracks the S\u0026amp;P 500, would have seen a $1,000 investment turn into $2,392.01 over the same time period. \u003c/strong\u003eThis represents a hypothetical return of 139.2% over the same time period.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eBuffett has been recognized for his value investing strategy. Some may have seen his investment in Apple as a rare one, given his preference for value over growth and his typical shyness to technology stocks. Investors who followed his investment are likely thankful they did.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eRead Next: \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/general/movers-shakers/21/08/17298128/warren-buffett-turns-91-a-highlight-for-each-decade-of-his-life\"\u003eA Highlight For Each Decade Of Warren Buffett\u0026#39;s Life\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003ePhotos: Shutterstock\u003c/em\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\r\n\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n","symbols":["AAPL","BRK-A","BRK-B","SPY"],"source":"benzinga"}]

Rogan is a commentator for the UFC.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eCoincidentally, the UFC has a connection to Musk, which could put the company\u0026nbsp;in the driver\u0026rsquo;s seat to land the fight.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe UFC is owned by \u003cstrong\u003eEndeavor Group Holdings \u003c/strong\u003e(NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/EDR#NYSE\"\u003eEDR\u003c/a\u003e), which \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/21/04/20852228/ufc-wme-parent-endeavor-ipo-what-investors-need-to-know\"\u003ewent public in 2021\u003c/a\u003e. Benzinga\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/22/04/26501545/did-elon-musks-twitter-stake-board-appointment-coincide-with-his-exit-from-another-company\"\u003e previously reported that\u003c/a\u003e Musk was on the Board of Directors of Endeavor before stepping down. Musk also\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/22/06/27761407/elon-musk-just-exercised-stock-options-in-this-company-and-no-it-wasnt-tesla\"\u003e once owned shares\u003c/a\u003e of Endeavor Group, but it is unclear if he remains a shareholder today.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eSports Business Journal reporter \u003cstrong\u003eAdam Stern \u003c/strong\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/A_S12/status/1671925542013091844\"\u003esaid \u003c/a\u003eThursday that UFC President \u003cstrong\u003eDana White\u003c/strong\u003e has been in contact with Musk and Zuckerberg, according to a UFC spokesperson.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/general/sports-betting/23/05/32552843/exclusive-how-jake-paul-joey-levy-are-positioning-betr-as-the-robinhood-of-gambling-indust\"\u003eBetr co-founder\u003c/a\u003e \u003cstrong\u003eJake Paul \u003c/strong\u003epitched Musk on the fight as well. Paull said he would gladly promote the fight against Zuckerberg and pitched doing it with the PFL (Professional Fighters League), which he is signed with.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026ldquo;We can do it in the PFL on ESPN+ for charity,\u0026rdquo; Paul \u003ca href=\"http://twitter.com/jakepaul/status/1671691706331176960\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe PFL has a deal with ESPN, which is owned by \u003cstrong\u003eThe Walt Disney Company \u003c/strong\u003e(NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/DIS#NYSE\"\u003eDIS\u003c/a\u003e), through 2023 and the option of a renewal.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eGiven that Musk and Zuckerberg each own social media networks, the rights to the fight could become an issue raised, with Twitter and Facebook being potential homes of the highly anticipated fight.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eRelated Link:\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32806833/despite-elon-musks-critique-mark-zuckerberg-admires-his-actions-at-twitter\"\u003e Despite Elon Musk\u0026#39;s Critique, Mark Zuckerberg Admires His Actions At Twitter\u0026nbsp;\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003ePhoto: Shutterstock\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eThe Potential Matchup:\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;Musk is the richest person in the world, valued at $232 billion, and Zuckerberg ranks tenth at $103 billion according to \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/billionaires/\"\u003eBloomberg\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eShareholders of the public companies they run could also be worried about any potential injuries or distractions. Shares of Tesla and Meta Platforms are up 142% and 124% respectively year-to-date. Tesla is the seventh-largest public company in the world, with a market capitalization of $829 billion. Meta ranks ninth at $718 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe potential cage match would see two opponents that could be opposites when it comes to working out and fighting enter the ring.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eZuckerberg is\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/general/entertainment/23/05/32270576/mark-zuckerberg-delivers-epic-beatdown-at-first-brazilian-jiu-jitsu-tournament-this-nerd-is\"\u003e trained in \u003c/a\u003ejiu-jitsu\u0026nbsp;and previously competed in a tournament where he was named the winner.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;Competed in my first jiu-jitsu tournament and won some medals for the Guerilla Jiu Jitsu team,\u0026quot;\u0026nbsp;Zuckerberg shared on social media at the time.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eZuckerberg\u0026rsquo;s training partner \u003cstrong\u003eKhai Wu\u003c/strong\u003e previously said that the Meta Platforms CEO is a \u0026ldquo;Jiu Jitsu nerd\u0026rdquo; that many might not know is also a \u0026ldquo;silent killer.\u0026rdquo;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eMusk, on the other hand, has joked about his fighting abilities and workout\u0026nbsp;routine.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026ldquo;I almost never work out, except for picking up my kids \u0026amp; throwing them in the air,\u0026rdquo; Musk said.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eWhile he isn\u0026rsquo;t a trained fighter like Zuckerberg, Musk shared with his Twitter followers that he does have one move ready to go.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026ldquo;I have this great move that I call \u0026lsquo;The Walrus,\u0026rsquo; where I just lie on top of my opponent \u0026amp; do nothing,\u0026rdquo; Musk \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1671699387620237312\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e. Musk previously highlighted the move during an \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/john/status/1671720243482480641\"\u003einterview \u003c/a\u003eon the \u0026ldquo;Full Send Podcast.\u0026rdquo;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eComputer scientist and podcast host \u003cstrong\u003eLex Fridman\u003c/strong\u003e, who has interviewed Musk and Zuckerberg previously, offered to train Musk in jiu jitsu. Fridman holds a black belt in jiu jitsu.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eMusk has called out Facebook and Instagram previously, two units owned by Meta Platforms. Musk has \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/22/08/28516290/elon-musk-has-a-secret-instagram-heres-why-the-tesla-ceo-remains-anonymous-on-the-thirst-trap-social\"\u003ereferred to Instagram\u003c/a\u003e as a \u0026ldquo;thirst trap\u0026rdquo; and previously took down pages for Tesla and SpaceX on Facebook.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eZuckerberg is listed with a height in the range of 5\u0026rsquo;7\u0026rdquo; to 5\u0026rsquo;8\u0026rdquo;. Musk is listed at a height of 6\u0026rsquo;1\u0026rdquo; to 6\u0026rsquo;2\u0026rdquo;.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCelebrity Fight History: \u003c/strong\u003eThere has been a history of athletes joining the ranks of boxing and mixed martial arts. Additionally, several matches have featured celebrities fighting against each other.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026ldquo;Celebrity Boxing\u0026rdquo; aired two episodes on Fox. Among the celebrities that competed in matches were \u003cstrong\u003eVanilla Ice, Danny Bonaduce, Barry Williams, Todd Bridges, Paula Jones, Tonya Harding, Dustin Diamond, Manute Bol, Joey Buttafuoco \u003c/strong\u003eand \u003cstrong\u003eWilliam \u0026ldquo;Refrigerateor\u0026rdquo; Perry.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eAn annual charity boxing event called \u0026ldquo;Creator Clash\u0026rdquo; sees content creators like YouTubers face off against each other.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eBetting Odds:\u003c/strong\u003e While a fight between Musk and Zuckerberg is only in the rumor or early planning stages, sportsbooks are already starting to circulate odds for the highly anticipated bout.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eDraftKings Inc \u003c/strong\u003e(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/DKNG#NASDAQ\"\u003eDKNG\u003c/a\u003e) \u003ca href=\"https://dknation.draftkings.com/pop-culture/2023/6/22/23769810/mark-zuckerberg-vs-elon-musk-odds-cage-fight-who-will-win-wheres-the-asteroid\"\u003eshared \u003c/a\u003eodds for a potential cage fight. The odds are listed as -160 for Zuckerberg and +140 for Musk, with the Meta Platforms CEO favored.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026ldquo;Zuckerberg is 12 years younger and has taken part in an intensive challenge in which he ran a mile, completed 100 pull-ups, 200 press-ups and 300 squats, before running a further mile, all while wearing a 9kg weighted vest. He also has been training in Brazilian Jiu-jitsu,\u0026rdquo; DraftKings Director of Race \u0026amp; Sports Operations \u003cstrong\u003eJohnny Avello \u003c/strong\u003esaid.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eAvello added that Musk has dabbled in taekwondo, karate, judo and jiu-jitsu.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026ldquo;So while Zuckerberg will be the smaller man via weight and size, he\u0026rsquo;s a big MMA fan and seems to be in better shape.\u0026rdquo;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eSportsbook Bovada has the \u003ca href=\"https://www.bovada.lv/sports/entertainment/celebrity-boxing/elon-musk-mark-zuckerberg-202308310000\"\u003eodds \u003c/a\u003elisted at -150 for Musk and +110 for Zuckerberg.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat\u0026rsquo;s Next:\u003c/strong\u003e If the fight is to happen between Musk and Zuckerberg, several people are expressing their desire to be part of the action.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSoFi Technologies\u003c/strong\u003e CEO \u003cstrong\u003eAnthony Noto,\u003c/strong\u003e who is a West Point graduate, \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/anthonynoto/status/1671729960757919745\"\u003esaid \u003c/a\u003ehe wants to fight the winner.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eRoger both Zuckerberg and Musk, with the winner getting to pick the cryptocurrency used by Facebook and Twitter.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eUsers on social media are calling for Musk to fight href=\"https://www.eurogamer.net/sony-says-it-wouldnt-share-ps6-details-with-microsoft-owned-activision\"\u003eAs per\u003c/a\u003e Eurogamer, Ryan emphasized that if the $68.7 billion buyout received regulatory approval, Sony, which makes PlayStation, would no longer be able to disclose details about its upcoming console hardware to Activision, the maker of the popular game franchise Call of Duty.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSee Also:\u003ca Games As Strong Case Against Microsoft, Activision Blizzard Merger\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSony \u0026quot;simply could not run the risk of a company that was owned by a direct competitor having access to that information,\u0026quot; Ryan said during a hearing with the U.S. Federal Trade Commission in Apri\u003c/strong\u003el.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eRyan\u0026#39;s remarks were made two months ago when he appeared before the FTC to provide Sony\u0026#39;s perspective on the potential consequences of the acquisition.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eOf particular concern to Sony was the potential disruption to its game development processes, as it \u0026quot;could no longer share confidential details about its next console in development\u0026quot; for\u0026nbsp;PlayStation 6.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe PlayStation\u0026nbsp;boss also voiced concerns regarding Microsoft\u0026#39;s potential lack of incentive to develop PlayStation-specific features for Activision games following the acquisition.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;I believe that [Microsoft]\u0026#39;s incentives \u0026mdash;\u0026nbsp;their primary incentive will, at post-acquisition, would be to optimize its overall Xbox business, not the business of Activision,\u0026quot; he added.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eWhen Ryan asked about the level of sensitivity surrounding information on forthcoming features for PlayStation consoles. He responded: \u0026quot;Immensely sensitive.\u0026quot;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe recent court transcript \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/stephentotilo/status/1671474280259887105?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1671474280259887105%7Ctwgr%5E6f69fc4677328da552dad2ed4e715cb036f1573c%7Ctwcon%5Es1_\u0026amp;ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.eurogamer.net%2Fsony-says-it-wouldnt-share-ps6-details-with-microsoft-owned-activision\"\u003euncovered \u003c/a\u003eby Axios\u0026#39; Stephen Totilo, showed\u0026nbsp;no questions were posed to Ryan regarding the inverse scenario, where Microsoft faces the challenge of collaborating with Sony-owned studios such as\u0026nbsp;Bungie (the developer behind Destiny) and Sony San Diego, the creator of Major League Baseball games, for the development of Xbox versions.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eIt\u0026#39;s worth noting that the temporary blockage of Microsoft\u0026#39;s acquisition of Activision Blizzard by the FTC made headlines last week.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eRead Next:\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/general/gaming/23/06/32833324/ftc-sues-to-block-microsofts-acquisition-of-activision-blizzard-microsoft-welcomes-it\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;FTC Sues To Block Microsoft\u0026#39;s Acquisition Of Activision Blizzard; Microsoft Welcomes It\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003ePhoto:\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://unsplash.com/@mahtabmashuq?utm_source=unsplash\u0026amp;utm_medium=referral\u0026amp;utm_content=creditCopyText\"\u003eMahtab Mashuq\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;via\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://unsplash.com/es/fotos/2eVNoI2omxE?utm_source=unsplash\u0026amp;utm_medium=referral\u0026amp;utm_content=creditCopyText\"\u003eUnsplash\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n","symbols":["ATVI","MSFT","SONY"],"source":"benzinga"}]

company that was owned by a direct competitor having access to that information,\u0026quot; Ryan said during a hearing with the U.S. Federal Trade Commission in Apri\u003c/strong\u003el.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eRyan\u0026#39;s remarks were made two months ago when he appeared before the FTC to provide Sony\u0026#39;s perspective on the potential consequences of the acquisition.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eOf particular concern to Sony was the potential disruption to its game development processes, as it \u0026quot;could no longer share confidential details about its next console in development\u0026quot; for\u0026nbsp;PlayStation 6.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe PlayStation\u0026nbsp;boss also voiced concerns regarding Microsoft\u0026#39;s potential lack of incentive to develop PlayStation-specific features for Activision games following the acquisition.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;I believe that [Microsoft]\u0026#39;s incentives \u0026mdash;\u0026nbsp;their primary incentive will, at post-acquisition, would be to optimize its overall Xbox business, not the business of Activision,\u0026quot; he added.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eWhen Ryan asked about the level of sensitivity surrounding information on forthcoming features for PlayStation consoles. He responded: \u0026quot;Immensely sensitive.\u0026quot;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe recent court transcript \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/stephentotilo/status/1671474280259887105?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1671474280259887105%7Ctwgr%5E6f69fc4677328da552dad2ed4e715cb036f1573c%7Ctwcon%5Es1_\u0026amp;ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.eurogamer.net%2Fsony-says-it-wouldnt-share-ps6-details-with-microsoft-owned-activision\"\u003euncovered \u003c/a\u003eby Axios\u0026#39; Stephen Totilo, showed\u0026nbsp;no questions were posed to Ryan regarding the inverse scenario, where Microsoft faces the challenge of collaborating with Sony-owned studios such as\u0026nbsp;Bungie (the developer behind Destiny) and Sony San Diego, the creator of Major League Baseball games, for the development of Xbox versions.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eIt\u0026#39;s worth noting that the temporary blockage of Microsoft\u0026#39;s acquisition of Activision Blizzard by the FTC made headlines last week.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eRead Next:\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/general/gaming/23/06/32833324/ftc-sues-to-block-microsofts-acquisition-of-activision-blizzard-microsoft-welcomes-it\"\u003e\u0026nbsp;FTC Sues To Block Microsoft\u0026#39;s Acquisition Of Activision Blizzard; Microsoft Welcomes It\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003ePhoto:\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://unsplash.com/@mahtabmashuq?utm_source=unsplash\u0026amp;utm_medium=referral\u0026amp;utm_content=creditCopyText\"\u003eMahtab Mashuq\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;via\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://unsplash.com/es/fotos/2eVNoI2omxE?utm_source=unsplash\u0026amp;utm_medium=referral\u0026amp;utm_content=creditCopyText\"\u003eUnsplash\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n","symbols":["ATVI","MSFT","SONY"],"source":"benzinga"}]
[{"T":"n","id":32975044,"headline":"Intel Is Doing Everything In Its Power To Regain Its Former Chip Glory","summary":"Intel Corporation (NASDAQ: INTC) has been making dramatic changes to its PC chips in an effort to regain its former glory on the front.","author":"Upwallstreet","created_at":"2023-06-22T19:50:53Z","updated_at":"2023-06-22T19:50:53Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/23/06/32975044/intel-is-doing-everything-in-its-power-to-regain-its-former-chip-glory","content":"\u003cp\u003eIntel Corporation (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/INTC#NASDAQ\"\u003eINTC\u003c/a\u003e) has been making dramatic changes to its PC chips in an effort to regain its former glory on the front. The chip giant adopted a heterogenous architecture to mix powerful cores with smaller efficiency cores and this strategy in an effort to strike back its rival Advanced Micro Devices Inc (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/AMD#NASDAQ\"\u003eAMD\u003c/a\u003e).\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eIntel is building out a foundry business of its own as it attempts to reclaim its manufacturing lead from Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company Limited (NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/TSM#NYSE\"\u003eTSM\u003c/a\u003e) and ensure its chips have a competitive advantage over those made by AMD.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003eRestructuring Of The Manufacturing Business\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eOn Wednesday,\u0026nbsp;the chip giant announced that the manufacturing unit will now be operating as a separate unit. Although the business is expected to generate a margin, no precise timeline was given, with shares dropping 5% as a result.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003eManufacturing Services Are An Essential Part Of Intel\u0026rsquo;s Turnaround Plans\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eAs part of its turnaround strategy, Intel will be offering its\u0026nbsp;its manufacturing services to other companies including its competitors.\u0026nbsp;A major external\u0026nbsp;foundry\u0026nbsp;customer\u0026nbsp;will be announced later\u0026nbsp;this year with CFO\u0026nbsp;David Zinsner confidently stating during the investors call that that the model empowers\u0026nbsp;Intel to become the\u0026nbsp;second largest foundry as early as next year with manufacturing revenue exceeding $20 billion.\u0026nbsp;However, Summit Insights Group analyst Kinngai Chan pointed out that this forecast is pale when compared to sales of Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing, which are expected to come near to $85 billion next year, a figure that clearly shows TSM\u0026rsquo;s supremacy. Chan concluded\u0026nbsp;that Intel simply revealed that its\u0026nbsp;current manufacturing is sub-scale and could remain so for a while.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003eBig Changes Are Coming With Meteor Lake Chips\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eAfter many years of manufacturing delays, obstacles and setbacks, Intel will be rolling out five new process nodes in a four-year span. Following the footsteps of its rival AMD, Intel is adopting a tile-based architecture. Meteor Lake CPUs will feature distinct tiles, each of which can be manufactured on different processes. The CPU tile will use Intel 4, while other tiles dedicated to graphics and other functions will be manufactured by TSM.\u0026nbsp;By adopting the tile-based architecture, Intel will be able to mix and match manufacturing technologies. While this approach increases the complexity of the manufacturing process, it also reduces development times and costs because most advanced manufacturing technology isn\u0026rsquo;t wasted on tiles that are not able to benefit from it as these are sorted to cheaper and older ways of doing.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003eIt\u0026#39;s AI Time\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eWith the tile-based architecture, Intel is bringing AI with Meteor Lake chips that will come with a dedicated AI processor, named the VPU. Although running a ChatGPT-like program on a PC won\u0026rsquo;t be possible anytime soon due to the complex requirements, plenty of AI tasks could potentially come to our simplified devices. Moreover, dedicated AI hardware will allow Intel to free up the CPU and GPU, and this could result in improved speed that users tend to appreciate.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003eIf Intel Pulls It All Off, Many Rewards Are On The Way\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eCollectively, all the above changes have the potential to\u0026nbsp;help Intel cement its lead in the PC CPU market.\u0026nbsp;Intel is going all in by risking with a new manufacturing process, a new architectural structure, and a new type of AI processor, and it is doing it all at the same time. But if it makes it work, these moves will pay off in a big way. However, AMD will certainly not be standing still with its shares skyrocketing 92% year-to-date as it geared up its AI chips game to catch up to Nvidia Corporation (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/NVDA#NASDAQ\"\u003eNVDA\u003c/a\u003e) whose shares as much as tripled this year. Considering that everyone wants a part of the AI chip pie, the game will be intense, to say the least.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eDISCLAIMER: This content is for informational purposes only. It is not intended as investing advice.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n ","symbols":["AMD","INTC","NVDA","TSM"],"source":"benzinga"}]

[{"T":"n","id":32986311,"headline":"One In Four Workers Contemplating Career Shift As \u0026#39;Great Resignation\u0026#39; Meets Remote Work Debate","summary":" ","author":"Michael Cohen","created_at":"2023-06-23T15:11:06Z","updated_at":"2023-06-23T15:11:06Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/general/23/06/32986311/one-in-four-workers-contemplating-career-shift-as-great-resignation-meets-remote-work-debate","content":"\u003cp\u003eThe global workforce is experiencing a significant shift, with a quarter of workers considering a change in jobs, according to a recent survey by PwC. This trend, often referred to as the \u0026#8220;Great Resignation,\u0026#8221; continues to gain momentum as employees reassess their work-life balance, job satisfaction, \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/topic/job-market\"\u003eand career goals. \u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAs the \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/business/great-resignation-continues-quarter-workers-look-change-jobs-pwc-2023-06-19/\"\u003ePwC\u003c/a\u003e survey reveals, the desire for change is not limited to a specific industry or role. It spans across various sectors, from tech and finance to healthcare and education. The reasons for this desire for change are multifaceted, ranging from burnout and dissatisfaction with current roles to the lure of better opportunities elsewhere.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe survey also found that 42% of employees are planning to demand pay raises to cope with the higher cost of living, up from 35% last year. Additionally, 46% of respondents said they were struggling to pay bills every month or most of the time.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe pandemic has played a significant role in this shift of perspective, with many workers experiencing the benefits of remote work and seeking more flexible work arrangements. However, not all employers are embracing this change, with some insisting on a return to the office \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/05/32479736/elon-musk-admits-some-jobs-can-be-done-from-home-but-says-super-out-of-touch-to-suggest-most-can-wor\"\u003eas the norm.\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eAlso Read:\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/05/32437964/elon-musk-paints-remote-work-as-morally-wrong-says-laptop-classes-are-living-in-la-la-land\"\u003e Elon Musk Slams Remote Work As ‘Morally Wrong'\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eOne notable voice against the shift towards remote work is \u003cstrong\u003eElon Musk\u003c/strong\u003e, CEO of \u003cstrong\u003eTesla Inc. \u003c/strong\u003e(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/TSLA#NASDAQ\"\u003eTSLA\u003c/a\u003e). Musk has been vocal about his belief that most jobs cannot be done from home, and has criticized the idea of remote work as being \u0026#8220;super out of touch.\u0026#8221; He argues that while some jobs can be done remotely, most require in-person interaction and collaboration.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eHowever, not all CEOs share Musk\u0026#8217;s views. Andi Owen, CEO of \u003cstrong\u003eMillerKnoll (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/MLKN#NASDAQ\"\u003eMLKN\u003c/a\u003e), made headlines when she encouraged her employees to focus on the company\u0026#8217;s financial struggles rather than their bonuses. Her comments, made during an employee meeting, went viral and sparked a debate about the \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/04/31861669/millerknoll-ceo-tells-employees-to-get-the-damn-26-million-and-leave-pity-city-goes-viral\"\u003eappropriateness of her remarks.\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAnother company that has been in the spotlight for its stance on remote work is \u003cstrong\u003eAmazon Inc. \u003c/strong\u003e(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/AMZN#NASDAQ\"\u003eAMZN\u003c/a\u003e). Despite protests from employees, Amazon remains firm on its return-to-office mandate. The company believes that in-person work fosters better collaboration and connection among employees. However, this stance has been met with resistance from some employees, who believe that they can be just as \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32954545/job-market-softens-shifting-dynamics-amazon-unbothered-by-employee-protests-over-lack-of-trust-in-le\"\u003eproductive working from home.\u003c/a\u003e \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAs the Great Resignation continues, it remains to be seen how companies will adapt to these changing dynamics. Will they embrace remote work and offer more flexible work arrangements, or will they insist on a return to the office? Only time will tell. But one thing is clear: the world of work is changing, and both employers and employees will need to adapt.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eNow Read:\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32971984/jeff-bezos-told-his-employees-i-predict-one-day-amazon-will-fail-amazon-will-go-bankrupt-but-his-goa\"\u003e Jeff Bezos Predicts Amazon\u0026#8217;s Future Bankruptcy\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eThis content was partially produced with the help of AI tools and was reviewed and published by Benzinga editors.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003ePhoto: Shutterstock\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["AMZN","MLKN","TSLA"],"source":"benzinga"}]

[{"T":"n","id":33026945,"headline":"How To Earn $500 A Month From QQQ Stock","summary":" ","author":"AJ Fabino","created_at":"2023-06-27T15:17:03Z","updated_at":"2023-06-27T15:17:04Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/news/large-cap/23/06/33026945/how-to-earn-500-a-month-from-qqq-stock","content":"\u003cp\u003eWhen the market feels uncertain, investors often turn to assets that can provide them with \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/calendars/dividends/\"\u003estable returns\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWith tech stocks seeing wild volatility as we head into the summer, there\u0026#8217;s a way to tap into their potential without taking on excessive risk. Enter, \u003cstrong\u003eInvesco QQQ Trust Series 1\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/QQQ#NASDAQ\"\u003eQQQ\u003c/a\u003e).\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eFor the unaware, QQQ is an ETF that tracks the Nasdaq-100 Index, comprising the 100 largest non-financial stocks listed on the Nasdaq. With a heavy concentration on tech companies, QQQ allows investors to own a piece of the sector\u0026#8217;s giants like \u003cstrong\u003eMicrosoft\u003c/strong\u003e \u003cstrong\u003eCorporation\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/MSFT#NASDAQ\"\u003eMSFT\u003c/a\u003e), \u003cstrong\u003eApple\u003c/strong\u003e \u003cstrong\u003eInc\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/AAPL#NASDAQ\"\u003eAAPL\u003c/a\u003e), \u003cstrong\u003eAlphabet\u003c/strong\u003e \u003cstrong\u003eInc \u003c/strong\u003e(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/GOOG#NASDAQ\"\u003eGOOG\u003c/a\u003e), and \u003cstrong\u003eAmazon.com, Inc\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/AMZN#NASDAQ\"\u003eAMZN\u003c/a\u003e) — all in a single trade.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eQQQ is currently the fifth most popular ETF globally, with over $160 billion in assets under management. Its focus on fast-growing sectors, excluding financials, makes it an appealing option for investors looking for growth.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe ETF\u0026#8217;s composition is heavily skewed toward mega-cap tech stocks. Here's a look at QQQ's top 10 holdings:\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cul\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMicrosoft\u003c/strong\u003e: 12.63%\u003c/li\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eApple\u003c/strong\u003e: 12.60%\u003c/li\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAlphabet\u003c/strong\u003e: 7.4%\u003c/li\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAmazon\u003c/strong\u003e: 6.3%\u003c/li\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eNvidia Corporation\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/NVDA#NASDAQ\"\u003eNVDA\u003c/a\u003e): 5.3%\u003c/li\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eMeta Platforms Inc\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/META#NASDAQ\"\u003eMETA\u003c/a\u003e): 3.7%\u003c/li\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTesla Inc \u003c/strong\u003e(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/TSLA#NASDAQ\"\u003eTSLA\u003c/a\u003e): 3.4%\u003c/li\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eBroadcom Inc\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/AVGO#NASDAQ\"\u003eAVGO\u003c/a\u003e): 2.0%\u003c/li\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePepsiCo, Inc\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/PEP#NASDAQ\"\u003ePEP\u003c/a\u003e): 2.0%\u003c/li\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCostco Wholesale Corporation\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/COST#NASDAQ\"\u003eCOST\u003c/a\u003e): 1.7%\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIn addition to capital growth, QQQ also offers investors a dividend yield of 0.59%. Although this isn't a high yield, it is a nice bonus for those primarily investing in QQQ for capital appreciation.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cem\u003eRead Also: \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/trading-ideas/long-ideas/23/06/33014928/how-to-earn-500-a-month-from-sl-green-stock-new-york-citys-largest-office-landlord\"\u003eHow To Earn $500 A Month From SL Green Stock, New York City\u0026#8217;s Largest Office Landlord\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eHow can investors earn $500 per month from the Q's?\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWe'll start with our monthly target of $500, which translates to an annual target of $6,000 ($500 x 12 months).\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eNext, we'll divide the $6,000 by QQQ's 0.59% dividend yield: $6,000 / 0.0059 = $1,016,949.15.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSo, an investor would need to own $1,016,949.15, or 2,827 shares to yield $500 per month.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eFor a more modest amount, say an investor is aiming to earn $100 per month in dividends, amounting to $1,200 annually.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWe divide the $1,200 by QQQ\u0026#8217;s dividend yield: $1,200 / 0.0059 = $203,389.83.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eThis means that an investor would need approximately $203,390, or 565 shares to yield $100 per month in dividends.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eNote that dividend yield can change on a rolling basis, as the dividend payment and the stock price both fluctuate over time.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe dividend yield is calculated by dividing the annual dividend payment by the current stock price. As the stock price changes, the dividend yield will also change.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eFor example, if a stock pays an annual dividend of $2 and its price is $50, its dividend yield would be 4%. If the stock price increases to $60, the dividend yield would decrease to 3.33% ($2/$60).\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eConversely, if the stock price decreases to $40, the dividend yield would increase to 5% ($2/$40).\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eFurther, the dividend payment itself can also change over time, which can also impact the dividend yield. If a company increases its dividend payment, the dividend yield will increase even if the stock price remains the same. Similarly, if a company decreases its dividend payment, the dividend yield will decrease.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cem\u003eNow Read: \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/trading-ideas/long-ideas/23/06/33013528/how-to-earn-500-a-month-from-fox-corp-stock\"\u003eHow To Earn $500 A Month From Fox Corp Stock\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["AAPL","AMZN","AVGO","COST","GOOG","META","MSFT","NVDA","PEP","QQQ","TSLA"],"source":"benzinga"}]

This indicator, with a great track record, is popular among long term investors to stay in tune with the market and among short term traders to independently undertake quick trades.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eProtection Band And What To Do Now\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eIt is important for investors to look ahead and not in the rearview mirror.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eConsider continuing to hold good, very long term, existing positions. Based on individual risk preference, consider holding 21% - 39% in cash or Treasury bills or allocated to short-term tactical trades; and short to medium-term hedges of 3% - 6%, and short term hedges of 5% - 8%. This is a good way to protect yourself and participate in the upside at the same time.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eYou can determine your protection bands by adding cash to hedges.\u0026nbsp; The high band of the protection is appropriate for those who are older or conservative. The low band of the protection is appropriate for those who are younger or aggressive.\u0026nbsp; If you do not hedge, the total cash level should be more than stated above but significantly less than cash plus hedges.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eIt is worth reminding that you cannot take advantage of new upcoming opportunities if you are not holding enough cash.\u0026nbsp;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003eWhen adjusting hedge levels, consider adjusting partial stop quantities for stock positions (non ETF); consider using wider stops on remaining quantities and also allowing more room for high beta stocks.\u0026nbsp; High beta stocks are the ones that move more than the market.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003ch3\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTraditional 60/40 Portfolio\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h3\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eProbability based risk reward adjusted for inflation does not favor long duration strategic bond allocation at this time.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThose who want to stick to traditional 60% allocation to stocks and 40% to bonds may consider focusing on only high quality bonds and bonds of five year duration or less.\u0026nbsp; Those willing to bring sophistication to their investing may consider using bond ETFs as tactical positions and not strategic positions at this time.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eThe Arora Report is known for its accurate calls.\u0026nbsp; The Arora Report correctly called the 2008 financial crash, the start of a mega bull market in 2009, the COVID crash, the post-COVID bull market, and the 2022 bear market.\u0026nbsp; Please click here to sign up for a free forever \u003ca href=\"https://thearorareport.com/generate-wealth-newsletter\"\u003eGenerate Wealth Newsletter\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n    ","symbols":["AAPL","AMD","AMZN","BABA","BTCUSD","GOOG","META","MSFT","NVDA","QQQ","SPY","TSLA"],"source":"benzinga"}]
