[{"T":"n","id":33108907,"headline":"Tesla China Q2 Sales Hit New High As Giga Shanghai-Made Cars Account For 53% Of Global Deliveries","summary":" ","author":"Shanthi Rexaline","created_at":"2023-07-04T16:36:45Z","updated_at":"2023-07-04T16:36:45Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/markets/asia/23/07/33108907/tesla-china-q2-sales-hit-new-high-as-giga-shanghai-made-cars-account-for-53-of-global-deliveries","content":"\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTesla, Inc.\u003c/strong\u003e (NASAQ: TSLA)\u0026#8217;s China sales rose sharply in June, explaining the \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/markets/equities/23/07/33091637/tesla-q2-deliveries-steamroll-past-estimates-as-quarter-end-push-positively-impacts-volume\"\u003estrength seen in the global deliveries the company reported Sunday.\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat Happened: \u003c/strong\u003eTesla China delivered 93,680 units of Giga Shanghai-made cars in June, according to data from the China Passenger Car Association, Reuters reported.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis marks a 18.72% increase from a year-ago and 20.57% upside from April\u0026#8217;s sales. The June number marks a second-best total for Tesla in China after November 2022\u0026#8217;s record performance of 100,291 units.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eTesla\u0026#8217;s second-quarter sales tally in China was 247,217 units, a record. Data released by the Elon Musk-led company showed that it delivered 466,140 units globally in the quarter, which suggests a little over 53% of the cars delivered were made in China.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSee Also: \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/money/everything-you-need-to-know-about-tesla-stock\"\u003eEverything You Need To Know About Tesla Stock\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhy It\u0026#8217;s Important: \u003c/strong\u003eTesla\u0026#8217;s Giga Shanghai manufactures both Model 3 and Model Y cars, and the vehicles rolling out of the factory boast better margins given the production efficiency at the factory and the relatively cheap labor force. This should bode well for Tesla\u0026#8217;s automotive margins. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe strong China sales figure was achieved on the back of promotional schemes such as a discount on new inventory vehicles. The number is all the more important given the intensifying competition in the Chinese market, where domestic startups have models catering to different price points. Tesla is constrained by the limited product offering it has for users in China.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eTesla closed Monday\u0026#8217;s truncated session at $279.82, up 6.9%, according to \u003ca href=\"https://benzinga.grsm.io/lxquj26b2sag\"\u003eBenzinga Pro data.\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eCheck out more of Benzinga\u0026#8217;s Future Of Mobility coverage by\u0026nbsp;\u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://www.benzinga.com/topic/mobility\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003e\u003cem\u003efollowing this link\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eRead Next: \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/analyst-ratings/analyst-color/23/07/33093409/tesla-analyst-gary-black-flags-key-concern-amid-q2-delivery-cheer-i-would-much-pref\"\u003eTesla Analyst Gary Black Flags Key Concern Amid Q2 Delivery Cheer: \u0026#8216;I Would Much Prefer\u0026#8230;\u0026#8217;\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003ePhoto via Shutterstock. \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["TSLA"],"source":"benzinga"}]
[{"T":"n","id":33108907,"headline":"Tesla China Q2 Sales Hit New High As Giga Shanghai-Made Cars Account For 53% Of Global Deliveries","summary":" ","author":"Shanthi Rexaline","created_at":"2023-07-04T16:36:38Z","updated_at":"2023-07-04T16:40:24Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/markets/asia/23/07/33108907/tesla-china-q2-sales-hit-new-high-as-giga-shanghai-made-cars-account-for-53-of-global-deliveries","content":"\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTesla, Inc.\u003c/strong\u003e (NASAQ: TSLA)\u0026#8217;s China sales rose sharply in June, explaining the \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/markets/equities/23/07/33091637/tesla-q2-deliveries-steamroll-past-estimates-as-quarter-end-push-positively-impacts-volume\"\u003estrength seen in the global deliveries the company reported Sunday.\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat Happened: \u003c/strong\u003eTesla China delivered 93,680 units of Giga Shanghai-made cars in June, according to data from the China Passenger Car Association, Reuters reported.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThis marks a 18.72% increase from a year-ago and 20.57% upside from April\u0026#8217;s sales. The June number marks a second-best total for Tesla in China after November 2022\u0026#8217;s record performance of 100,291 units.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eTesla\u0026#8217;s second-quarter sales tally in China was 247,217 units, a record. Data released by the Elon Musk-led company showed that it delivered 466,140 units globally in the quarter, which suggests a little over 53% of the cars delivered were made in China.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSee Also: \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/money/everything-you-need-to-know-about-tesla-stock\"\u003eEverything You Need To Know About Tesla Stock\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhy It\u0026#8217;s Important: \u003c/strong\u003eTesla\u0026#8217;s Giga Shanghai manufactures both Model 3 and Model Y cars, and the vehicles rolling out of the factory boast better margins given the production efficiency at the factory and the relatively cheap labor force. This should bode well for Tesla\u0026#8217;s automotive margins. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe strong China sales figure was achieved on the back of promotional schemes such as a discount on new inventory vehicles. The number is all the more important given the intensifying competition in the Chinese market, where domestic startups have models catering to different price points. Tesla is constrained by the limited product offering it has for users in China.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eTesla closed Monday\u0026#8217;s truncated session at $279.82, up 6.9%, according to \u003ca href=\"https://benzinga.grsm.io/lxquj26b2sag\"\u003eBenzinga Pro data.\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eCheck out more of Benzinga\u0026#8217;s Future Of Mobility coverage by\u0026nbsp;\u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://www.benzinga.com/topic/mobility\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003e\u003cem\u003efollowing this link\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eRead Next: \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/analyst-ratings/analyst-color/23/07/33093409/tesla-analyst-gary-black-flags-key-concern-amid-q2-delivery-cheer-i-would-much-pref\"\u003eTesla Analyst Gary Black Flags Key Concern Amid Q2 Delivery Cheer: \u0026#8216;I Would Much Prefer\u0026#8230;\u0026#8217;\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003ePhoto courtesy of Tesla. \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["TSLA"],"source":"benzinga"}]

itemized elaborations have been created using the accompanying table.  \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e•  Regarding \u003cstrong\u003eNVDA\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/NVDA#NASDAQ\"\u003eNVDA\u003c/a\u003e), we observe a \u003cstrong\u003ecall\u003c/strong\u003e option \u003cstrong\u003esweep\u003c/strong\u003e with \u003cstrong\u003ebullish\u003c/strong\u003e sentiment. It expires in 3 day(s) on \u003cstrong\u003eJuly 7, 2023\u003c/strong\u003e. Parties traded \u003cstrong\u003e190\u003c/strong\u003e contract(s) at a \u003cstrong\u003e$430.00\u003c/strong\u003e strike. This particular call needed to be split into 8 different trades to become filled. The total cost received by the writing party (or parties) was \u003cstrong\u003e$71.2K\u003c/strong\u003e, with a price of \u003cstrong\u003e$376.0\u003c/strong\u003e per contract. There were \u003cstrong\u003e7832\u003c/strong\u003e open contracts at this strike prior to today, and today \u003cstrong\u003e22614\u003c/strong\u003e contract(s) were bought and sold. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e•  For \u003cstrong\u003eAMD\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/AMD#NASDAQ\"\u003eAMD\u003c/a\u003e), we notice a \u003cstrong\u003ecall\u003c/strong\u003e option \u003cstrong\u003esweep\u003c/strong\u003e that happens to be \u003cstrong\u003ebearish\u003c/strong\u003e, expiring in 3 day(s) on \u003cstrong\u003eJuly 7, 2023\u003c/strong\u003e. the Financial Times quoted \u003cstrong\u003eKeiji Kaita\u003c/strong\u003e, president of Toyota\u0026#39;s research and development center for carbon neutrality,\u0026nbsp;as saying.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;In terms of potential, we will aim to halve all of these factors.\u0026quot;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eKaita added the company discovered ways to address the durability problems from about three years ago and now has\u0026nbsp;enough confidence to mass-produce solid-state batteries in EVs by 2027 or 2028.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eAccording to the report, Toyota said\u0026nbsp;it has made a \u0026quot;technological breakthrough\u0026quot; in addressing durability concerns and finding a solution for materials, enabling an electric vehicle powered by a solid-state battery to achieve a range of 1,200km and a charging time of 10 minutes or less.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;All of our members are highly motivated and are working with the intention to launch\u0026quot; the technology by the promised timeline, Kaita said.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eAlso Read:\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/markets/equities/23/06/33054737/toyota-posts-10-sales-growth-in-may-boosted-by-improved-supply-chain-logistics\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eToyota Posts 10% Sales Growth In May Boosted By Improved Supply Chain Logistics\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhy It Matters:\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;Solid-state batteries are widely regarded as a transformative technology for electric vehicles, offering the potential to decrease charging times, enhance capacity\u0026nbsp;and mitigate the fire risk associated with traditional lithium-ion batteries that utilize a liquid electrolyte.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eAnalysts have suggested that solid-state batteries could be a watershed\u0026nbsp;development for Toyota, which has lagged behind competitors in the electric vehicle market, helping the company close the gap with\u003cstrong\u003e\u0026nbsp;Tesla Inc\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003e(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/TSLA#NASDAQ\"\u003eTSLA\u003c/a\u003e), the Financial Times reported.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eToyota\u0026#39;s shares have experienced a 13% increase since the announcement of its solid-state battery plan last month.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe outlet quoted \u003cstrong\u003eHiroki Nakajima\u003c/strong\u003e, the chief technology officer, cautioning that the company does not view this technology as the definitive solution for battery challenges.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eNakajima has emphasized that there is still room for improvement in liquid-based batteries. [{"T":"n","id":33109598,"headline":"Here\u0026#39;s How Much Forrest Gump\u0026#39;s Theoretical Stake In Apple Would Be Worth Today — And How Much You Could Have Made Since Movie Was Released","summary":"Tom Hanks starred as the iconic movie character Forrest Gump in the 1994 movie of the same name. The movie highlighted events of the 1950s through the 1980s, including \u003cstrong\u003eElvis Presley\u003c/strong\u003e, the Vietnam war, Civil Rights and multiple presidencies. The movie also features an iconic scene highlighting an investment in a \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/tech/23/06/33078458/apple-breaks-3-trillion-market-cap-sets-new-record-high-can-the-iphone-makers-stock-keep-climbing\"\u003enow $3-trillion company.\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat Happened: \u003c/strong\u003eFictional and non-fictional movies alike can feature the names of companies that are real and in some cases still around today. That\u0026rsquo;s exactly what happened in the 1994 classic \u0026ldquo;Forrest Gump,\u0026rdquo; which starred\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/topic/tom-hanks\"\u003eHanks.\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eA scene toward\u0026nbsp;the end of \u0026ldquo;Forrest Gump\u0026rdquo; features the title character saying that his friend and business partner Lieutenant Dan took care of their Bubba Gump shrimp money.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026ldquo;He got me invested in some kind of fruit company,\u0026rdquo; Gump says, showing a letter with the old \u003cstrong\u003eApple Inc \u003c/strong\u003e(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/AAPL#NASDAQ\"\u003eAAPL\u003c/a\u003e) computer logo.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe movie timeline would follow the investment being made in Apple after Hurricane Carmen in 1974 and was likely a hypothetical $100,000 stake for 3% of the company. Apple went public in 1980 after raising money from venture capitalists and angel investors.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026ldquo;I got a call from him saying we didn\u0026rsquo;t have to worry about money anymore,\u0026rdquo; Gump said.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eRelated Link:\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/large-cap/23/07/33099149/apple-now-worth-more-than-these-5-leading-u-s-retailers-including-amazon-and-walmart-2-beverage-gi\"\u003e Apple Now Worth Mor Than These 5 Leading U.S. Retailers And 2 Beverage Giants\u0026nbsp;\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eApple Value Today: \u003c/strong\u003eLieutenant Dan was certainly right that Gump would not have to worry about money anymore if they bought 3% of Apple.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe hypothetical 3% stake in Apple would be valued at $90.9 billion today, based on a market cap of $3.03 trillion. The value doesn\u0026rsquo;t take into account any share dilution over the years or dividend payments.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eGump and Dan\u0026#39;s stake would rank them 13th on \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/billionaires/\"\u003ethe \u003c/a\u003eBloomberg Billionaires Index.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eInvesting Alongside Movie Release:\u003c/strong\u003e The Tom Hanks movie was \u003ca href=\"https://www.boxofficemojo.com/release/rl1314031105/weekend/\"\u003ereleased \u003c/a\u003eon July 6, 1994 and went on to gross $329.7 million at the box office.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eApple traded at a split-adjusted price of 24 cents\u0026nbsp;on July 6, 1994. This means that a $1,000 investment in Apple stock the day \u0026ldquo;Forrest Gump\u0026rdquo; was released would now be worth $801,917.31 based on a share price of $192.46 for Apple.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eWho knew at that time Forrest Gump and Lieutenant Dan were sharing one of the world\u0026rsquo;s greatest investment ideas?\u0026nbsp;Maybe Gump\u0026rsquo;s mother was correct in saying, \u0026ldquo;Life is like a box of chocolates, you never know what you\u0026rsquo;re going to get.\u0026quot;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eRead Next: \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/general/education/23/06/32970683/if-you-invested-1-000-in-apple-when-warren-buffett-bought-shares-heres-how-much-youd-have-today\"\u003eIf You Invested $1,000 In Apple When Warren Buffett Bought Shares, Here\u0026#39;s How Much You\u0026#39;d Have Today\u0026nbsp;\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ciframe allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"315\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/SNa4EMUWnAc\" width=\"560\"\u003e\u003c/iframe\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003ePhoto via Shutterstock.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n","symbols":["AAPL"],"source":"benzinga"}]

href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/PSNY#NASDAQ\"\u003ePSNY\u003c/a\u003e) attributed the resurgence of electric vehicles in the 21st century to the pioneering efforts of\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eToyota Motor Corp\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026#8216;s (NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/TM#NYSE\"\u003eTM\u003c/a\u003e) Prius and\u003cstrong\u003e\u0026nbsp;Tesla Inc\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/TSLA#NASDAQ\"\u003eTSLA\u003c/a\u003e).\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat Happened\u003c/strong\u003e: Polestar, in a Fourth Of July blog post, said that the first practical EV was developed by American chemist\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eWilliam Morrison\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;in the late 1800s, capable of reaching a top speed of 23 km/h.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eEVs gained popularity and accounted for a significant portion of vehicles on the road until the introduction of\u0026nbsp;\u003ca target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/general/education/21/10/12498786/this-day-in-market-history-ford-produces-1-millionth-model-t-1\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003eFord\u0026#8217;s\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eModel T\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;and declining gas prices, causing the EV market to decline by 1935.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSee Also:\u0026nbsp;\u003c/em\u003e\u003ca target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/money/best-electric-vehicle-stocks\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eBest Electric Vehicle Stocks\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThrowing in a \u0026#8220;Lord Of The Rings\u0026#8221; reference, Polestar said that the\u0026nbsp;\u003ca target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/22/11/29743530/toyota-unveils-fifth-generation-prius-in-japan\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003eToyota Prius\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;burst onto the automotive scene like when\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eSamwise Gamgee\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;hoists Frodo onto his shoulders. \u0026#8220;As the world's first mass-produced hybrid electric vehicle, it took the world by storm.\u0026#8221;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAround the same time, \u0026#8220;a small U.S. startup was working under wraps, with the dream of creating a luxury EV sports car that would change the way we view EVs forever.\u0026#8221;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAnd thereby, with the success of Tesla, the electric vehicle returned, Polestar said. \u0026#8220;It wasn't until the 21\u003csup\u003est\u003c/sup\u003e century that EVs would find their rebirth: the next phase of the Hero's Journey.\u0026#8221;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhy It Matters:\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003eThe Prius was launched in December 1997. \u0026#8220;When we launched Prius, no one even knew what a hybrid was,\u0026#8221; said\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eTakeshi Uchiyamada\u003c/strong\u003e, also known as the father of the Prius. Ten years later, worldwide sales of Toyota hybrids surpassed 10 million units.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eTesla, meanwhile, introduced the Roadster in 2008. Tesla CEO\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eElon Musk\u0026nbsp;\u003c/strong\u003etermed the development of the first all-electric production vehicle to use lithium-ion batteries an \u0026#8216;\u003ca target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/22/05/27121491/elon-musk-says-teslas-initial-roadster-endeavor-was-an-insane-nightmare\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003einsane nightmare\u003c/a\u003e.\u0026#8217;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026#8220;First of all, we had no idea how to build a car,\u0026#8221; Musk said. \u0026#8220;And then no one really knew how to build a commercial lithium-ion battery car. No one had ever done it.\u0026#8221;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eCheck out more of Benzinga\u0026#8217;s Future Of Mobility coverage by\u0026nbsp;\u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/topic/mobility\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003e\u003cem\u003efollowing this link\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eRead More:\u003c/em\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/07/33110625/elon-musk-retweets-striking-ax-2-mission-launch-picture-to-wish-followers-a-happy-independence-day\"\u003eElon Musk Retweets Striking Ax-2 Mission Launch Picture To Wish Followers A \u0026#8216;Happy Independence Day\u0026#8217;\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["PSNY","TM","TSLA"],"source":"benzinga"}]

[{"T":"n","id":33118157,"headline":"Looking At Tesla\u0026#39;s Recent Unusual Options Activity","summary":" ","author":"Benzinga Insights","created_at":"2023-07-05T15:33:34Z","updated_at":"2023-07-05T15:33:34Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/markets/options/23/07/33118157/looking-at-teslas-recent-unusual-options-activity","content":"\u003cp\u003eSomeone with a lot of money to spend has taken a bearish stance on \u003cstrong\u003eTesla\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/TSLA#NASDAQ\"\u003eTSLA\u003c/a\u003e).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAnd retail traders should know.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWe noticed this today when the big position showed up on publicly available options history that we track here at Benzinga.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWhether this is an institution or just a wealthy individual, we don't know. But when something this big happens with TSLA, it often means somebody knows something is about to happen.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eSo how do we know what this whale just did? \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eToday, \u003ca href=\"https://pro.benzinga.com/?utm_source=insights\"\u003eBenzinga\u003c/a\u003e's options scanner spotted 165 uncommon options trades for Tesla.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThis isn't normal.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe overall sentiment of these big-money traders is split between 44% bullish and 55%, bearish.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eOut of all of the special options we uncovered, 33 are puts, for a total amount of $1,934,188, and 132 are calls, for a total amount of $8,538,855.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch3\u003eWhat's The Price Target?\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eTaking into account the Volume and Open Interest on these contracts, it appears that whales have been targeting a price range from $200.0 to $390.0 for Tesla over the last 3 months. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch3\u003eVolume \u0026amp; Just recently, Rackspace Technology announced a significant expansion of their partnership with Google Cloud to offer Cutting-edge Generative AI Services and Solutions using the (FAIR\u0026trade;) practice. Foundry for Generative AI by Rackspace FAIR for Google Cloud is dedicated to accelerating the secure responsible, and sustainable adoption of generative AI solutions in enterprises across all industries.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;Whether you\u0026#39;re already a Google customer or simply getting started in your digital transformation, Rackspace can help you accelerate innovation and cost savings within your organization by taking over the intensive day-to-day operations of your cloud. Rackspace Technology and other IT providers immerse themselves in the C2C community to help increase its brand visibility and highlight its messaging and successful customer stories through various ways, including event participation, hosting, sponsorships, content creation, and thought leadership opportunities.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eClick\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.globenewswire.com/Tracker?data=ukTXNtABIlpUPFL05DjWAnIOL5XR81ArAG46PJke3zeDvlnuKtLhZbmjAzAeQ4vxRvCwke2NNekKDKjFF955aMUG2LwR6QlbjvIDQvN9aA4=\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ehere\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;to find out more about Rackspace Technology Google Cloud offerings.\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["GOOG","GOOGL","RXT"],"source":"benzinga"}]

[{"T":"n","id":33133558,"headline":"MrBeast: \u0026#39;Willy Wonka Of YouTube\u0026#39; Applies Content Creation Tactics For Good, Wins Over Skeptical Author","summary":"A writer who chronicled the rise of MrBeast and his appeal to his followers has divulged more insights on the popular YouTuber during a recent podcast interview.","author":"Chris Katje","created_at":"2023-07-06T15:27:47Z","updated_at":"2023-07-06T15:27:48Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/07/33133558/mrbeast-willy-wonka-of-youtube-applies-content-creation-tactics-for-good-wins-over-skeptical-author","content":"\u003cp\u003eA writer who chronicled the rise of \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/topic/mrbeast\"\u003eMrBeast \u003c/a\u003eand his appeal to his followers has divulged more insights on\u0026nbsp;the popular YouTuber during a recent podcast interview. The conversation, which includes both praise and potential criticism, comes as \u003cstrong\u003eMrBeast \u003c/strong\u003epassed 150 million subscribers on YouTube to become the \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/general/entertainment/23/05/32205699/mrbeast-just-hit-150m-subscribers-on-youtube-heres-how-much-he-makes-1\"\u003emost followed individual account on the platform.\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat Happened:\u003c/strong\u003e MrBeast, whose real name is \u003cstrong\u003eJimmy Donaldson\u003c/strong\u003e, has been loved and followed by a generation of younger fans who gravitate to his YouTube videos. One video that generated lots of views and publicity was MrBeast paying for 1,000 blind people to see thanks \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/01/30623511/1-000-people-receive-cataract-surgery-thanks-to-this-millionaire-youtube-star\"\u003eto cataract surgery.\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThat video is one of the key highlights in a \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2023/06/12/magazine/mrbeast-youtube.html\"\u003eprofile \u003c/a\u003eon MrBeast titled \u0026ldquo;How MrBeast Became the Willy Wonka of YouTube.\u0026rdquo; Article author \u003cstrong\u003eMax Read \u003c/strong\u003ewas recently \u003ca href=\"https://open.spotify.com/episode/5r9SCVGrzRa9MTJPrA4DvT?si=0fLLspjMQW608rqHFaU_lQ\u0026amp;nd=1\"\u003einterviewed \u003c/a\u003eon the New York Times \u0026ldquo;The Daily\u0026rdquo; podcast where he discussed\u0026nbsp;the evolution of MrBeast\u0026#39;s career, the increased scrutiny that came with his fame, and how he came to view the influential YouTuber in a positive light despite the criticisms.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eRead said he has been watching the rise of MrBeast on YouTube, a unit of \u003cstrong\u003eAlphabet Inc \u003c/strong\u003e(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/GOOG#NASDAQ\"\u003eGOOG\u003c/a\u003e)(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/GOOGL#NASDAQ\"\u003eGOOGL\u003c/a\u003e) for the last four or five years.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eDonaldson, who now has over 164 million subscribers on YouTube, started in a much more humble space according to Read.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eIn the beginning, MrBeast videos were in the \u0026ldquo;let\u0026rsquo;s play\u0026rdquo; category, where he would play a video game like \u0026ldquo;Call of Duty\u0026rdquo; and comment on his play. Read called this a really common YouTube genre.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eWhile he was doing this, Read said MrBeast was also studying the YouTube masters and learning what titles and thumbnail videos got the most views. Read described the strategy MrBeast employed while in high school as reverse engineering of sorts.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eDonaldson decided not to go to college, against his mother\u0026rsquo;s wishes, so he could focus on content creation and his growing YouTube business.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eAccording to Read, one of MrBeast\u0026#39;s earliest standout videos showcased him counting from 1 to 100,000 while positioned at his computer.\u0026nbsp;\u0026ldquo;People loved it, it went viral.\u0026rdquo;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eRead noted that this video was instrumental in showing Donaldson that hard work and a visible investment of time can result in more views, a concept that diverges from the conventional wisdom of the volume of videos being the most important thing for content creators.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eMrBeast instead put a focus on fewer video releases, but ones that came with big time commitments, efforts, physical pain in some cases, and cash rewards.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026ldquo;MrBeast has mostly spent his time putting on these stunts and giving away money. That\u0026rsquo;s something that YouTube viewers connect with.\u0026rdquo;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eRead said that MrBeast has invested in and perfected what he called \u0026ldquo;junk lord\u0026rdquo; videos. Spending a lot of money on a huge stunt that is silly and funny can bring in a lot of viewers. Another type of video that MrBeast has produced with huge success is one where he he distributes money.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026ldquo;A lot of his junk lord videos involve giving money away.\u0026rdquo;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eRead said this is important as videos that feature MrBeast giving away money to Uber drivers, waitresses and homeless people can have the same amount of viewers as more elaborate ones that he releases.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eRelated Link: \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/general/entertainment/23/05/32453055/youtube-stars-take-google-to-the-bank-how-much-mrbeast-jake-paul-other-content-creators-mak\"\u003eYouTube Stars Take Google To The Bank, How Much MrBeast, Jake Paul, Other Content Creators Make\u0026nbsp;\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eIs MrBeast Good?:\u003c/strong\u003e Read said it was impressive that MrBeast has passed Cocomelon on YouTube, a channel that most parents know all too well.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026ldquo;He\u0026rsquo;s done it by being very different than what I think people imagine YouTubers to be like,\u0026rdquo; Read said.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eRead wrote an opinion piece for the New York Times, focusing on a video \u003ca href=\"http://www.benzinga.com/news/23/01/30647448/mrbeasts-1-001-acts-of-charity-the-gift-of-sight-and-a-new-tesla-for-1-teenager\"\u003epublished by MrBeast in February.\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;The video featured MrBeast paying for cataract surgeries for 1,000 people, helping them to see for the first time.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe video saw criticism and pushback due to a thumbnail featuring MrBeast and a child appearing to cry, which Read called cheap, baffling and said there was \u0026ldquo;something a bit icky about it.\u0026rdquo;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eRead also said that putting a counter in the video of blind people he helped save was similar to a video game. MrBeast received criticism for the video, with some viewers alleging that he didn\u0026rsquo;t care about people and was using exploitation for views.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026ldquo;If you watch the video, the criticism is not baseless.\u0026rdquo;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe backlash from the eye surgery video has publicly polarized opinions on whether MrBeast\u0026#39;s actions are altruistic or merely performed for viewer count.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eRead said that MrBeast has made promises to viewers to put the money he makes into more videos and giveaways. This leads to a suggestion that if you subscribe, you could be a recipient of his generosity someday.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThis included buying an island and hosting a Survivor-style competition with subscribers to win the island after MrBeast passed 100 million subscribers on YouTube.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026ldquo;He\u0026rsquo;s both entertaining and also able to transform your life as a viewer.\u0026rdquo;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eRead said that subscribing and watching MrBeast is almost like entering a lottery as you could become the object of his charity.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026ldquo;I call him the Willy Wonka of YouTube.\u0026rdquo;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eRead said one thing that helped him get past the criticism of MrBeast was speaking with teenagers and 20-year-olds who have watched MrBeast for years and appeared baffled by a question of whether the YouTuber is only doing the charity videos for views.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026ldquo;In the end, I was mostly won over.\u0026rdquo;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eRead highlighted MrBeast\u0026#39;s talent for engaging his audience and ensuring that they gain something from each video. He also noted MrBeast\u0026#39;s generous efforts, such as donations to food banks and other charities. In Read\u0026#39;s view, these actions enable viewers to feel involved and contribute positively to society merely by watching and enjoying the content they usually consume.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eRead Next: \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/general/entertainment/23/06/33065767/mrbeast-embodies-his-creator-name-prepare-to-be-shocked-by-the-youtubers-physical-transform\"\u003eMrBeast Embodies His Creator Name, Prepare To Be Shocked By YouTuber\u0026#39;s Physical Transformation\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n","symbols":["GOOG","GOOGL"],"source":"benzinga"}]
[{"T":"n","id":33134089,"headline":"What\u0026#39;s Going On With NXP Semiconductors and Taiwain Semiconductor Stocks Thursday?","summary":"Several semiconductor manufacturer names are continuing to slide on Thursday after China announced restrictions on the export of metals used in chip production.\n\nWhat To Know:","author":"Erica Kollmann","created_at":"2023-07-06T15:27:49Z","updated_at":"2023-07-06T15:27:50Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/07/33134089/whats-going-on-with-nxp-semiconductors-and-taiwain-semiconductor-stocks-thursday","content":"\u003cp\u003eSeveral semiconductor manufacturer names are continuing to slide on Thursday after China announced restrictions on the \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/07/33117339/why-semiconductor-stocks-are-moving-wednesday\"\u003eexport of metals used in chip production.\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat To Know:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eNXP Semiconductors N.V. \u003c/strong\u003e(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/NXPI#NASDAQ\"\u003eNXPI\u003c/a\u003e) and Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company Ltd \u003c/strong\u003e(NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/TSM#NYSE\"\u003eTSM\u003c/a\u003e)\u003cstrong\u003e \u003c/strong\u003eare among the semiconductor names moving lower on Thursday.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eOn Monday, China announced the placement of export restrictions on products and materials containing gallium and germanium which are critical to the production of semiconductors. The export restrictions on gallium and germanium are seen as possible retaliation to U.S. export controls designed to curb China\u0026#39;s technological advances.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eAdditionally,\u0026nbsp;the broader tech sector is trading lower amid concerns over further Fed rate hikes, which could negatively impact growth stocks.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eTaiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing will report second quarter earnings on July 20th before market open, according to data from \u003ca href=\"http://pro.benzinga.com/?gspk=YWRhbWVja2VydDUzMzY\u0026amp;gsxid=zBMR4PKmcgBw\"\u003eBenzinga Pro\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eRelated News: \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/07/33133702/pfizer-is-driving-caribou-biosciences-stock-higher-today-whats-going-on\"\u003ePfizer Is Driving Caribou Biosciences Stock Higher Today: What\u0026#39;s Going On?\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eNXPI, TSM Price Action:\u003c/strong\u003e According to \u003ca href=\"https://pro.benzinga.com/?gspk=YWRhbWVja2VydDUzMzY\u0026amp;gsxid=zBMR4PKmcgBw\"\u003eBenzinga Pro\u003c/a\u003e, NXP Semiconductors shares are trading 0.41% lower at $202.83, and Taiwan Semiconductor shares are trading 1.81% lower at $99.16 at the time of publication.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eImage: kritsadaj from Pixabay \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n","symbols":["NXPI","TSM"],"source":"benzinga"}]

[{"T":"n","id":33159651,"headline":"Beyond Cybertruck: Analyst Advises Tesla To Take Notes from Rivian\u0026#39;s EV Pickup Strategy To Blow Past Wall Street Estimates","summary":" ","author":"Shanthi Rexaline","created_at":"2023-07-10T06:36:36Z","updated_at":"2023-07-10T06:36:36Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/analyst-ratings/analyst-color/23/07/33159651/beyond-cybertruck-analyst-advises-tesla-to-take-notes-from-rivians-ev-pickup-strate","content":"\u003cp\u003eThe \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/07/33155400/elon-musk-takes-tesla-cybertruck-for-a-spin-in-austin-shares-photo\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCybertruck\u003c/strong\u003e buzz is getting louder\u003c/a\u003e as its launch date approaches. An analyst, who is very bullish about \u003cstrong\u003eTesla, Inc.'s \u003c/strong\u003e(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/TSLA#NASDAQ\"\u003eTSLA\u003c/a\u003e) next big product has already begun to think aloud about the next iterations of the much-awaited electric pick-up truck.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat Happened: Future Fund \u003c/strong\u003emanaging partner Gary Black said Tesla should consider launching a traditional-looking pickup for those who love pickups but want a more mainstream look, preferably at a lower price point.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe difference could be something like the Model X and Model Y, the analyst said.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eBlack was responding to a tweet by a Tesla investor and influencer who raised the possibility of some buyers preferring their pickup to the Cybertruck.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWhen a Twitter user said Tesla is confident of its own design language and brand name and people will gradually warm up to it, Black differed with the view.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026#8220;Why not make products that appeal to different consumer segments?\u0026#8221; he asked\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026#8220;Two distinctly different pickups for a segment that buys 16M units [a] year and may differentiate on price is realistic.\u0026#8221;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSee Also: \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/money/everything-you-need-to-know-about-tesla-stock\"\u003eEverything You Need To Know About Tesla Stock\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWhen Tesla CEO Elon Musk shared a picture of him driving around in a Cybertruck, Black said he loved the design and has ordered a tri-motor Cybertruck. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eHe also noted that many pickup truck owners want a more traditional truck, as is evident from \u003cstrong\u003eRivian Automotive Holding, Inc.\u0026#8217;s \u003c/strong\u003e(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/RIVN#NASDAQ\"\u003eRIVN\u003c/a\u003e) success with its R1 pickup truck. \u003c/strong\u003eCybertruck is seen as a game-changer, as it is expected to draw in customers with its design appeal, power efficiency, and utility.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe U.S. pickup rates,\u0026#8221; said\u003cstrong\u003e Brad McMillan, \u003c/strong\u003echief investment officer for Commonwealth Financial Network.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIf the Fed continues to act more aggressively to fight inflation, the analyst expects a negative reaction from the market. \u0026#8220;That said, given that the underlying reason for the Fed's actions will be continued growth, markets have an economic cushion,\u0026#8221; he said.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026#8220;So, while volatility is likely, the downside may be limited.\u0026#8221;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFutures [{"T":"n","id":33163828,"headline":"Tesla Analyst Lifts Price Target Ahead Of Q2 But Warns Factors That Dragged Stock By 65% Have Not Gone Away","summary":" ","author":"Shanthi Rexaline","created_at":"2023-07-10T11:43:14Z","updated_at":"2023-07-10T11:43:15Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/analyst-ratings/analyst-color/23/07/33163828/tesla-analyst-lifts-price-target-ahead-of-q2-but-warns-factors-that-dragged-stock-b","content":"\u003cp\u003eWith less than two weeks to go for \u003cstrong\u003eTesla, Inc\u003c/strong\u003e.'s (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/TSLA#NASDAQ\"\u003eTSLA\u003c/a\u003e) earnings report, an analyst raised the price target for the stock. The company reported earlier this month \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/markets/equities/23/07/33091637/tesla-q2-deliveries-steamroll-past-estimates-as-quarter-end-push-positively-impacts-volume\"\u003ebetter-than-expected second-quarter deliveries.\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eThe Tesla Analyst:\u003c/strong\u003e Jefferies analyst \u003cstrong\u003ePhilippe Houchois \u003c/strong\u003emaintained a Hold rating and upped the price target from $185 to $265, which suggests a 3.44% downside from current levels.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eThe Tesla Thesis:\u003c/strong\u003e The second quarter will mark a trough in Tesla's auto gross margin, said Houchois in a note released Monday. The analyst said he expects second-quarter revenue to come in at $24.7 billion, up 6% sequentially and 46% higher than a year ago.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe revenue expectation, which also includes $400 million in zero-emission vehicle credit and $675 million in leasing, \u0026nbsp;is roughly in line with the consensus estimate of $24.53 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eHouchois forecast a gross auto margin of 18.6%, 40 basis points below the first quarter. He sees some mitigating impact coming from easing commodity costs, fixed cost coverage, and IRA support to battery costs.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAmong the aspects that Jefferies would focus on during the earnings call are price elasticity of demand, the ramp-up of in-house battery manufacturing, and inventories.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eProduction has been greater than deliveries for five quarters now and monthly volatility is high, Houchois said, adding that he would like to know optimal inventory levels as Tesla continues to globalize.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSee Also: \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/money/best-electric-vehicle-stocks\"\u003eBest Electric Vehicle Stocks\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eJefferies said it is modestly upgrading fiscal year estimates, making single-digit adjustments to revenue and EBIT estimates for the 2023-2025 timeframe.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWhile noting that Tesla shares trade at 6.8 times revenue, 44 times EBIT and 60 times P/E multiples, the analyst said Tesla, though leading auto industry transformation, may not see multiple rerating with auto earnings alone.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe Tesla investment case, according to the analyst, is still a work-in-progress and is dependent on f\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32828958/fix-no-fix-tesla-user-tells-elon-musk-fsd-beta-upgrade-did-not-help-his-woes\"\u003eull-self driving\u003c/a\u003e and stationary storage.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe analyst attributed the upward adjustment of the price target to the reduction of the discount rate from 9% to 8% and the lifting of long-term growth from 3% to 4%.\u0026nbsp; The assumptions are premised on the progress on auto-growth and the bottoming of auto margins, he added.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe analyst also cautioned that the issues that dragged Tesla shares down 65% in the second half of 2022 \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/analyst-ratings/analyst-color/22/12/30151389/teslas-market-share-decimated-backlog-has-collapsed-to-nothing-why-institutional-1\"\u003eamid demand slowdown\u003c/a\u003e amid economic uncertainties and production issues have not gone away.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTesla Price Action:\u003c/strong\u003e In premarket trading on Monday, Tesla stock rose 0.61% to $276.11, according to \u003ca href=\"https://benzinga.grsm.io/lxquj26b2sag\"\u003eBenzinga Pro data.\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eCheck out more of Benzinga\u0026#8217;s Future Of Mobility coverage by\u0026nbsp;\u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://www.benzinga.com/topic/mobility\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003e\u003cem\u003efollowing this link\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eRead Next: \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/analyst-ratings/analyst-color/23/07/33159651/beyond-cybertruck-analyst-advises-tesla-to-take-notes-from-rivians-ev-pickup-strate\"\u003eBeyond Cybertruck: Analyst Advises Tesla To Take Notes from Rivian\u0026#8217;s EV Pickup Strategy To Blow Past Wall Street Estimates\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["TSLA"],"source":"benzinga"}]

The pattern is bullish for the short term, but can be bearish down the road.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eFor bullish traders, the \u0026quot;trend is your friend\u0026quot; (until it\u0026#39;s not) and the stock is likely to continue upwards. Aggressive traders may decide to buy the stock at the lower trend line and exit the trade at the upper trend line.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eBearish traders will want to watch for a downward break from the lower ascending trend line, on high volume, for an entry. When a stock breaks down from a rising channel, it\u0026#39;s a powerful reversal signal and indicates a downturn is likely in the cards.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eAhead of the Federal Reserve\u0026rsquo;s decision on interest rates, volatility in the stock market may increase and traders may want to keep their heads square on their shoulders.\u0026nbsp;Traders wishing to trade the volatility in the stock market can use\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.miaxglobal.com/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eMIAX\u0026rsquo;s SPIKES Volatility products\u003c/a\u003e. The products, which are traded on\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eSPIKES Volatility Index \u003c/strong\u003e(XMIO: SPIKE), track expected volatility in the SPDR S\u0026amp;P 500 over the next 30 days.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eWant direct analysis? Find me in the BZ Pro lounge! \u003ca href=\"https://benzinga.grsm.io/1ih7p9hphj9p\"\u003eClick here for a free trial\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eThe Apple Chart:\u003c/strong\u003e On Friday, Apple attempted to break up again from the rising channel pattern but rejected the upper trend line and closed under Thursday\u0026rsquo;s high-of-day. The stock has broke up from the pattern previously but failed to gain momentum to the upside, which has stalled a bigger cycle on a few occasions.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cul\u003e\r\n\t\u003cli\u003eApple has been trading in a fairly consistent uptrend since March 2, making a series of higher highs and higher lows. The stock\u0026rsquo;s most recent higher high was formed on June 30 at $194.48 and the most recent higher low may have printed at the $189.20 mark on Thursday.\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eOn Friday, Apple temporarily broke up broke an inside bar pattern but lacked momentum, which caused the stock to form a shooting star candlestick. If the candlestick plays out, Apple could trade lower Monday, to test the lower ascending trend line of the channel.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cul\u003e\r\n\t\u003cli\u003eBulls want to see Apple break up from the channel on higher-than-average volume and then for bullish momentum to come in and drive the stock to a new all-time high. Bearish traders want to see Apple eventually break down from that pattern on high volume, which could suggest a longer-term downturn.\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\t\u003cli\u003eApple has resistance above at $194.49 and the psychologically important $200 level and support below at $189.61 and $182.94.\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cimg alt=\"screenshot_2562.png\" src=\"https://www.benzinga.com/files/u278075/screenshot_2562.png\" style=\"height:427px; width:760px\" /\u003e\u003cem\u003eRead Next:\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/large-cap/23/07/33153102/benzinga-bulls-and-bears-apple-rivian-disney-and-elon-musk-will-eat-a-mcdonalds-happy-meal-on-live\"\u003eApple, Rivian, Disney, And Elon Musk Will Eat A McDonalds Happy Meal On Live TV If...\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003ePhoto via Shutterstock.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n","symbols":["AAPL"],"source":"benzinga"}]

is set to air on Alibaba Group Holding Limited\u0026#39;s (NYSE: BABA) Youku platform and focuses on the semiconductor leadership and self-sufficiency theme, an essential priority for the Chinese government. ","author":"Anusuya Lahiri","created_at":"2023-07-10T12:08:31Z","updated_at":"2023-07-10T12:08:32Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/government/23/07/33159989/alibabas-youku-debuts-my-chinese-chip-journey-chinas-advanced-chip-development-tiding-past-us-embarg","content":"\u003cp\u003eThe series \u0026quot;My Chinese Chip\u0026quot; is set to air on\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eAlibaba Group Holding Limited\u0026#39;s\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;(NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/BABA#NYSE\"\u003eBABA\u003c/a\u003e) Youku platform and focuses on the semiconductor leadership and self-sufficiency theme, an essential priority for the Chinese government.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe storyline revolves around a state-supported startup that successfully develops lasers for deep ultraviolet lithography machines.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe show highlights the challenges the domestic company faces in overcoming trade sanctions and technological restrictions that prevent the acquisition of advanced chipmaking technology from multinational suppliers, Bloomberg\u0026nbsp;\u003ca class=\"editor-rtfLink\" href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2023-07-10/china-s-struggle-to-make-advanced-chips-dramatized-in-new-series?srnd=technology-vp\u0026amp;sref=TBDibEcD\" style=\"color:#4a6ee0; background:transparent; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ereports\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eOne of the significant obstacles depicted in the series is the trade war between the U.S. and China, which has led to restrictions on the sale of advanced chipmaking equipment, particularly extreme ultraviolet lithography systems, provided by\u0026nbsp;\u003cstrong\u003eASML Holding NV\u003c/strong\u003e\u0026nbsp;(NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/ASML#NYSE\"\u003eASML\u003c/a\u003e).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eASML, a leading supplier of lithography systems, has been unable to sell its most advanced machines to China since the Trump administration pressured the Dutch government to deny a license for their export.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eEarlier this year, the agreement between the Netherlands and the U.S. further limited ASML\u0026#39;s sales, affecting its deep ultraviolet (DUV) systems, which are crucial for manufacturing a wide range of chips used in various electronic devices.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe restrictions on advanced chipmaking equipment have underscored China\u0026#39;s need to enhance its self-sufficiency and develop domestic capabilities to meet its semiconductor demands, thereby reducing its dependence on foreign suppliers.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;My Chinese Chip\u0026quot; the social network inaccessible to millions of users over the weekend at the end of June.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eMeta made the most of this, pushing up the launch of Threads by a day – it was initially scheduled to launch on July 6th at 10 a.m. ET, but it was instead launched on July 5th at 7 p.m. ET.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWhile Threads has become the fastest app to 100 The top-tier \u003cstrong\u003eiPhone 15 Pro Max\u003c/strong\u003e will burn a bigger hole in your pocket as it's planning to add a new periscopic lens to the camera debuting in its next flagship smartphone.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat Happened:\u003c/strong\u003e Apple is said to launch the iPhone 15 Pro Max at a slightly higher base price when compared to its predecessor, according to Haitong International Securities' tech analyst Jeff Pu.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eSee Also: \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/07/33160048/threads-app-hits-100m-users-in-just-five-days-becomes-the-fastest-growing-app-in-history\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eMeta\u0026#8217;s Threads Hits 100M Users In Just 5 Days, Becomes Fastest Growing App In History\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003ePu underlined that the iPhone 15 Pro Max will be priced higher than the iPhone 14 Pro Max, which starts at $1,099. This will be the first price hike for Apple's top-end ‘Pro Max' branded iPhone since it was first introduced in 2018 – the base variant of the iPhone XS Max was also launched at $1,099.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eApple has since then retained the starting price of the ‘Pro Max' iPhone at $1,099, but this year could be different. While Pu does not mention the new starting price, some rumors suggest that Apple could hike the price by $200. This would mean that the iPhone 15 Pro Max could start at $1,299.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch3 class=\"wp-block-heading\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eiPhone 15 Pro Max Features: What To Expect?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe headline addition to the iPhone 15 Pro Max could be a new periscope lens. The upcoming iPhone flagship is expected to feature a triple camera setup on the back with a the new lens system.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eUsing a periscope lens system would allow Apple to achieve superior lossless zoom at levels like 5x or higher when compared to a traditional system.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe iPhone 15 series is expected to feature a USB Type-C port, Dynamic Island, and an improved modem from Qualcomm, among other things.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eCheck out more of Benzinga\u0026#8217;s Consumer Tech coverage by \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/topic/consumer-tech\"\u003e\u003cem\u003efollowing this link\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eRead Next: \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/07/33148075/macbook-with-a-foldable-display-apple-is-reportedly-planning-one\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eMacBook With A Foldable Display? Apple Is Reportedly Planning One\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["AAPL"],"source":"benzinga"}]
[{"T":"n","id":33166819,"headline":"\u0026#39;Apple Supplier Foxconn Pulls Out Of $19.5B India Chip Project\u0026#39; - CNBC","summary":"https://www.cnbc.com/2023/07/10/apple-supplier-foxconn-pulls-out-of-19point5-billion-india-chip-project.html#:~:text=Lead%20Apple%20supplier%20and%20global,the%20Indian%20state%20of%20Gujarat.\n\n \n\n\n\tFoxconn is","author":"Happy Mohamed","created_at":"2023-07-10T13:36:02Z","updated_at":"2023-07-10T13:36:03Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/07/33166819/apple-supplier-foxconn-pulls-out-of-19-5b-india-chip-project-cnbc","content":"\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2023/07/10/apple-supplier-foxconn-pulls-out-of-19point5-billion-india-chip-project.html#:~:text=Lead%20Apple%20supplier%20and%20global,the%20Indian%20state%20of%20Gujarat\" title=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2023/07/10/apple-supplier-foxconn-pulls-out-of-19point5-billion-india-chip-project.html#:~:text=Lead%20Apple%20supplier%20and%20global,the%20Indian%20state%20of%20Gujarat\"\u003ehttps://www.cnbc.com/2023/07/10/apple-supplier-foxconn-pulls-out-of-19point5-billion-india-chip-project.html#:~:text=Lead%20Apple%20supplier%20and%20global,the%20Indian%20state%20of%20Gujarat\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cul\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eFoxconn is pulling out of a $20 billion joint venture in India that would have produced semiconductor and display components.\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eThe top Apple supplier didn\u0026rsquo;t provide a reason for the breakup, but the $19.5 billion project would have been one of its largest moves outside China.\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eApple has emphasized supply chain de-risking to suppliers, even as executives walk a fine line in public commentary on the Communist regime.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eLead\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/quotes/AAPL/\"\u003eApple\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;supplier and global manufacturing powerhouse\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/quotes/2354-TW/\"\u003eFoxconn\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;has pulled out of a $19.5 billion joint venture project with an Indian conglomerate that would have brought semiconductor and display manufacturing to the Indian state of Gujarat.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026ldquo;Foxconn has determined it will not move forward on the joint venture with Vedanta,\u0026rdquo; the Taiwan company told\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/technology/foxconn-pulls-out-india-chip-jv-with-vedanta-2023-07-10/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eReuters\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;in a statement. The move is a significant blow to Indian prime minister Narendra Modi\u0026rsquo;s ambitions to transform the country into a global, high-tech manufacturing powerhouse.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eAmerican companies,\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2023/04/20/apple-years-away-from-diversifying-from-china-despite-india-expansion.html\"\u003eApple among them\u003c/a\u003e, have pushed their suppliers to\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2023/04/20/apple-years-away-from-diversifying-from-china-despite-india-expansion.html\"\u003ediversify\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;their supply chains beyond mainland China, as geopolitical and economic tensions mount. Foxconn has broken ground on multiple factory sites across India, although the $20 billion joint venture with Vedanta would have been one of the largest.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe breakup comes as U.S. and Chinese leaders and\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2023/03/27/apple-ceo-tim-cook-meets-with-china-commerce-minister-on-supply-chain.html\"\u003ebusiness executives\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;work through an uneasy and oftentimes\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2023/05/24/microsoft-warns-that-china-hackers-attacked-us-infrastructure.html\"\u003etreacherous path\u003c/a\u003e, with both threading the needle between acknowledging their\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2023/07/10/yellens-latest-trip-helps-set-a-new-normal-for-us-china-ties.html\"\u003ecodependence\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;and\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2023/06/13/china-cyberattacks-are-a-defining-threat-top-us-cyber-official.html\"\u003eharshly rebuking\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;their counterparts.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe U.S. government and major technology firms have started to openly identify Chinese technological advancements and manufacturing dominance as a key threat to national security. Some U.S. corporations, long the victim of Chinese state-permitted industrial espionage, are reassessing Chinese operations as part of so-called \u0026ldquo;de-risking\u0026rdquo; efforts.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eFoxconn continues to build\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2023/03/16/foxconn-wins-apple-airpod-order-plans-200-million-factory-in-india.html\"\u003eother factories\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;across India, including\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2023/05/15/apple-supplier-foxconn-breaks-ground-on-500-million-india-factory.html\"\u003eone in Telangana\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;and\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2023/03/03/iphone-supplier-to-build-factory-in-india-a-further-pivot-from-china-report.html\"\u003eone in Bengaluru\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e","symbols":["AAPL","INDA"],"source":"benzinga"}]
[{"T":"n","id":33166821,"headline":"CPI Preview: Will Weak Inflation Data Provide Further Relief To Markets?","summary":" ","author":"Piero Cingari","created_at":"2023-07-10T13:36:20Z","updated_at":"2023-07-10T13:36:20Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/economics/macro-economic-events/23/07/33166821/cpi-preview-will-weak-inflation-data-provide-further-relief-to-markets","content":"\u003cp\u003eThe highly anticipated U.S. consumer price index (CPI) inflation report for June, set to be released on Wednesday, takes the spotlight as the most significant \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/07/33155876/bofas-inflation-prediction-chinas-default-to-mccarthys-fresh-challenge-economic-tensions-this-week\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003eeconomic event of the week.\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eTraders are now anxiously awaiting what is likely to be the most critical data reading for the Fed\u0026#8217;s policy path ahead.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe CPI report comes on the heels of conflicting economic data for the job market, including outstanding ADP private sector employment growth of 497,000; lower-than-expected \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/economics/macro-economic-events/23/07/33146887/june-nonfarm-payrolls-miss-estimates-unemployment-drops-but-wages-rise-investors-\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003enonfarm payrolls\u003c/a\u003e (209,000 versus 225,000); and stronger wage growth.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWhile a rate hike in July is already widely expected, the market remains uncertain about the possibility of two rate hikes this year. Currently, the chances of another rate rise in September or November are valued at 22% and 34%, respectively.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\"\u003eUS June CPI Inflation: Forecasts\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cul\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHeadline CPI at 3.1% year-on-year (YoY):\u003c/strong\u003e Economists anticipate the annual U.S. headline inflation rate to further ease in June, dropping from 4% to 3.1%. This would mark the 12th consecutive month of declines and the lowest reading since March 2021. On a monthly basis, the headline CPI is expected to show a faster pace of growth at 0.3%, compared to the 0.1% recorded in May.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cul\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCore CPI at 5% YoY: \u003c/strong\u003eAnalysts project a slowdown in the annual U.S. core inflation rate for June, with a decline from 5.3% to 5%. If realized, this would be the lowest level since November 2021. On a monthly basis, the core CPI is expected to show a slight deceleration in the rate of increase, going from 0.4% to 0.3%.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\"\u003eChart: Will the US CPI Continue to Fall?\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cfigure class=\"wp-block-image size-large\"\u003e\u003cimg decoding=\"async\" loading=\"lazy\" width=\"1024\" height=\"720\" src=\"https://s3.amazonaws.com/editorial.benzinga.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/10082319/USIRYY_2023-07-10_14-22-46_6a974-1024x720.png\" alt=\"\" class=\"wp-image-65082\" srcset=\"https://s3.amazonaws.com/editorial.benzinga.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/10082319/USIRYY_2023-07-10_14-22-46_6a974-1024x720.png 1024w,https://s3.amazonaws.com/editorial.benzinga.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/10082319/USIRYY_2023-07-10_14-22-46_6a974-300x211.png 300w,https://s3.amazonaws.com/editorial.benzinga.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/10082319/USIRYY_2023-07-10_14-22-46_6a974-768x540.png 768w,https://s3.amazonaws.com/editorial.benzinga.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/10082319/USIRYY_2023-07-10_14-22-46_6a974-1536x1080.png 1536w,https://s3.amazonaws.com/editorial.benzinga.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/10082319/USIRYY_2023-07-10_14-22-46_6a974.png 1750w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px\" /\u003e\u003c/figure\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat Was the Market Reaction to Previous CPI Readings?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe headline CPI came in below market expectations for the last three inflation reports.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cul\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eOn April 12, 2023, the annual inflation rate for March came in at 5%, below than the expected 5.2%. The core CPI was 5.6% YoY, as predicted. On that day, the \u003cstrong\u003eSPDR S\u0026amp;P 500 ETF Trust\u003c/strong\u003e (NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/SPY#NYSE\"\u003eSPY\u003c/a\u003e) lost 0.4%. \u003cstrong\u003eNovo Nordisk A/S\u003c/strong\u003e (NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/NVO#NYSE\"\u003eNVO\u003c/a\u003e) was the best-performing stock among large caps, up 3.3%, while \u003cstrong\u003eJD.com, Inc.\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/JD#NASDAQ\"\u003eJD\u003c/a\u003e) fell 7.7%. Tech stocks performed poorly, with the \u003cstrong\u003eQQQ Invesco Trust\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/QQQ#NASDAQ\"\u003eQQQ\u003c/a\u003e) down 0.9% and \u003cstrong\u003eTesla Inc.\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/TSLA#NASDAQ\"\u003eTSLA\u003c/a\u003e) leading losses, down 3.4%, according to \u003ca href=\"https://pro.benzinga.com/dashboard\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003eBenzinga Pro data. \u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cli\u003eOn May 10, the annual inflation rate for April edged down to 4.9%, below than the predicted 5%. The core CPI also ticked down 5.5% YoY, as expected. Tech stocks rallied, with the \u003cstrong\u003eNasdaq 100 Index\u003c/strong\u003e up 1.1%, while the broader \u003cstrong\u003eS\u0026amp;P 500 Index\u003c/strong\u003e was 0.5% higher. \u003cstrong\u003eSnowflake Inc.\u003c/strong\u003e (NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/SNOW#NYSE\"\u003eSNOW\u003c/a\u003e) emerged as the best performer for the session, up 5%, followed by \u003cstrong\u003eAlphabet Inc.\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/GOOG#NASDAQ\"\u003eGOOG\u003c/a\u003e) (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/GOOGL#NASDAQ\"\u003eGOOGL\u003c/a\u003e) up 4.1%. \u003cstrong\u003eAirbnb Inc.\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/ABNB#NASDAQ\"\u003eABNB\u003c/a\u003e) was the worst performer, down 11%. \u003cbr\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cli\u003eOn June 13, the annual inflation rate for May plunged to 4%, slightly below market expectations of 4.1. The core CPI also ticked down 5.5% YoY, as expected. Core CPI ticked down to 5.3% as expected. \u003cstrong\u003eFreeport-McMoran, Inc. \u003c/strong\u003e(NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/FCX#NYSE\"\u003eFCX\u003c/a\u003e) was the top performer, up 5.3%, followed by \u003cstrong\u003eNvidia Corp. \u003c/strong\u003e(NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/NVDA#NASDAQ\"\u003eNVDA\u003c/a\u003e) up 3.9%. \u003cstrong\u003ePetroleo Brasileiro S.A. \u0026#8211; Petrobras\u003c/strong\u003e (NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/PBR#NYSE\"\u003ePBR\u003c/a\u003e) was the laggard, down 5.1%. The core CPI was 5.6% YoY, as predicted. On that day, the \u003cstrong\u003eSPDR S\u0026amp;P 500 ETF Trust\u003c/strong\u003e (NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/SPY#NYSE\"\u003eSPY\u003c/a\u003e) lost 0.4%. \u003cstrong\u003eNovo Nordisk A/S\u003c/strong\u003e (NYSE:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/NVO#NYSE\"\u003eNVO\u003c/a\u003e) was the best-performing stock among large caps, up 3.3%, while \u003cstrong\u003eJD.com, Inc.\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/JD#NASDAQ\"\u003eJD\u003c/a\u003e) fell 7.7%. Tech stocks performed poorly, with the \u003cstrong\u003eQQQ Invesco Trust\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/QQQ#NASDAQ\"\u003eQQQ\u003c/a\u003e) down 0.9% and \u003cstrong\u003eTesla Inc.\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/TSLA#NASDAQ\"\u003eTSLA\u003c/a\u003e) leading losses, down 3.4%, according to \u003ca href=\"https://pro.benzinga.com/dashboard\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003eBenzinga Pro data. \u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cli\u003eOn May 10, the annual inflation rate for April edged down to 4.9%, below than the predicted 5%. [{"T":"n","id":33167062,"headline":"Former Microsoft Executive Joins Opportunity International As Chief Technology Officer","summary":"Greg Nelson Will Lead Development of Technological Innovations to Increase Financial Inclusion and Business Development Efforts in Developing Countries\n\nCHICAGO, July 10, 2023 /PRNewswire/ -- Opportunity","author":"Happy Mohamed","created_at":"2023-07-10T13:49:07Z","updated_at":"2023-07-10T13:49:07Z","url":"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/07/33167062/former-microsoft-executive-joins-opportunity-international-as-chief-technology-officer","content":"\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eGreg Nelson Will Lead Development of Technological Innovations to Increase Financial Inclusion and Business Development Efforts in Developing Countries\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eCHICAGO,\u0026nbsp;July 10, 2023\u0026nbsp;/PRNewswire/ -- Opportunity International announced today that\u0026nbsp;Greg Nelson\u0026nbsp;has joined the organization as its next Chief Technology Officer.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;Greg\u0026#39;s addition to our ranks at Opportunity marks an important next step in our strategy to end extreme poverty,\u0026quot; said\u0026nbsp;Atul Tandon, Opportunity\u0026#39;s CEO. \u0026quot;The vast majority of people living on less than\u0026nbsp;$2.15\u0026nbsp;a day have subsistence level livelihoods with little to no access to resources, skills and even the time to help build sustainable incomes. Greg\u0026#39;s expertise and leadership will build technology solutions that can break down these barriers and provide our clients with what they need to build incomes and beat back poverty.\u0026quot;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003ePrior to joining Opportunity, Greg spent 26 years at Microsoft and was based in\u0026nbsp;Seattle,\u0026nbsp;London\u0026nbsp;and\u0026nbsp;Paris. His final role was Vice President of Partner Ecosystem for Business Applications, helping Microsoft\u0026#39;s developer community use tools and platforms to grow their businesses. His other roles at the company spanned engineering, partner and business development, marketing and sales.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eGreg will oversee Opportunity\u0026#39;s Digital Innovation Group (DIG) which combines Opportunity\u0026#39;s Digital Financial Services team and Product Innovation team to build solutions that enable Opportunity clients to improve their livelihoods and break the cycle of generational poverty.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;I\u0026#39;ve been a fan of Opportunity\u0026#39;s work since the mid-1990s, and have really enjoyed my service as a board member over the past two years,\u0026quot; said Nelson. \u0026quot;Now I am excited to work more closely alongside some of the most effective experts in international development, finding ways to bring technology-based solutions to help our clients build their futures.\u0026quot;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eGreg has served on Opportunity\u0026#39;s board of directors as an active member of the Stewardship \u0026amp; Impact Committee, where he has led an envisioning process using human-centered design to deeply understand the needs and motivations of Opportunity\u0026#39;s clients to inform technology decisions and program investment areas. He holds an MBA from\u0026nbsp;Harvard, as well as degrees from the University of\u0026nbsp;Cape Town\u0026nbsp;and\u0026nbsp;Seattle Pacific University.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAbout Opportunity International\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eOpportunity International is a global non-profit that has been empowering people to work their way out of poverty for 52 years. Opportunity provides 18.7 million people with innovative financial resources, training, and support to grow their small businesses and send their children to school. Opportunity International released more than\u0026nbsp;$2.6 billion\u0026nbsp;in capital across 30 countries in 2022.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe organization\u0026#39;s Digital Financial Services program focuses on human-centered design processes to best serve individuals experiencing extreme poverty. In 2022, the DFS program supported over 3.2 million digital transactions to our clients.\u003c/p\u003e","symbols":["MSFT"],"source":"benzinga"}]
