several of the companies that are top holdings in mutual funds he owns.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eA recent tweet criticized Amazon, one of the larger holdings in several of the mutual funds Sanders has\u0026nbsp;as investments.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026ldquo;On #PrimeDay, let\u0026rsquo;s not forget: Amazon is the third wealthiest company in America owned by the second wealthiest man in America. It should be the safest place to work, not one of the most dangerous,\u0026rdquo; Sanders \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/SenSanders/status/1679147471895764992\"\u003etweeted\u003c/a\u003e, encouraging workers to share their stories.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eAnother \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/SenSanders/status/1601001424107601920\"\u003etweet \u003c/a\u003etook on Microsoft over its attempted merger with \u003cstrong\u003eActivision Blizzard\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/ATVI#NASDAQ\"\u003eATVI\u003c/a\u003e), which has faced regulatory hurdles.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026ldquo;I applaud the FTC for moving to block this merger. In sector after sector, a handful of giant corporations control what is produced and how much Americans pay for their products. We must stop this dangerous concentration of ownership. This is a step in the right direction.\u0026rdquo;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eSanders also \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/SenSanders/status/1551656099098624000\"\u003ecriticized \u003c/a\u003ethe CHIPS Act, which was seen to benefit semiconductor stocks such as\u0026nbsp;Nvidia and caused problems for \u003cstrong\u003eNancy Pelosi,\u003c/strong\u003e who \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/general/politics/23/05/32595899/nancy-pelosi-sold-nvidia-early-heres-how-much-she-missed-in-profits\"\u003eowned a position\u003c/a\u003e and supported the bill.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026ldquo;I\u0026rsquo;ll be on the floor of the Senate to once again talk about legislation that hands a $76 billion blank check to the microchip industry. Yes. We need to rebuild the microchip industry, but not in a way that just benefits profitable corporations.\u0026rdquo;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eTesla appears in several of the mutual funds, which comes as the senator had publicly\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/government/21/11/24082067/elon-musk-insults-bernie-sanders-on-twitter-the-dis-you-need-to-know-about\"\u003ecriticized company\u003c/a\u003e CEO\u003cstrong\u003e Elon Musk\u003c/strong\u003e several times.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSanders argued earlier this year that all income over $999 million should be confiscated.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026ldquo;I think people can make it on $999 million. I think that they can survive just fine,\u0026rdquo; Sanders told Chris Wallace during an appearance on \u0026ldquo;Who\u0026rsquo;s Talking to Chris Wallace?\u0026rdquo;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eSanders introduced legislation in 2021 and 2023 that would levy additional taxes on the trading of stocks.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe \u003cstrong\u003eTax on Wall Street Speculation Act of 2023\u003c/strong\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://lee.house.gov/news/press-releases/congresswoman-barbara-lee-and-senator-bernie-sanders-introduce-tax-on-wall-street-speculation-act-of-2023\"\u003ewould \u003c/a\u003eseek to have \u0026ldquo;the wealthy pay their fair share to the American people.\u0026rdquo;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026ldquo;Since the 2008 recession, 45% of all new income has gone to the top one percent who disproportionately hold their wealth in stocks, bonds, and derivatives on Wall Street,\u0026rdquo; a press release read.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe act would put a transaction tax of 0.5% on the trading of stocks, 0.1% tax on bonds and 0.005% on derivatives. Estimates say the act would raise $220 billion per year, or more than\u0026nbsp;$2 trillion in 10 years.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026ldquo;Let us never forget: Back in 2008, middle-class taxpayers bailed out Wall Street speculators whose greed, recklessness and illegal behavior caused millions of Americans to lose their jobs, homes, life savings, and ability to send their kids to college,\u0026rdquo; Sanders said.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eSanders noted that\u0026nbsp;adding the tax could help rebuild the middle class.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eA member of Congress since 1991, serving the state of Vermont in the House and Senate, Sanders has been very outspoken over large company profits and also against stock traders.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eFinancial disclosures have shown that Sanders doesn\u0026rsquo;t have a conflict of interest in buying and selling stocks while in Congress. Among them are \u003cstrong\u003eIgor Babuschkin\u003c/strong\u003e, \u003cstrong\u003eManuel Kroiss\u003c/strong\u003e, \u003cstrong\u003eYuhuai Wu\u003c/strong\u003e, \u003cstrong\u003eChristian Szegedy\u003c/strong\u003e, \u003cstrong\u003eJimmy Ba\u003c/strong\u003e, \u003cstrong\u003eToby Pohlen\u003c/strong\u003e, \u003cstrong\u003eRoss Nordeen\u003c/strong\u003e, \u003cstrong\u003eKyle Kosic\u003c/strong\u003e, \u003cstrong\u003eGreg Yang\u003c/strong\u003e, \u003cstrong\u003eGuodong Zhang\u003c/strong\u003e, and \u003cstrong\u003eZihang Dai\u003c/strong\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eDan Hendrycks\u003c/strong\u003e, current director of the Center for AI Safety, will serve in an advisory role.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eDespite xAI being a separate entity, it will closely cooperate with \u003cstrong\u003eX Corp\u003c/strong\u003e, Tesla, and other companies, according to the website.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe company also launched an official Twitter account in May, \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/xai\"\u003e@xai\u003c/a\u003e, with 82,500 followers at the time of writing.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eRead also: \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/06/32956523/tesla-quietly-launches-new-tesla-ai-twitter-account-heres-its-first-thread\"\u003eTesla Quietly Launches New Tesla AI Twitter Account: Here\u0026rsquo;s Its First Thread\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe choice of the name xAI refers to one of Musk\u0026rsquo;s earliest endeavors, \u003cstrong\u003eX.com\u003c/strong\u003e. The website was one of the pioneering online banking sites founded in December 1999. It eventually merged with \u003cstrong\u003ePayPal Holdings Inc\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/PYPL#NASDAQ\"\u003ePYPL\u003c/a\u003e) \u0026mdash; a company Musk also co-founded \u0026mdash; in March 2000 and later spun off into an independent entity.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eMusk regained ownership of the domain name X.com from PayPal in 2017.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhy It\u0026rsquo;s Important:\u003c/strong\u003e The new venture from Musk isn\u0026rsquo;t surprising for those who have been closely following his trajectory.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eIn April, he hinted at his AI ambitions in an interview with former Fox News host \u003cstrong\u003eTucker Carlson\u003c/strong\u003e. Musk spoke about creating a \u0026ldquo;Truth GPT,\u0026rdquo; or a maximum truth-seeking AI, that attempts to comprehend the nature of the universe.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eMusk has also expressed his concern about the potential dangers of AI, \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/04/31845988/elon-musk-is-worried-about-ai-posing-a-threat-to-humanity-but-prepares-to-launch-openai-rival\"\u003estressing the need for safety standards and an understanding of AI\u0026rsquo;s potential\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eWith the creation of xAI, Musk is set to compete against \u003cstrong\u003eOpenAI\u003c/strong\u003e, a company he left in 2018.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe xAi website announced a Twitter Spaces chat on Friday, July 14.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cdiv class=\"wp-block-embed__wrapper\"\u003e\r\n\u003cblockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\"\u003e\r\n\u003cp\u003eAnnouncing formation of \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/xai?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\"\u003e@xAI\u003c/a\u003e to understand reality\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u0026mdash; Elon Musk (@elonmusk) \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1679164661869182976?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\"\u003eJuly 12, 2023\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\r\n\u003cem\u003ePhoto: Shutterstock\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/blockquote\u003e\r\n\u003cscript async src=\"https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"\u003e\u003c/script\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\r\n","symbols":["PYPL","TSLA"],"source":"benzinga"}]

Tesla did a limited run of surfboards in 2018 and briefly\u0026nbsp;listed\u0026nbsp;limited-edition red satin shorts in 2020, which many assumed to be a shot at short sellers of Tesla stock.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eTesla also sold its own tequila\u0026nbsp;in a bottle shaped like a lightning bolt and then\u0026nbsp;famously launched the Cyberwhistle in 2021 and listed the product for sale on the site in \u003cstrong\u003eDogecoin\u003c/strong\u003e (CRYPTO: \u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/quote/doge/usd\"\u003eDOGE\u003c/a\u003e) during the last crypto bull run.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eMore recently, SpaceX \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/04/31836664/elon-musk-channels-johnny-cash-spacex-creates-a-burning-thing-to-sear-your-steak-this-summer\"\u003ereleased a Starship Torch\u003c/a\u003e. It\u0026#39;s still available for pre-order, listed at $175\u0026nbsp;on the\u003ca href=\"https://shop.spacex.com/collections/featured-products/products/starship-torch\"\u003e SpaceX site\u003c/a\u003e. But maybe the most popular item ever released by a Musk-run company was another flame-related product called\u0026nbsp;\u0026quot;Not-A-Flamethrower.\u0026quot;\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe Boring Company-branded flamethrower sold out of 20,000 units for $500 each pretty quickly. They demand high premiums on\u003cstrong\u003e\u0026nbsp;EBay Inc\u003c/strong\u003e (NASDAQ:\u003ca class=\"ticker\" href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/stock/EBAY#NASDAQ\"\u003eEBAY\u003c/a\u003e) to this day. Coming soon from @boringcompany, the same people that sold you a Flamethrower,\u0026quot;\u0026nbsp;Musk\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1574896997416374272?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1574897489005510656%7Ctwgr%5E4441bfcf24fa30973d3c406e11fb4a178f59b521%7Ctwcon%5Es2_\u0026amp;ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.teslarati.com%2Felon-musk-mens-cologne%2F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003etweeted\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;last September.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe product \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/22/09/29058252/new-cologne-coming-from-elon-musk-heres-the-smell-he-wants\"\u003ewent on sale\u003c/a\u003e for $100 on Oct.\u0026nbsp;11, 2022 and\u0026nbsp;sold out within 48 hours. If you were one of the 30,000 to order a bottle, you may have finally received your burning delivery this week.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eThe product took longer than expected to hit customer doorsteps. In an email update from March, The Boring Company said the product took extra time to develop because the\u0026nbsp;team had to wait for their hair to grow back to resume testing. The \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/05/32523134/ready-to-smell-the-musk-boring-companys-burnt-hair-perfume-to-start-shipping-next-month\"\u003estring of emails\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;sent to customers over the last nine months was filled with puns and playful jokes.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;Anybody who truly nose about Burnt Hair will tell you that this fancy bottle and repugnant perfume is very close to being scent to you,\u0026quot; the company said in another update.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eA card that was packaged with the bottle of perfume says, \u0026quot;Hey there, smokeshow. Congratulations on your purchase of Burnt Hair! It\u0026#39;s going to be lit.\u0026quot;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003e\u0026quot;But not (lit)erally\u0026nbsp;... flip over this card for some boring legal language about flammability.\u0026quot;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eNow that customers have the long-awaited bottles in hand, they are starting to pop up on eBay and\u0026nbsp;are selling between $130 and $200 per bottle on average, with some going for as high as $300.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eYou could at least expect to get $150 for the product, which represents a 50% return in just nine months \u0026mdash; a \u003ca href=\"https://www.benzinga.com/news/23/07/33147982/warren-buffetts-crucial-investment-lessons-to-alex-rodriguez-after-signing-record-mlb-deal\"\u003egreat investment\u003c/a\u003e by most measures. In fact, the bottles have appreciated more than Tesla\u0026nbsp;stock\u0026nbsp;over that time.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\r\n\u003cp\u003eIf you bought a share of Tesla on Oct. 11 instead of the perfume, it would have cost you between $215 and $225\u0026nbsp;that day.
